Prime Minister Meles said, "War is not a Soccer Game!"
Recently, it is often heard that the main stick of criticism rested upon Prime Minister Meles during the TPLF/EPRDF evaluation session.
Meanwhile, it's widely heard that Prime Minister's private guards were changed by others, direct telephone lines to the Prime Minister were disconnected in the palace, and one can discuss about anything related to the present condition with the office of Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
It's in the midst of this situation that Ato Meles gave an interview to voice of America.
During the interview there was a different position about Eritrean question among the TPLF leaders.
Due to the special favor the moderate and the conservatives gave to Eritrean government there was a great difference, it was said.
Responding to whether there was a significant difference between bodies of TPIF EPRDF with regards to the special relationship (special favor) Eritrean government receives he denied that there has been no difference in both TPLF as well as EPRDF,  and will never be, and more or less ruled out the issue of evaluation.
Asked about his relationship with president Isayas Afeworkihe responded "...even though there were times when I observe unlikable behavior ... I have never thought he would take a decision merely made out of a game of chance with issues that affect the chances and benefit of people.
Actually, signs of obstinacy can't be said to have come yesterday.
They were there long ago."
And with regards to opposition parties, he answered, "At the time when measures are taken against the sovereignty of Ethiopia, her peoples' rights and benefits, every one cooperatively works in defense, and this was a common practice and it should be.
Our political difference cannot be resolved in a day's time.
One of the characteristics of democracy is the interplay of various kinds of positions."
And with regards to the present situation, he stated that war is not a soccer game, "we are not going to take part in such a game as ‘this one scored a goal before, so you, too, should score' kind-of-game."
we won't participate in such a game.
He said.
When he responded to the last question, what lesson did your government learn from this situation?
"He said" although it is known that there's a concealed arrogance and conceit in Eritrea, never have we expected that he would gamble on Eritrean people.
I never expected this arrogance and conceit would reach as far as this level.
What I have learnt now is that the scope of arrogance and conceit of Eritrean leadership could be revealed in terms of gambling with people's benefit.This we saw.
From now on, it is something we will always remember that there are not only conceited individuals behind us, but also individuals who gamble on people's benefit," concluded his speech.

A Top Diplomat Deserte.
A top diplomat at the Ethiopian Embassy in Rome, Dr. Bekele, deserted.
Dr. Bekele's desertion was heard yesterday on the voice of EPRP.
The desertion of the diplomat didn't leave good feeling around the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, close sources indicated.
The doctor was head of the economic cooperation.
Italy gives a lot of aid to Ethiopia, and the doctor's desertion with many secrets may or may not put this aid in danger, it's not known.
Nonetheless, there are officials in the ministry of Foreign Affairs who are very much concerned about it, close sources disclosed to us.
In an interview he gave to Finote Democracy, EPRP's voice, he said, "In fact, I have served for 8 years; I couldn't simply accept what TPLF is doing especially the administrative injustice done on Southern people, and I have expressed my opposition may times in diplomatic meeting and in any other occasions.
I have never declined from stating that the constitution has been violated.
I expressed that some situations should be improved.
Regarding this, some EPRDF spies in the embassy reported to the ministry of Foreign Affairs; as a result, some punishments and threatening befell him..
Finally, I was ordered to withdraw my work and report by going to my country.
The situation as it is now would not only be risky for my security, but also I'm worried that I may not be able to contribute my share in the ongoing peaceful struggle for democracy and justified administration.
Here in a foreign land, I could, without any worry, contribute my share in the struggle to bring abut a better regime and to enable it come soon but now I have been obliged to distance my self from the diplomatic work I very much like.
Mr. Meles' government couldn't keep the promise it made to Ethiopian people even after 10 years.
The peace and stability, democracy and development that were talked over by EPRDF for the last 10 years have only remained to be a clamor of words.
The constitution which EPRDF gave to the people by itself has created a problem to it.       .
The individual and people's rights that are written in the constitution have become futile..
As the 1995 constitution has many articles that give precedence for the benefit of the ruling groups, I think struggling or its correct interpretation is the right strategy for struggle and the direction for struggle.
As I am a national from Southern people, I would be willing to contribute my share in the struggle in this direction".
He said.

From Addis Admas January 12, 2002  .
Statement Given From King Haileselassie Memorial Organizatio.
King Haileselassie Memorial Organization gave a press statement on February 24, 1998..
Following is the full text of the statement.
Some individuals thought out of the public's interest of transferring his majesty's corpse to Holy Trinity cathedral and have now and then been giving press statement about the situation..
The reason for this was being unaware of the memorial Organization's responsibility, its duties and activities as well as being oblivious of the fact that it needs a lot of time and preparation to honorably transfer the corpse, so we believe that this statement is needed to show the true picture..
Before anything else, to honorably transfer his majesty's corpse and establish the appropriate memorial statue, king Haileselassie memorial organization is give the sole responsibility.
Since His majesty king Haileselassie is the higher protector of Ethiopian patriot's association based on the question the association had put forward to the then Ethiopian Transitional Government and the latter's cooperation and effort the corpse of his majesty, after a two-day search, was cautiously taken out on February 16, 1992 from the not-so-good hiding place it was put earlier, which Ethiopian people were aware of..
As the great king's corpse was found, it was urgently making preparations to lay the corpse in Holy Trinity Cathedral, when the committee which was assigned to set up the program received a letter questioning "His majesty king Haileselassie corpse should lay honorably and in order to have enough time for the preparation, let it temporarily rest at Taeka queen Baeta Mary Monastery" form the public and since the king's family agreed on this idea, through the letter written from patriots' Association, has now been six years since His majesty's corpse laid at Taeka Queen Baeta Mary Monastery..
While the other Ethiopians who were killed and their corpse thrown else where by the ruthless Dergue regime were with the kind permission of the transitional government, gathered again and honorably put to rest safely, and, as needed, put on memorial statue, this majesty's corpse has still been found in Taeka Queen Baeta Mary Monastery where it laid temporarily, despite the then transitional government president's permission.   .
Although the contribution His majesty king Haileselassie made to Ethiopian's development in his long years of leadership would be widely explained in the future, it's known that he made continual efforts especially, to make Ethiopia's freedom and unity remain intact, to reveal her long time freedom history to the would as well as to enable the enrichment of the social living and to enable it develop educationally and knowledge wise..
When formerly the country faced hard tests from foreigners, in the battle field and later his political struggle and firm faith produced fame and appreciation for himself and appropriate pride for Ethiopia..
In the struggle conducted to bring about freedom for African Unity and peace, his majesty was the one who had registered highest results..
For the great leadership services he conducted, and the roles he played in negotiation, establishing a permanent legacy and memorial for His majesty who was a great leader and father to Africa, is a holy task to be done by the owner of the history, the Ethiopian people..
That's why the people, at first opposed the transfer of His majesty's corpse to Holy Trinity cathedral, with such deficient organization..
For the organization was also established accepting the people's question, all must cooperate for this good cause. .
Since His majesty's corpse hasn't honorably laid to rest up to now in its appropriate place with proper procession, not only international and famous person age who appreciate his deeds, have aired their voice of resentment, regret and complaints, but also it has become troubling to their conscience to those Ethiopians who beloved in honor of humanity, justice and fairness..
In order to be saved from historical judgment and a regret that lives forever, the corpse has to honorably transfer to a grave yard at Holy Trinity Cathedral that had already been prepared while the king was alive, and building a memorial that is appropriate to a nation's pride and a benefit for the people obviously would be the major timely deed..
The Ethiopians who were present in the first meetings in order to enable this honorable cause accomplish, after the discussion, family of the king, peoples and the Ancient Ethiopian patriots Association attending as members established "His majesty king HaileSelassie Memorial Organization" as we explained before in Tobia newspaper, March 6, 1996 edition.
We have attached the establishing document and presented it to the appropriate government office in order to have officially registered..
The established organization is led by 21 members of management committee now and under it organized seven technique committees, actively operational by now..
We hope that Ethiopians who love their country and foreigners who are friends of His majesty have the right awareness of the organization through this press statement..
The His majesty king Haileselassie Memorial Organization has no doubt would have wide financial and material support as well as constructive ideas from Ethiopia and overseas who like justice..
With regards to the public's participation, recording, contributions and about its future activities, the organization would usually give press statement, and each of the newspaper on its part is believed to publish and show the right picture..
Until nation wide branches are built after having completed registration of members we kindly request that all true and rightful friends discuss on the issues wherever they are and prepare the way the individuals who will lead the branches in the future, as well as send constructive suggestions through P.O. Box 5616 Addis Ababa..
Bitweded Zewdie Gebre Hiwot
His Majesty kind Haileselasi.
Memorial Organizatio.
Executive committee

From Fiameta April 29, 1998
World AIDS Campaign was Celebrated in Our Country
The 1998 World AIDS Campaign which is underway under the motto "Babies and Children who live in the would where AIDS Spreads" has been celebrated in our country with different ceremonies. .
In a ceremony held at the ministry of Health's hall, bureau head of Addis Ababa Health Office Dr. Abera Kume, spoke that the disease mostly attacks the youth who's part of the community's backbone and ‘as a result' has a negative impact..
Particularly in the region, to curb the spread of the disease, a coordination committee was formed in collaboration with different government and non-government organizations, great efforts should be made, especially to bring about a change of behavior on the youth, Dr. Abera Pointed out.
To control the spread of the disease, he pointed out that working in unison is crucial, and in the prevention in order for the community to be kept for from the disease, not only those who are involved in the health sector, but also other organizations and association, community bodies who are poplar and are listened to, others, too, should work hand in had for it is believed to have a great contribution, he pointed out. .
At this ceremony, mentioning the recent figure, in our city close to quarter a million people are infected by the disease, while 20 thousand people are caught by the disease and waiting for their death.
In addition, the death of 25% of the productive youth has been AIDS disease and, above all, out of the babies born forms the victims of the disease, 30% remained without parents.
World Health Organization Ethiopian Bureau head Dr. Mombaze Widson on his part said that especially babies who die of AIDS disease are increasing from time to time, and he said this year focus was given for babies and children who live in the world where AIDS spreads.     .
In relation to this he also reminds that African countries should give great concentration to the effort that is to be made vis-à-vis the protection of the disease..
In the ceremony celebrated for the 10th time in our country, various research papers, songs and literary papers were presented pertaining to the date, presents were given to the winners of the competition.

From Fiameta July 28, 1999
Arrangements Were Made for Ethiopia to Get Gasoline from Sudan, it was Disclosed
By buying eighty-five percent of the total gas supply Ethiopia needs from Sudan arrangements were made to reduce a seven-million dollar expense, Ethiopia Gas Organization disclosed.
Mr. Yegzaw Mekonnen the general manager of the organization disclosed the day before yesterday that Ethiopia imports 10 thousand metric tons per month which is 120 thousand metric tons gas per year from Sudan as of the beginning of the coming Gregorian calendar.
In addition, she would get 3 thousand metric tons per month which is 36 thousand metric tons of kerosene per year.
The manager disclosed that the gas that' found from Sudan would enable her reduce her cost by seven million dollar than her annual expense she used to disburse while buying in would market.
The supply of the gas would cover eighty-five percent of the countries needs while that of kerosene fully covers the consumption of northern and north-western part which covers twenty percent of consumption of the entire country.
Mr. Mekonnen pointed out that Ethiopia gets 25 thousand square meter area from the government of Sudan with a minimum annual payment in order to build gas depot that enable her receive and store the gasoline, and when the depot is completed and arrangements are made for the gas to enter our country, there may be a situation where its price get reduced he explained.
When Ethiopia starts importing gas from Sudan, not only would it make it possible to save foreign exchange expense, but it would also create an option to the previously limited doors of Asab and Djibouti and make security of gas supply assuring.
The two countries signed a cooperation agreement June 7, 1998 in Khartoum that enabled Ethiopia get gasoline from Sudan as of the Gregorian New Year.

From Addis Zemen June 20, 2001.
Price Reduction has been made on Gas Products .
There has been reduction of retail price on gas products as of today for the coming three months, Ministry of Trade and Industry  disclosed. .
The ministry, in the statement it released yesterday pertaining to the amendment of price disclosed that in accordance to the approval of the council of ministers and the price tag that's going to be practical for the coming three months, since gas products showed price reduction, it's expected to see reduction in other retail products and services, too.
Based on the present price amendment, in Addis Ababa retail price of gas products, petrol /gas/ would be four Birr and four cents, Kerosine, one Birr and 80 cents, white diesel, two Birr and 62 cents per liter, black diesel, two Birr and 14 cents per liter, the statement disclosed..
Based on the price amendment, the statement reminded that all gas stations should make this practical, the statement disclosed.   .

Statement and Decision Given from the Ministry of Education
It's known that the administrative questions the Addis Ababa University raised are being given appropriate responses.
Even if the questions are questions of he campus students, illegal activities are underway in Addis Ababa City under the pretext of the question of the students.
At this time when the students' questions are being properly answered, there's no reason why they could be causes for disrupting the peaceful living condition of the people and government work, violence and looting.
Due to the disturbance instigated by the university students at around Arat Kilo University campus the day before yesterday, as it was disclosed in the mass media, ministry of education, commercial Bank, Tourist Hotel and other work places and organizations were struck..
Window panes were broken.
Not less that 10 cars which were the properties of National Examinations Organization were burned..
Had these been a place where petrol /gas were available, it would have been exposed to a severe damage.
And yesterday, too as a result of the intensification of this anti-people activity, several properties were destroyed..
All these illegal and anarchic activities were perpetrated in order for some political organizations which through free panel and peoples' votes last acceptance, to accomplish their political aim, using higher educational institutions as forums.  .
Although many students of higher institutions at this time, completing their education want to help their countries, people and their families few students who have political missions want to impede this aim and seek to have the former parade with them in their illegal aims and various crimes..
Ministry of Education wanted to remind that higher institutions are places where skilled work fore are produced but not hiding and gathering places for criminals.
Hence, to curb the problem that is being created, it was necessary to pass the following decision.
1. The Addis Ababa University is closed indefinitely as of yesterday April 18, 2001;
2. We warn other higher institutions not to be blindly led by groups who have special                 political missions and be reserved and follow their education in an orderly fashion.
3. Ministry of Education strictly reminds that parents being cognizant of the situation should           make the proper contribution in the effort government is making to keep the                       community's and their children's security..
Ministry of Education.

From Fiameta September 8, 1999
"If Initiating Unrest and creating conflict were Yardsticks for Political Victory, No one would Excel Eritrea."
Professor Endrias
In a public meeting organized by ECA on December 9, 1980 under the motto legislative forum for Peace, Professor Endrias stated that the Eritrean government and Eritrean Peoples Liberation Front's leadership, who after a long struggle for freedom and great victory has now started moving towards a ravine, and it would really be difficult to think that they would almost instantaneously fade at the time of their birth.
Only five years old, how could she become trouble-maker and longing for war amongst her neighborhood? Who could expect leaders that came from a society of farmers and pastoralists, who toil each day to meet ends, would have, within a short span of time, a designating characteristic of military obstinacy and lawlessness.
In connection with the elite, he commented that the intoxicated and confused Eritrean action and leadership, to make matters worse, seemed to get unwavering support of the elite, and hence, both the leadership and elite seem to cooperatively feast in Unison over their death.     .
Professor Endrias returning to the present problem mentioned that it was not only Eritrea who could be accountable in this case, but the requirements for referendum should have been clear, admitting the errors committed with regards to this..
It was possible to make official agreement as to what kind of relationship Ethiopia and the freed Eritrea could have, and clearly decide the border demarcation, situations of economic cooperation, as well as the legislative rights Eritreans residing in Ethiopia may have..

From Addis Zemen March 13, 2001
Editoria.
In Order to Wipe the tears shed around Judicatur.
People of the law say instead of arresting one individual unjustly, it is better for criminals to escape.
It is known that in a country where justice is to serve revenge, hatred, and politics, the truthful individuals and community's existence doesn't have any security.
Because of this, today in areas where armed oppositions are said to operate, especially in the Amhara and Oromia region, the family of a member of opposition parties are put behind bars.
Crime is individual by nature and in its not hereditary that passes through blood.
This is not alone.
Today the number of people who are imprisoned with one or the other reason have increased tremendously.
In addition, due to shortage of judges, the working procedures of courts have been shackled by crippling obstacles.
The security of government's perseverance, the protection and mainstay of the people are assured when bodies which carry out justice could work Freddy from any interference and influence.
We think that getting justice without waiting patiently and getting it as a gift is a right.
They say, "Delayed justice is injustice" (justice delayed is justice denied).
Especially, today in Federal courts where due to shortage of judges, courts of session are seen compact and issues are being postponed for later times.
The absence of the justice that used to be in the former governments, the fact that Ethiopians have been undergoing pain for they don't get justice at all, etc – created a big problem between the people and the government and history has registered it..
It made us encounter a problem that has not get calmed down and resulted in greater tension.
In short, the search of the people for justice struggle and hastening hasn't approached a legitimate answer.
Instead, the characteristic of the politics and the ruling party's stand has taken us very far from what the people wished for long.
It also made the struggle harsh.
The free judiciary system which should some as a tool for maintaining basic rights and a bridle for officials, has only been seen as a propaganda, which hurts us very much.
Free judiciary system is said to have got constitutional security.
But it is shackled by chain not to work
Since the current regime held power, just like the earlier one, many thousand citizens are cooped up behind bars.
But it's impossible to say that all that have been imprisoned are criminals.
Yet if this claim are said to be true, then it means sentimentality, revenge and hatred stood before justice.
From the perspective of law, no one is criminal unless he/she is made to dispute in a free court and verdict is passed on hem/her.
No one can be called criminal.
But when the present truth is viewed, our country' prisons can surely be said to have become places for stuffing free citizens.
How long will they stay behind bars those who don't know the entrance of the court, who were just called on the telephone, gathered by a radio call, took from their houses and the road, etc?
When justice's delayed it's hated like injustice;
This regime, the stand and activities of which are questionable, the moral strength of which is usually mentioned in its negativity, has been responding to the caused for the long arrest of prisoners of conscience, journalists, political individuals, and the like, the lack of judies, missing of prosecutors, opening files taking its time.
This is its won problem and pretext.
It is not acceptable in the face of the public and justice.
Those who put great faith in the judicature, citizens who were put behind bars in the different prisons, urgently need to hear a verdict in favor or against them.
We were told that certain people were taking training for the judiciary tasks.
Although we say that it's not proper the fact that judges are being trained in cadres training centre, but months have passed since it was told that 30 judies are prepared to be predated to the council of peoples' representative for promotion.
They were expected to be appointed before the council's break for summer recess.
But it didn't happen.
The council was expected to make the appointment of judges its first priority.
The expectation didn't work out.
People with cases are still unjustly treated.
The files which used to be postponed are being thrown again to be seen for 1999.
The judges who were said to have been trained with new outlook and belief would be seen in the days ahead as to what kind of faith they have to justice and their loyalty to the people, but we believe that they, even if to some extent, would be able to wipe the tears that are shed to day around the judicature due to excessive files an shortage of judges.

From Fiameta September 8, 1999
A Journey to a Historical Site
Among the ancient church found in Lake Tana, one is Yenarga Trinity church on the island of Dek.
This church was built for Queen Mintiwab (1730-1755) a religions father whom we met at the place told us.
We saw that the holy wall just like those churches found in the neighborhood was decorated with ancient pictures.
We also came to know that the grass roof to which became ruined in the 1981 and was not allowed to undergo renovation has now been substituted by corrugated iron sheets.
After we visited the Barga Trinity church we retuned to our ship..
And making our way to Bahir Dar, we went to Zege.
We were told that the kebran Saint Gabriel church which was built in the 15th century and Ura Kidane Mihret Church which was built in the 17 century was found on Zege island.
In the ship Beers and Soft drinks and sold with not-so-cheap price.
Travelers have opened their services..
The smell of tasty chicken sauce opened most people's appetite for food.
Travelers next to us asked us if we wanted to share their food which they kept in the traditional food bag that is made of leather skin and dry grass..
But we apparently declined..
Expecting they would insist saying "please".
But they didn't say so..
So we didn't eat despite the good smell that pours in and our insatiable appetite..
As soon as we reach Zege Island we heard on hand-held micro phone news that is not good to the ears..
It was the voice of the guide of the Travelers' club whom we accustomed to so soon..
Since it's going to be evening we were told that the captain of the ship couldn't go to Zege.
The calm that reigned within travelers suddenly transformed to disturbance.
Although the travelers' club has already charged thirteen Birr from each traveler promising to show the four monasteries, many said that completion of the day's visit with only 2 monasteries was not appropriate..
Some suggested that it's not necessary to indulge in to such an argument while cruising on a ship..
Later, one monk was sent to ask the captain to go the Zege.
The captain replied that since it's got dark he wouldn't take any responsibility..
Many argued that their money be returned.
But the ship didn't stop.
Advancing forward, the ship stopped as if it completed its journey at about 5:20 at a place we first aboard..
The captain was made to aboard and talk to passengers.
The captain stood before the people folding his arms and told that he took the measure for the sake of the people's peace and security..
It was obviously seen that the joyous feeling many of us had at about the beginning of the visit, gradually turned into sadness.
One of our colleagues who met staffs of the organization which is responsible for the ship talked to them with regards to our program..
But these workers were seen shying away from it claiming that they were not higher officials..
Anyway, this journey was completed regardless of its contract..
But in our belier, the situation should not continue in this way..
Just as the former schedule, traveler ought to have visited the historical places as long as they pay their money.
Other wise it would be better if the advertisement clearly states that the visitors are to see those, places as time permits..
After our return from the visit of Lake Tana, we spent the night in Bahr Dar..
On the morrow, we left for Gondar from Bahr Dar, Azezo, which is found 739 kilometers from Addis Ababa seemed to say to us, at the outset of the city ... welcome.
Most of the residences that are found at the right and left of the road are dilapidated and it's obvious that they longed for renovation..
If towns had tongues to speak that they need renovation perhaps Azezo would be the first one to utter.
We reached Gondar at about evening after having traveled in neither a gravel nor asphalted road.
The town was not built on a suitable location..
Perhaps it was because of this reason that her development was not so obvious as her establishment..
Many of the hotels are old..
In order to find a hotel to stay the night in this ancient city it took us more than an hour..
Don't ask me the hotel payment..
It was finally that we got rented bedroom with fair payment in a certain house that has wide premise..
I remember the music that says, "There's no coffee, but had there been some, there's no place like Gondar."
And is it true that there's no coffee in this town?
It was a question I asked myself.
However, in the morning together with my friend we ordered coffee at a café and proved there was coffee.
While sipping the coffee I imagined what the ancient Gondar might be.
Then, when Fasil stood overseeing the erection of the building, Tewdros being in the grandstand talking to the people.
I imagined visitors and researchers coming from Europe, crossing the Red Sea, through the lowland, I remembered those Jesuits who came to widen the catholic faith..
Any way, after discussing with the representative of Gondar Danger protection and Preparedness commission, for it was our purpose of going there, and then continued our program to Gondar castle.   .
Although we know from our education that the ancient city, Gondar, which is the reflection of Ethiopian history and culture and was the seat of Ethiopia kings after the 16th century, and have many long cultures and customs, we had to get some other person to do additional briefing..
The zonal Information and Tourism Department assigned an adult man who was eloquent speaker.               .
This guide told us that Gondar was a very small town in the 16th century and king Fasil who reigned in 1640 made Gondar its permanent seat, built a huge palace in the center of the town.
Showing us the palace from a near distance..

This was announced in Hague by Director of Development Cooperation in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Mr. Brham Van Ogie..
According to the statement made by Mr. Ogic this measure of reduction was taken so as to make the small number of countries who are in desperate need of the aid more beneficiary..
He pointed out that a resolution had passed after a long heated argument took place in the parliament, and the next step is to decide which countries should be chosen and that was to be decided in a few months.
The selection would be made on three major requirements: the country must be poor, it must desperately need the aid, and it should have good governance, follow democracy..
In my opinion, Ethiopia fulfills this requirement, and there's no chance that makes Ethiopia out of the list, he said. .

At this time the defense force as a national defense army its found capably and is ready to carry out the responsibility entrusted upon it by the people and government to protect the constitutional order, and enemy forces that at different concurrences dispute the sovereignty of Ethiopia and challenge constitutional order, they assured.    .

At that time, due to the electric throbbing, my body hurt and swelled..

By inserting thin tube through the opening of my penis and sucked blood and urine..

The other front is "Ethiopian Democratic Unity of Patriots' united Front that was established by one team of Medhin's party, one wing of Benshangul, one wing of Kefagn, Ethiopian patriots' front and Gathering Ethiopia Organization united their fronts.
Both fronts made official in their programs that they struggle for clan-free national politics.
Why didn't they unite.
This question is still not answered.
The fronts have started releasing victory statement..
But on the side of the government, there has been no official statement except carrying out military activities around the area.
On the other hand, Afar and Gambella leaders are being changed now and then in a peace and democracy conference.
Although budget is said to have been allocated from the central government, no tangible development is being carried out.
The Somali region which has for long been getting used to gun fires, the political crisis has relapsed recently.
Since the attempted coup de tat that was carried out on September 25, 1998 by his deputy Mr. Mahidi Ayub Guled, against the president Id Tahir Farah was said to have violated the constitution and failed by the central government intervention, the regional council to conduct a consultation on the matter would meet tomorrow for its 2nd urgent session, it was disclosed.   .
Id Tahir, who is said to have the support of the Prime Minister Meles Zenawi and chairman of Ethiopian Somali Democratic League, Dr. Abdulmejid, on the morrow of the ailed coup, on September 30, 1998 ousted 5 officials from his political oppositions, inclusive of the police commissions, Mr. Yunis Abdulahi, it was officially disclosed.
The cause for the dismissal of the police commissioner as stated by the president was he illegally imprisoned people using his power and despite the last warning given to him last year he couldn't improve his deeds.
Although Id Tahir said this, in the statement he gave in the evening of the same date regarding the coup, the police force who were ordered by the commission were waiting attentively to assassinate the president in his car, but wrongly fired on the vehicle of the defense army, which, in other words, made it clear the cause for his dismissal from job.
Dr. Abdul Mejid in his explanation stated the reshuffling, based on the regional constitution, the meeting had to be called by the president or by the person whom he represented, and yet the League wouldn't pressurize to make the president stay in power unless he has popular support, but it opposes the illegal measure that was taken.
In this reshuffling that was said to have taken place without the 31 executive committee members, including the president, where 2/3 (21) members were not present and with a meeting held by only 16 individuals, the League held a meeting in the regions capital Jijiga town, on October 4, 1991 to take a standpoint on it.
While we didn't include in this report the standpoint the League took on the issue for it didn't reach for publication, from the perspective of the intervention of the central government in this issue and from Dr. AbdulMejid's statement, they are expected not to accept the opposition's stand for the council's falling apart is also the league's weakness.   .
Nevertheless, since the council that constitutes most of the members of ESDL, doesn't trust one another and is full of contradictions, the amendment measure that are expected to be taken by the League may restore it for a short time, the reshuffling the president had started, especially his act of transferring old-timer teachers who are said to have been highly active to the sub-regions, would provoke more his opposition, it was told.
The deputy president Mahidi Ayub who attempted the coup being an enemy to Id Tahir, has gotten a rough relationship with the latter since he led the peace and democracy conference held in Degehabur, internal sources disclosed, would be expected to give an explanation about the measure he had taken to get the majority vote, in the 2nd urgent session of the council that is expected to be held in Jijiga town for four days starting tomorrow.
In this meeting where all members of he council of the nine zones are said to participate, it's disclosed that the ex deputy president Abdulahi Hassen and his secretary Ahmed Ibrahim, who were members of the executive committee, members who have now and them been ousted from their powers in pretexts of not carrying out their responsibilities, gave priorities to their benefit rather than to the people', were all not expected to become simple enemies.          .
Although the League had expressed through its chairman that as the ousted executive committee members accepted their faults and the evaluation was conducted in their presence and hence, it would respect the decision, it didn't say anything about those 72 officials at different level who have been ousted this year alone without including these ones, and without their presence, as it stood for Id Tahir, showed favoritism in sources pointed out.
Unless the discords in the council get resolved soon, together with the instable security of the region would transform the situation in to a worsened level, and the session that was to be held in October 8, 1998 would remain splitting headache to Dr. Abdulmejid and the federal government, observers stated.  .
In order to control the tendency that occurred in 1995 in the Somali region, the central government united the Democratic Action League, Ethiopia Gobiye Democratic organization, Ethiopian Somali Democratic Front, Gurgura Liberation Front, Horial Democratic Party and Esa and Gurgura Liberation Front and together formed the pro-EPRDF, Ethiopian Somali Democratic League, it's to be recalled.
In relation to the establishment of the league the former president flassen jire Kalinle and his deputy Ahmed Ali stepped down form their power and were made to be arrested, while in their place Abdurahman Abdikeni and Ahmed Mekahil Hussien were replaced.
This operation itself, after having traveled for sometime, due to the prevailing political unrest, and during the 1995 regional election which was postponed from May to June out of the 139 seats the regional council have the Ethiopian Somali Democratic League got 76, while Ogaden National Liberation Front, 31 west Somali Liberation Front, got 11 seats, for which case ESDL got the majority seat and Id Tahir, president, Abdulahi Hassen, Deputy and Ibrahim was elected secretary of the council, it was to be recalled.
These clan elites who organized themselves in parties and fronts and who claim to have stood for the people have contributed nothing in terms of changing the poor living condition of the people.

From Tobia October 9, 1997
Eritrea's Port was Not Affected by Ethiopian Sanctions
It was reported that Mitsewa's Port, Eritrea's main port General Manager, Araya Tsegaye told Reuters on June 17 that the port was unaffected and in fact would plant new equipment and renovate Mitsewa and Asab ports with the 57 million dollar that is to be given by World Bank..
However, he declined to comment as to how much is allocated to the two ports which need renovation of equipment, road and other building services.
Ayte Tsegaye said that Mitsewa Port for ears had been given merely Military services for Ethiopia and since Eritrea got her independence in 1993, gradually changed in to a fully trade center..
"No one considered to make it modern.
The service-giving equipment of the port was on the verge of obsolescence..
The infrastructure was highly damaged and almost nothing was functional..
So, we had to start from scratch," said Tsegaye.
Tsegaye also stated that before the conflict surfaced between the two ex-friendly nations, Ethiopia, more than any other nations, used to store her goods for a long time without any service payment, he never thought they will reach such a stage.
Reuter's reporter Manoh Esipew quoting city officials asserted that although there's a fight between Eritrea and Ethiopia within 70 kms radius from Asab, trade transactions were going on as usual..
Ayte Tsegaye told stated that although Ethiopian ships or ships that carry Ethiopian cargo all of a sudden were made to turn their direction away from Asab and Mitsewa, and advance to Djibouti, it has brought no damage on their economy, and meanwhile, northern transport fare is said to increased by 3 fold especially for Ethiopians whose goods used to come through Metsewa..
Ayte Tsegaye also stated that out of the total load Ethiopia imports, 15% of it used to come through Mitsewa while more than 50% comes through Asab..
In 1991, it was only 500,000 tons, last years it grew to 800,000 tons, but this year it was expected to rise 900,000 tons..
The fact that last year the amount of goods that Ethiopia imports through Mitsewa was 119,000 tons, which was higher than the 83,000 tons in April, show that the port could go well with out Ethiopia, Ayte Tsegaye said.
On average, 3 to 4 ships per day arrive in Mitsewa,the cargoes mostly contain cereals, agricultural equipment, industrial, and construction and trade goods..
Tsegay didn't want to comment on the loss that incurred as a result of Ethiopian sanction..
However, he expressed his regrets by saying "If they thought that the port of Mitsewa would close just because their ship does not use it, they are very much mistaken".              .

Addis Zemen May 31, 2001  .
"The Proclamation doesn't refer to those who chose Eritrean Citizenship" .
"The proclamation that was drafted by the ministry of Foreign Affairs entitled, Enabling Ethiopian-born Foreigners to benefit from various privileges of their native country" was approved by the council of ministers; presented to the council of peoples' representative on Thursday, January 9, 2002 and was referred to the legislative standing committee..
This proclamation that was divided in to three parts eighteen articles, details about the benefits of rights that could be gotten from being born in Ethiopia but took other citizenship and those who were not born in Ethiopia but either their parents or grandparents, or great grandparents, one of whom had Ethiopian citizenship, the draft proclamation described.
In part one of the proclamation article two sub article one it translates them meaning, "Ethiopian born foreigner" doesn't refer to those who took citizenship of Eritrea, it clearly indicated that.
However, in the proclamation there is not only a gap in the written statement of clarification the ministry of Foreign Affairs prepared, but it obviously indicated that the Eritreans would be beneficiaries of the opportunity.
Article 2 sub-article 1 of the draft proclamation that translates "Ethiopian-born foreigner" reads as follows.
"1. Ethiopian-born foreigner means an individual who had had Ethiopian citizenship before he/she had other country's citizenship or a foreigner whose parents, grandparents or great grandparents, at least one of them at any time had Ethiopian citizenship, but it doesn't include those individuals who left Ethiopian citizenship and chose Eritrean citizenship," it said.
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs gave an explanation regarding this sup article and it said as follows.
"...As it is known since Eritreans changed their citizenship due to their secession from Ethiopia an establish their own country, and since giving them the prerogative to the various rights and benefits refer to the overall people of the country, assigning this meaning to them is not appropriate.
The experience of India not to include Pakistanis and people of Bangladesh who used to be her own bodies, explained the same thing; there fore, these people are clearly exclusive in the execution of the proclamation," strengthened the sanction and then, it opened a door for them with an adjective, "However"..
"However, it must be proved that Eritrean-born Eritreans had chosen Eritrean citizenship to lose his/her Ethiopian citizenship.
Moreover, Eritrean-born individuals who didn't take Eritrean citizenship but took other country citizenship could be said in the proclamation Ethiopian-born," it said; for the question raised by MPs as to why didn't it say those who participated in the referendum, the house speaker Dawit Yohannes argued the issuance of referendum is not related with citizenship.
Observers criticized that this explanation indicated that there was an interest in benefiting Eritreans in the proclamation.
All Eritreans who participated in the Eritrean referendum, since they have temporary identity cards from the outset, according to the legislation decreed in 2000, and still today practical proclamation of citizenship, they lose their Ethiopian ness; since this should that all Eritrean citizens leaving Ethiopian citizenship and chose Eritrean citizenship are clearly implicated here; leaving aside this clear legislation of the country, the ministry of Foreign Affairs, gave a statement that said, "However, it should be proved that the Eritrean had chosen Eritrean citizenship to lose Ethiopian Citizenship," which may give a green light for those Eritrean business people who were sunken after the Ethio-Eritrean conflict to regain control the business, there is a worry.
It would also give a chance for foreigners to involve in banks and the like which are forbidden for them, and it would make the screening of Eritrean citizens difficult for there's no list in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of those who took part in the Eritrean referendum.
At the time the draft proclamation was referred to the council of peoples' representative, the sentence that says if one of the spouses is Ethiopian and the other a foreigner, the later would be given identity and even if he/she is not Ethiopian, had been questioned.
This has also raised an opposition claiming that it would pave a conducive situation for evicted Eritreans.
Although what initiated this statement, was said to be the questions the Eriteans who were said to have come from abroad raised to the government officials in Hilton Hotel, from the perspective of the urgency and the gap the proclamation opened, it seemed to benefit the Eritrean business community, there are some who claim this.
The people whom this draft proclamation refers to, apart form being forbidden to work in defense, security and foreign affairs, as well as robbing off their rights to vote, or to be elected, they would be beneficiaries of all other privileges a citizen has; they would be given identity cards to show that they are beneficiaries of these prerogatives.
This draft proclamation is expected to be approved by the council soon after the Legislative issues, Defense and foreign affair standing committees see to it..

From Addis Zemen April 28, 2005
Immigration Office Took Measures on Foreigners Who were Found Illegal, It was Disclosed..
Ethiopian Immigration Office disclosed that imposed a total of 80,800 Birr levy on foreigners who were found illegal..
Those foreigners whom imposition were laid upon were the ones found entering through illegal borders, and whose visas or residence permission is not renewed, the top official of the organization, Mr. Gezachew Adane informed.
The report also stated that last year his office gave passports and visa for 1.45 million Ethiopians..
Stating the need for amendment of immigration laws that have been in use for over 30 years, he said in order to update the law and make it applicable to the present time, a panel consisting of five experts is conducting a sturdy..
If the study went according to plan, it would complete next year around February, he also mentioned..
On the other hand, the borderlines are so wide along various frontiers of the neighboring countries that it is not conducive to manage and control the infiltration, the situation is, hence, there are as many cases where people are seen coming into or going out freely other than through the frontier toll stations..
Especially people with lots of money, after reaching the border, would give a good amount of money to the area officials, and go out of or get into the country without being noticed by immigration workers, the people who know the areas spoke with regret.  .
The presence of toll stations would serve best to control the people who go out of and get into the country if the borderline is only one and the rest were topographical impediments..
In particular, the districts around the border between Ethiopia and Somalia as well as between Kenya and Sudan are free for anyone to enter from any side, so, the toll stations serve only those who abide by the law, said the people who know the areas..
Related to the illegal infiltration of people of people in and out of the country, are the valuable resources and cash crops which could serve the country earn hard currency such as gold, coffee, incense and ‘chat' that are sold cheap in bulk in the neighboring countries, being a good means of getting foreign exchange to them..
Northern Somalia or Somaliland Republic which is famous in the world for its export of Camel and horned cattle to Arab countries gets hard currency in return as a result of the illegal trade of these animals which go from Ethiopia, it was indicated..
Unless appropriate control and management are put in place after passing and amending the law, there would be nothing that prohibits the flow of plentiful products which can bring in return a lot of hard currency to other countries, and infiltration of anti-Ethiopian as well as terrorist elements to the country; so alongside with the amendment and passing of the law, many believe that it would be wise and effective to consider the means of strengthening to border security. .

288 Million Dollars was Written off from Ethiopia's Debt.
288,100 dollars was written off from Ethiopia's foreign debt, Ethiopian embassy in France disclosed.
The embassy as it disclosed yesterday to ENA, out of the 430 million dollar Ethiopia was supposed to pay up to March 31, 2004, the written off debt constituted 67%.  .
The agreement was reached after the International Monetary Fund (IMF) passed a decision recently supporting the poverty reduction program.
These lending countries who signed the writing off & rounding off agreement with Ethiopia are found among the developed nations of the group named the Paris club.
At this occasion, the minister of Finance, Mr. Sufian Ahmed who is the leader of the Ethiopian delegates, mentioned that the lending countries took the measure supporting the development policy Ethiopia designed, and the money that was supposed to be paid would be expended on the economic and social development, the embassy disclosed.
It was pointed out that French, British, Sweden, United States, Russia, Japan, Italy, Finland, Germany and Belgium delegates participated..
In a message they relayed in the meeting, the International Monetary Fund, (IMF) African Development bank an United Nations commission for Trade and Development (UNCTAD) they assured they would stand beside Ethiopia in her effort to reduce poverty..
It is to be recalled that the Paris Club countries similarly signed an agreement to write off Ethiopia's debt in 1992 and 1997..

The internal sources informed that up to now he took more than two million Birr (750 thousand of the car inclusive) form the commission, and since the now and then requests put forward to the commission by the patriarch couldn't get answers, he not only dismissed the manager but also scattered the development commission board altogether one of whom was bishop Gabriel, they pointed out;
It was told that the patriarch, other than the synod, works forming sub-synod that consisted of his friends, and in order to investigate the matter about bishop Mekarios who was dismissed by the question of the people of Tigray and other issues, the general manager of the church's development commission Mr. Tsegaye Berhe, the secretary, Mr. Wosenseged as well as brother of sibehat Nega, Mr. Belay Nega went to Tigray and talked to various members of the community.
It was possible to understand that the development commission not only substituted his supporters, but asked the government to give him workforce, the sources pointed out;
Aba Paulos who removed his opponents from the development commission not only substituted his supporters, but asked the government to give him workforce, the sources pointed out;
There are sides who say that the reason why patriarch couldn't succeed by what he does and why he repeatedly gets in to contradiction with others, is because he has a mental disorder;
In our attempt to investigate the problem in the clergy, an official of the clergy whose name wanted to be anonymous said that the Head of the development commission was Father promoted to a level of an archbishop of the National preaching but not ousted, and further explained that there's transfer in any work place and it should not be considered as wrong to see transfer exercised;
Responding to the question we raised with regards to the working procedure of the synod, he expressed that the synod is concerned with transfer of bishops, but regarding the control of department head, manager, different work sectors, it's what the patriarch does with his subordinate officials;
The financial spending of the church has been orderly and it is followed by the church and donors' auditors, and has legal procedures, so the patriarch cannot take money as he wished, and if anyone claims that money has been taken improperly, the situation would be investigated by auditors, making the givers as well as the takers accountable, the same official pointed out;
It is proper for the development commission to be asked for payment of house rent for the different institutions under the church are made to operate independently, and hence, it's legally appropriate to pay house rent.
The official said, "the development commission is not dismantled, perhaps it has substituted members for missing ones," and the team which was sent to Tigray had no special mission except investigating the problem, he explained.
From Tobia September 25, 1997
Uniformed Amharic Alphabet Usage Avoids Working Problems
If Uniformed Amharic Alphabet were prepared for computer users and service providers, it would help avoid the working problems they may encounter, it was disclosed..
Coordinator of the establishing committee for Ethiopian Computers Standard Association, Dr. Dawit Bekele, explained that preparing Amharic Alphabet chart avoids problems that could be faced during information exchange, preparation of research works and gathering of data..
In a statement he made to journalists during the meeting of the establishing committee for Ethiopian computer standard Association, Dr. Dawit explained that since the arrangements of Amharic key board is not compatible with the English ones, it would have an impact on workmanship, so establishing the association would help avoiding this problem..
Doctor Dawit uncovered that unless professionals of the sector, beneficiaries and service providers cooperatively agree and approve to prepare uniformed Amharic alphabet chart, the difficulty wouldn't be overcome..
On the other hand, since the working language of our country is Amharic, preparing the alphabet chart would have great advantage both for the beneficiaries as well as for service providers, he unveiled..
In Ethiopia one of the stumbling blocks for the widening of computer technology is the vacancy of this uniformed alphabet chart, said Doctor Dawit, and as to the gossip that there would be no computer after the year 2000, he underscored that this is simply incorrect and should not worry anyone in our country..
Dr. Demissa Gemeda, Associate Professor at AAU, in has speech doing the opening session of establishing Committee for Ethiopian computer standard Association, he said the establishment of the association is timely and it has oblong contribution for our country's development of information exchange.   .

From Fiameta August 30, 1998
Where is the Remedy?
While Ethiopia is known for many favorable characteristics, her early civilization, tourist attractiveness, ancient governorship, as of recently her name become illustrious for drought, famine, disease resulted from famine, etc.
It has become a common practice to look for aid from the rich countries in order to fill whenever we are hit by drought which is considered as an angel of death.
Since the end of the kingship regime the feet that our politics is mostly related with begging, aid and alms made the proud citizen shameful and taciturn.
This can not be denied.
As one writer expressed a year ago in this newspaper, for the last twenty-four years, the Aid and Rehabilitation Commissioner was more popular than the foreign secretary.
As one western journalist mocked, "you (Ethiopians) do not need a Foreign Secretary.
If any need arises, I think one sub-department under Aid and Rehabilitation Commission would suffice.
If you want to enter the political game like other countries, first of all you have to change your attitude towards famine.
It would be fit if your politics is termed as the politics of famine and disease," he said.
Just like the previous regimes this one also claims, "I'm concerned about Somalia, I'm worried about Rwanda, I have such and such plans," it said.
But when the news alone is mentioned about Ethiopian famine and victims of famine, it becomes a sin.
It seems a crime.
Due to these and related awareness problems, inefficiency of administrative and leadership, distribution of development and lack of justice, budget and economic allocation, basic poverty of knowledge and incompatibility of plans before actions, all these exposed our people to famine.
It is not God's fury.
Nor is it natural calamity.
As always, for the public's wretchedness the cause is the political order.
Two months ago, the former American President Jimi Carter visited the place where he was told as producing abundant yield, the Prime Minister being host of touring the area.
If not new for the two individuals the area has since long ago been very blessed by nature.
This government has added nothing to it.
Nor has it contributed thousands of tractors several hundred machines for cutting and gathering grain (combine harvesters).
Instead, since the current government, just like the former ones, doesn't come out of begging should have asked aid showing the victims of famine.
But that didn't happen.
Because government usually takes it for granted to beg in the pretext of poor citizens and victims of famine.
On the other hand, it has concluded that the problems of Ethiopia should have been resolved by foreign forces.
But what this people want to know is that are foreign governments accountable for the people's miserable condition or is it the one who sits as government officials in Addis who are responsible for it?
It's worrying to heat that five million people are exposed for famine.
The city people and those fellow people haven't become victims as yet would like to see it in its own eyes.
The victims are within the fenced barbed wire of five, either not to get in to immigrate to the neighboring countries..
Our fellow country people who used to be said "would spoil the city it wouldn't get into the capital for it would leave black point on the politics" is still having the same fate today.
Worst of all, in 1995 while the famine was a big concern for many fellow people, a statement was given, "The famine's not so dangerous as to risk human lives," proving the regime's heedlessness to its citizens' suffering.
The fellow people who are victims of famine are the products of poor leadership.
The problem that arose due to land distribution among farmers in Amhara region is to be recalled.
The source of the resulting difficulty is there fore poor administration and its policy the in human regime and its stand.
Even then, temporarily at least, the rest of the world and its brothers should come to its rescue and save him.
However, the lasting and only solution is the democratic and public order itself builds and should actively involve in this direction believing in it..

The Sanction Applied on Sudan would Collaborate the Arab World Even Better
From reporter of Tobia (Washington DC.
The sanction no Sudan which was orchestrated by the newly appointed African Affairs Deputy Minister, Mrs. Suzan Rice, and which was to apply on Sudan as from the beginning of last week, would collaborate the Arab camp even better and would make Sudan headstrong to be a safe haven for strengthening opposition forces, the not-so-few Arab diplomats of United Nation members disclosed.
Senator John Ashkroft, the Senate Foreign Affairs sub-committee chairman, saying "a policy that's acceptable" the sanction that President Clinton ordered in his signature, approved and after that strongly praised in the ministry of Foreign Affairs, Deputy African Desk Minister Suzan Rice who was appointed in place of Mr. Robet Mus for her efficiency in this task;
At the beginning of last week, President Clinton not only imposed all kinds of American investment sanctions but also ordered to stop most of the bilateral business transactions.
According to the disclosure of higher officials this kind of measure was taken on Sudan because she hasn't stopped international terrorism and human rights violation.
The measure of Clinton seems that of the stands shown by his country on Iran, Burma and Cuba.
The Sudan government on its part retaliated on its part (Nov. 5, 1997), it was disclosed that America had 70 million dollar business relations per year with Sudan.
Sudan is the main gum supplier (          ) to America. .
Spokesperson of State Department, James Rubin explained that there's no interest to discontinue diplomatic relations with Sudan.
There was no need to push up to the end the plan that was designed last month to return American diplomats to Sudan.
Among the Islamic states Iran, Iraq and Sudan as well as Libya being victims of the attack of administration would let most members of Islamic State Association continue collaborating, diplomats found around UN disclosed for our reporter.
Moreover, America accuses Sudan of training anti-neighboring state government forces and spreading them, though sources close to Sudan also disclosed that the measure taken on her would make sudden ready, more than any other time, to arm oppositions against Eritrea, Ethiopia and Uganda.
"This measure of sanction is the last of all atrocities.
It's to be recalled that when the Eritrean, Isayas and Meles Zenawi trained and armed up to the brim the anti – Khartoum forces, the American government allocated more than twenty million dollars..
Was this not widening terrorism?"
One political observer disclosed;
It is expected that the Sanction imposed on Sudan's dates (date fruit) product that comes out of the thorny tree have a great impact on America on her products of Perfumes, Juicy beverages and candies.
Nonetheless, state Department officials started saying "permission would be granted for those who would like to bring this product of tree".
Out of the 20 million dollar products Sudan sell to America, 9 million dollars would be gotten from date fruits, Washington Post pointed out.
Sudan has for long stopped widely treating opposition forces of Ethiopian and Eritrean governments.
Instead it was widely talked of Sudan's willingness to hand over opposition forces in the talk that was held between the Ethiopian Security head and his Sudan counter part.
However, many were surprised at how America's sudden change of stand has became acute.
The American government uses dictatorial rulers in Angola, Eritrea, Uganda and Ethiopia in order to establish countries that would follow its policies, experts who know the direction of American policies (       ) pointed out that the remaining agenda is to topple down Sudanese government.
In general, however, America would enter in to diplomatic wheedle tomorrow by putting aside Sudan today, many have underscored.
It's believed that this putting aside of Sudan would gradually enable the latter to rally support from the Arab World, and would serve as an impetus for seriously helping opposition forces of different governments.
Most politicians assumed that on the side of Ethiopia, too, entering the international political affairs that doesn't concern her, from her geo-political perspective, would be like becoming "quarrel some"..

From Libro February 2, 2002 .
"We Follow Our Own, not Eritrean Policy
Meles Zenawi
Due to the sudden clash surfaced between Ethiopia and Eritriea, the citizens of both countries are found in extreme worry..
The roads that enable Ethiopians in Eritrea to return to their country have become narrow..
With regards to Eritreans in Ethiopia, Prime Minister Meles Zenawi, in the press statement he gave on the May 28 Occasion, more or less put them in some worry..
When the Prime Minister spoke in relation to this "...It has been an issue we have been discussing time and again.
We had believed" we would get solution for this problem in a short time..
The important thing is there is a common working procedure.
With regards to living, foreigners who live in Ethiopia as long as they make Ethiopia their living place could work in any sector they close, registering as dwellers..
Similarly, Ethiopians living in any country, as long as they made that country their living place, they would have the opportunity to work in any sector..
"These are many Ethiopians who make America their living place..
Even though they don't have American citizenship, they are allowed to work privately and in some government works for they have permanent residence permit..
There fore, there's a residence permit, and citizenship right..
Being a foreigner, it is not possible to participate in elections..
One cannot participate in defense forces..
In such sensitive areas any body who doesn't have citizenship right can not be assigned..
Hence, we see citizenship right and residence permit being mixed up..
Between Eritrea and Ethiopia..
"In order to put this in order, stage by stage, for Eritrean citizens who live in Ethiopia, respecting their right of residence permit and their right to work, even those who have residence permits, but because they are not citizens if these may be places where they are not allowed to enter, stage by stage, to let them leave we were discussing on issues pertaining to this..
More or less, these were situations where agreements reached upon..
This problem that surfaced now may be an impediment to implement the situations that were more or less agreed upon..
However, later the fact that this thins should be put in order is the issue government took position on..
"Citizens and dwellers should be identified ... there are works limited to citizens.    .
For instance, in relation to investment and finance issue, issue related to journalism, is restricted to citizens.
And it means they can not work in such fields.
But in any other works, this includes all other foreigners living in Ethiopia..
The Armenians, Eritreans can work in the same status..
"The other is there are government works where foreigners could be employed..
For instance, there are Indian teachers whom we brought from abroad; there are consultants of foreign teachers..
There are government works not limited by citizenship..
These would, as necessary, when the professions and skills are not access able, there would be an opportunity where foreigners would participate.
What ever the case might be, there are areas where foreigners would never participate..
For example, defense, parliament, security and some sensitive areas; these are areas that should be limited only to citizens..
"...We divide them in these stages so as to implement it orderly; we discussed this issue with Eritrean government..
The problem that is created now took the issue back..
Anyway, the Ethiopian government based on in its own direction and its own law, as well as world wide common working procedure, would be a situation to resolve this complicated problem ...
It is known that "Ethiopians in Eritrea are done some injustice..
We have been making effort to resolve this through discussion with the pertinent Eritrean government bodies up to now..
Well the present problem may aggravate this situation..
Nevertheless, we're following ours, not Eritrean policy..
When the Eritrea's turn left, there is no reason why we turn left..
Just because the Eritrean government did injustice to Ethiopians, there can not be a suggestion that says the Ethiopian government should do injustice to Eritreans.
We are led by our law, we have our own ethics, we have our own outlook..
We are led by our law and ethics but not with tit-for-tat mentality, repeating what one has done," he responded..

From Fiameta June 24, 1998
Message of Fiameta
In order to stop EPLF's insurgents the control of all the people will be Decisive (from the stand point of military science).
Insurgents cross the national border of a country and enter another country whose aim is to bring about terror and suspicion on the prevailing government, gather military, political, economic and social information, and disseminate propaganda by studying the people's grievance and burning questions, attack military and civil areas as well as communication and various economic sectors, conduct kidnapping and assassination..
The entrances the insurgents who come form foreign land to the country use the dwelling places of their clans. .
Before they engage in their work, the hide in their clans. .
As has been mentioned above the wide range duties of the insurgent groups, since the Eritrean army who are in confrontation with the Ethiopian ones around the border couldn't go forward, as an option, it may send insurgents in to the central Ethiopia in order to continue its destructive mission, so all the people in the city or country should stand ready to protect. .
Since EPLF leadership are joined with the defected group OLF, and OLF is said to have started relations at the level of leadership, EPLF can use these defected members to in surge especially within the people of speakers of Oromifa an accomplish its destructive mission, the people in the city and countryside should identify and control there forces.
When insurgents engage in their mission, they have easily identifiable weak points, therefore, if controller from the area is assigned at village, district, town, or countryside level they can easily put them under control..
The following are the weak points upon which insurgents could mainly be identified..
* Most of the time insurgents can be identified by their clothes, general facial expressions, language or style of talking..
In addition, there are facial, way of dressing and eating behavior, walking situations that can serve identity each insurgent, so the dwellers of the area or security guards could take notice and catch them..
* When they pass by the countryside, they leave footprints so it's indicative of a strange person had passed by..
Their footprints also remain noticeable in sandy areas..
* Insurgents could not pass without feeling suspicious and staring when they pass by through enemy people..
Whatever trained they may be they feel frightened for their activities are underground..
This worry and fear can be read from their facial expressions; so far one who made a good follow-up it would be uncovered..
* Since people who conduct dangerous attacks make their movements during the night time, they could be traced make their movements during the night time, they could be traced by taking a sudden curfew measures..
In order for insurgents to do their duties they have to be embraced by the people..
Insurgents who have no public support would be like a fish out of the sea. .
Hence, if government and the people work hand and gloves insurgents could not do their missions, and if the police village, farmers' association and individual dwellers cooperate a work by creating relations to one another, it is possible to about the plans of the insurgents of EPLF, so let's cooperatively control them..
