From Tobia October 9, 1997
There was an explosive bomb Attack on two UN vehicles in Eritre.
Two vehicles whose properties were that of Canada's Peace delegations of the United Nations Mission for Ethiopia and Eritrea (UNMEE) were attacked by an explosive bomb at Tsorena, Eritrea.
The first explosive bomb occurred on March 12 at 2:10 in the afternoon while the second attack occurred yesterday.
Although there was no human injury in the attack, insignificant damage occurred on the two cars..
The attacks occurred at the time when the cars were investigating whether the vicinal roads were free from explosive bombs.
Major General Patrick, UNMEE's force higher commander, underlined that although by chance something pitiable didn't happen, this attack showed how it's important to get explosive bomb information form both countries. .
In addition, he stated that the information about explosive bombs is not only to keep safe the peace enforcement delegates, but also to ensure the security of the displaced fellow people who would return to their respective countries when the temporary security zone is established.
In order to establish and control the security zone that separates the two countries and to enable the displaced dwellers return roads must be clean from explosives..
In the areas where the mission is found UNMEE, Slovak and Bangladesh groups of experts who made explosives inoperative are doing cleaning task..
In addition, the UNMEE centre for making explosives inoperative is giving training for the people enrolled in this task and relaying the necessary information.
Additional investigation is being underway to identify the cause of the two accidents.
From Addis Zemen March 16, 2001
Editorial
The Value and Importance of National Reconciliation
In our country, discussing ideas calmly, resolving differences through tolerance or agreeing to disagree has not been a common experience.
While it is not possible to say it is from our nature, we are not used to accept defeat willfully due to our cultural backwardness.
Starting from two individuals we give precedence to resolve our difference of opinions through the physical tackle.
This kind of practice could be said a black spot of our thinking that went deeper from individual to political organization.
Consequently we are dragging ourselves along the ground embracing, the culture of guns and poverty.
It's common to have differences of opinions in individuals, communities, countries, political parties.
If the contradiction among these social forces were to be resolved through force, as we've been used to for long, and are inclined to do now, it's not difficult to estimate in what kind of turmoil the world would get in.
That's why we say the way of contradiction should be abandoned in order for us not to get in to such kind of disorderly situation.
That's why we say our political differences should be resolved though the spirit of tolerance and national reconciliation.
And we benefit, not lose, as a result.
Resolving differences through the culture of clashes and guns have hurt us deeply.
Especially the clash that's been among children of one nation consumes not only the country's wealth.
And not only development fruits that came about through time..
But it is also the youth who is the productive force and has a prior role in the construction of community and development of a country that would be devastated.
Due to the absence of peace, the hope of civilians to live would be obscured..
We would move from poverty to the abyss of poverty.
We saw in our eyes this practice and its consequences for the last thirty years.
We went through it.
If we just say the sacrifice that was paid to defend the unity of the country is the price one generation would pay to the country it lives in, the loss of the lives of the children of the country due to political differences is countless..
It was a generation that perished due to the disgusting so-called white and red terror.
This generation was young, and not only productive and full of strength but also that excelled in its understanding, "why did this happen.
"It used to ask; it was one who was bright and who could widely contribute for the strengthening of democratic culture.
As a result of these white and red terrors, there are now many behind bars who were from these elite and that were believed to be active groups..
If our queries are to continue today and tomorrow, all who have, through guns, destroyed the unity of the country, opened a chapter of racial politics and caused to destroy one another, killed their comrades and opponents in the struggle in the bushes, killed and have people killed in broad day light are to be brought to justice.
The yesterday's destruction cannot give blessing for today..
In fact, as today's leaders told us from the outset, that criminals of red terror are put to justice so that it would teach a lesson that no one's life ever in this country would pass without legal order.
Today, these people have no gut and courage to repeat these phrases.   .
They don't put to justice criminals of Bedeno's, water's, Areka's, Mosque's, Universities, Jesus square's cases and assassinators of Asefa Maru.
When we say let national reconciliation reign in the country, it should be understood that we're not saying that ordinary criminals sight not to be put to justice.
But at least, before additional destruction is followed, let the confrontation of political forces slack off and let there be a chance to discuss; we mean let the door open.
As it's started in our opening news the political air has been tightened with contradictions..
There's a naked contradiction between leaders and followers, among leadership itself, and between the incumbent and opposition parties.
In most places the contradiction is transforming to military clash.
We are heading towards destruction.
For national reconciliation and political tolerance more than anyone else, it is the government in power, the political organization which is the basis of the government and its all members that shoud work day and night..
For this it has a reason.
This government and its supporters should bring about and familiarize peaceful transition power.
If this didn't happen, the first to be hurt would be them.
We think they have seen the trouble the act of being defeated by force could bring about from the previous regime..
As a government, they have the responsibility of keeping the peace of the community not with force but with knack.
The other reason that makes national reconciliation necessary is not only our backwardness and the necessity of our cooperation to defeat poverty.
It's known that it's TPLF which is the prevalent political orbit (central wheel) that claims to have started its struggle holding the complaints of the Tigrean people..
Whether the group has a support of all the Tigrean people is doubtful but due to the narrow cause it has, the superiority of Tigrina speakers was clearly demonstrated for the last six years, and hence, "We-They" kind-of-saying dividing people in to two category, which is a dangerous tendency has been created..
This is a dangerous tendency that could pass on to the next generation.
Therefore, the disease that has been widespread by few leadership should be stopped before long by the cooperative effort of the struggle of Tigrean people, responsible leadership of TPLF, all opposition forces and donor countries. .
The value and importance of national reconciliation would be clearly seen only then.

The standpoint and Resolution of the Third Plenary Session of Board of Sympathizer Groups of Ethiopia, AAOP and Professor Asra.
We who are in different positions of AAPO and sympathizer group of Ethiopia, AAPO and professor Asrat, in a meeting held today on October 21, 2000 in Addis Ababa, Gerar Hotel, after having listened to the report of the executive committee of the board, deeply and widely investigated it had unanimously passed the following decision.
1st With Regards to our Organization, AAPO
1.1 We came to understand from the report that after our leader, His Excellency Professor Asrat Woldeyas died, the central committee didn't call an urgent national assembly and in his place didn't substitute his leader, so it realized that the organization is without a leader.
Therefore, according to the regulation and principles of the party, activities done within the AAPO up to now have been illegal, it realized.
1.2 We can realize from this report that since the executive board meeting second plenary session was held in May 9, 1999 and the effort to make our leader's burial ceremony colorful, and in his place assigning a leader who is capable and efficient, evaluating the pros and cons of the organization, and in order to enable it take measures of amendment, the session realized the effort it made to call the national assembly.
1.3 Moreover, the assembly looked in depth the effort the organization made to strengthen sympathizer groups in foreign relations, in its own organization, public relations departments.
1.4 At last, the assembly fully realized that the report analyzed in depth the situation of out country and our organization, AAPO, and its call for a better struggle.
Hence, /1/ the assembly appreciates the work performance report the executive committee presented and unanimously approves it and decided to have it as a document.
2nd with Regards to General NekaTibeb and Dissenting leadershi.
2.1 Since the assembly realized General NekaTibeb Bekele's leadership since 1995 have been engaged in scattering the organizations strong and sympathizer members, and continuously removing structures.
2.2 Moreover, realizing that dismantling the Moresh musical band that was a strong force behind the organization and which was established in a tiring effort, has made the assembly sorrowful.
2.3 Taking into consideration that he assigned TPLF sympathizers in Addis Ababa Council and even in the central committee, and paving way for the destruction of the organization,
2.4 And realizing that he used the income that was gotten from various sources regardless of the finance rules and regulations, and objected the investigation of it by external auditors .
2.5 Considering that based on the code of the organization, Article 2.12, the question that was asked by all members and bodies, particularly, his negligence to the call of the strengthened national assembly that came about after His Excellency professor Asrat woldeyes' death, protecting against the election of leaders and being an impediment by attempting to put himself on to power.
2.6 Dismantling the support-giving committees which have been a back bone in finance, material, diplomatic and organizational work and giving unparalleled contribution and dismissing the popular leadership and attempting to displace the people in exile writing letters to governments expressing death, and seeing these acts with great sorrow.
1st Unanimously condemning the General's unprincipled leadership, until the national assembly is called and decided, he is ejected from leadership in AAPO.
Therefore so as to make whatever activity he does illegal.
2nd The others who were close collaborative to him in this destructive work especially
1. Admasu Mekete
2. Sahile Seif.
In order to stop their destructive task in the organization it is decided that they should be banned from doing any activity of the part and be brought to justice before the national assembly.
3rd In order to maintain AAPO's legal existence and to reassure its acceptability and prestige among people the sympathizer's executive committee would call all members and supporters, followers for a public meeting and have them decided about the meeting of the assembly.
4th The destructive campaign that has started on Ethiopia by the encouragement and support of the historical enemies of Ethiopia should stop and the incumbent government should make the necessary effort to strengthen the unity of the people, and the assembly realized that it is the EPLF group that's responsible for the extermination of people.
5th As it is indicated in the report, the assembly decides to have the effort of public and foreign relations, continue strengthened.
Ethiopian, AAPO and Professor Asrat's Sympathizer Group.

Meeting of Ethio-Eritrean Border and Restitution Commission Held in Hei.
According to the peace agreement signed between Ethiopia and Eritrea meeting of border and restitution commissions held in Heig, Holland's capital on March 25 and 26 2001, Foreign Affairs Ministery announced..
In the statement given to (Ethiopian News Agency) ENA yesterday evening, the Border commission in its meeting exchange ideas and gave reminder on the disciplinary procedures the commission would abide by, the system of resolving oppositions on judges, financial administration, as well as on presentation of applications and time-limit.
This meeting decided that the first meeting of the commission with completed members to be held in May, it disclosed..
Similarly, the Restitution Commission discussed on the disciplinary and administrative issues and passed on reminder, informed the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the office of International permanent peace-making court decided to use the members of the commission as secretaries, it also disclosed..
The ministry disclosed that the agreement signed between Ethiopia and Eritrea on December 11, 2001 decreed by-law that the two commissions which look in to issues of border and restitution be formed.
The Border and Restitution commission are formed by assigning 2 members form each countries, Ethiopia and Eritrea, and by the presidents of the commission that are elected by the 4 judges and accordingly commissioners were assigned from both sides and they each close their presidents and the commission is more or less in formation, it was pointed out. .
Since commissioners who serve in either Border or Restitution Commission are assigned by any of them sides, they have the responsibility of being objective and fair, there is a working procedure to oppose if one judge may be thought to have been prejudiced or impartial towards the other, and on the side of Ethiopia there's opposition on the two commissioners Eritrea brought and similar opposition was raised on the side of Eritrea..
However, since the expression of opposition on both sides would disallow the commission to look into administrative and disciplinary issues, the meetings were not conducted for two days.
Even though the commission members faced oppositions and have weakened authority to pall decisions, not only could they give reminders on necessary and appropriate issues, but could make important and constructive idea exchanges, the ministry disclosed.  .
The ministry also disclosed that in the meeting Ethiopian and Eritrean governments' consultants and international lawyers participated.

The Belgium Government Writes off Debts
Out of the 20.3 millioin American dollars Ethiopia borrowed from Belgium government, 19.3 million dollars debt has been written off. .
In order to help Ethiopia's effort to reduce proverty, the writing off agreement was signed yesterday in Adds Abab between the Finance Minister, Mr. Sufiyan Ahmed and Belgium's Development and Cooperation Minister, Ede Bawtamans.
95 percent of the debt which was written off would greatly help especially for the sectors like health, education, road and area development which the country focused, it was disclosed.
From Addis Zemen April 12, 2001
The First Private University is to be Established in Ethiopia
Investors and representatives of Universities of United States took the primary step to establish the first private University in Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia on October 3, 1998, pointed out the information American embassy in Ethiopia sent.
The information from the embassy disclosed that the investors and representatives together with invited guests visited the building site of the university which is to be established on the northern part of Addis Ababa.
The invited guests observed the signed treaty that was made between the founder investors and California University (Stanislaws).
The agreement is to cooperatively establish a university for Ethiopia and surrounding countries that followed the general model of California University, and enables to give an American educational methodology.
The new university that is hoped to be opened in 1998 would design its first program to fulfill the demand of the country in business administration, accounting and finance fields, the information uncovered.
Apart from the regular degree program, the university would prepare knowledge-building certificate program for professionals at work..

From Fiameta September 25, 1998
The Discussion Between Addis Ababa University Students and the Minister of Education was Adjourned without fruitful results..
The discussion held between the minister of Education and the university students in order to seek remedy for the oppositions student started claiming that their rights have not been respected, was adjourned without coming to fruition..
The discussion which was expected to seek remedy as well as answers for the questions university students raised recently claiming that their rights were not respected was adjourned because among the queries was one that states police forces should go out from the campus, and agreement could not be reached with regards to that issue..
In the discussion held at x-mas hall, the students expressed that they wanted the police to go out of the campus with out any condition, while the minister agreed with the question in principle she said that it may take some time to pull out these forces and it would be difficult to give time frame as to when they would go out.
The minister, Mr. Genet Zewdie, explained the necessity of security forces in the campus for the properties as well as students security and she reminded that if police forces are pulled out today, since these are no prepared force that could substitute it, the campus would be without security, hence, until control and training process is carried out, the police force has to stay in the security job..
Mrs. Genet who reminded that the question of continuing the publication of students' council's gazette, respecting the rights of students to gather and discuss, speak have got remedies in Thursday's meeting, the issue with regards to a change of university administration, she said she would study the proposed idea..
Many questions were raised on the part of the students, among which the main one is to make the police force leave the campus as soon as possible.
They earnestly asked that the police force leaders who beat students should be brought to justice and for a change of the university administration.
They insisted up on an urgent response for the questions they asked but it this doesn't happen they promised not to start classes and continue their opposition, up on which the representative of students was obliged to send the minister off.
In the speech the representatives made to the students just before this meeting they told that among the students who were beaten by the police forces two of them are still under treatment in the hospital while the rest returned home after the treatment..
The 46 students who were under police arrest were released that day in accordance with the discussion with the minister..
In the mean time, the ministry of Education announced that the Addis Ababa University students who stopped regular classes since lest week, have been decided to continue their regular classes as of today April 17, 2001..
In a statement the office of the Ministry sent to ENA yesterday evening, students who do not want to continue their classes would be considered leaving on their own starting from April 18, 2001, noon, and without affecting the rights of others should leave the university campus, fulfilling the formalities of withdrawal of the university..
Even if the students do not fulfill the formalities of the university, as long as they are not present in their classes it would be considered as if they left on their own will, the statement reminded..
Those students who left in this way would not be given any kind of readmission, the ministry also disclosed.
Any kind of activity that would hinder the teaching learning process should not be carried out and in order to avoid difficulties and acts perpetrated on students who are interested in learning, legal measures would be taken, the ministry warned.
The ministry, reminding that the Addis Ababa University has stopped classes since last Tuesday April 10, 2001, expressed that it has given responses to questions raised by students by difference levels of the ministry of education..
The attempt the university authorities made to talk to the students on April 10, 2001 became fruitless due to the students' disobedience to do so.
Based on the students' request, to talk to the minister of education, discussion was held on April 11, 2001 on the questions raised by the students, and statements were given by the university administration by the police with regards to the measures taken by the police that day.
Based on the agreement reached with the representative of students, the minister of education discussed the details with students on April 12, 2001, it was explained..

From Tobia October 2, 1997
Editoria.
Disrespect and Mockery in Judicatur.
In the words of what people of law tell us, in the countries where thrones of democracy reigns and countries where democracy took a royal seat, judicature is precious.
If the citizen is done wrong, if its rights is taken out of the law and order he would go to the order of judicature.
Indeed, all judgments can not necessarily be mentioned as fair.
Because fairness means right judicature while judgment is a decision to be taken based on presented evidence.
Therefore, the given judgment could be affected by officials of the railing party or a covered evidence presented by a flatterer lawyer..
The judiciary court that is established in any dictatorial regime can not be said to be free from political influence.
The familiarization and multitudinous of decisions that smell government and which are taken to be instrumental to the political aim make people not to put faith fully in the supremacy of law..
One can see the outlook of people on the judiciary system at present.
As Mr. Meles witnessed earlier, in this country most legislative bodies who said they took care of justice sell justice..
The ex-minister of justice (In actual fact the minister of justice) said this age cannot be the golden age of justice.
Indeed, it's, as Mr. Meles liked to prove to us a time where "justice is suppressed and mocked at."
Mentioning very few points as reasons alone may give the answer.
First, people of law who had skill, capability and experience had gone out.
Second, those who liked friendship with the government, who judge in accord with the weather condition, dominated the scene of selling justice..
Third it's difficult to say there is any work done with conscience and in respect to the law..
Justice by itself makes you erroneous.
It's possible to widely see the details in this way.
In our belief, the very first reason is since the regime doesn't have quality and clarity, thinking of justice by itself makes you erroneous..
As everything has become shaky from its basement!
From what we read on papers that the government led parties publish, with regards to major bodies that are clad red to sell justice, there are confusion and disagreement.
One official has filled its throne, with full of relatives and families, according to the news we found from other publication..
If this is really true, this by itself is an act of mocking at justice.
Therefore, it's undisputable that there is a lot of damage in the area of justice.
While what Mr. Meles said was all right, it is to be underscored that the judgments displayed by these court sessions and judges lacked Justice..
Especially those political oppositions group leaders who are said to be prisoners of conscience could be seen as victims of these people's judgments.
People of law say "Delayed justice is injustice".
People are suffering behind bars for the last six years without being changed, and even if changes are put against them, the court proceedings are delayed for one reason or another.
The cases of individuals suspected of the red terror who came from the Amhara region and the sources of Christianity, are going to be seen in after six years in 1998.
These people, if found not guilty after their cases are seen in the court, could be sent out by saying to them "you are free to go".
While for one region school of different levels, health institutions, roads, factories etc. are planned and established for the past six years, for the unfortunate (shall we say for the one who didn't struggle?) Prisons have been formed here and there.
They have become full of prisoners..
Although the number of prisoners is unknown, it could be generally estimated in thousands.
All these are proofs for the remoteness of justice, demolition of equality are seen day after day.
While the working procedure of judiciary system in this country is becoming pensive and controversial, a question has been raised by TPLF/EPRDF to Canada, United States, some African countries and Europe.
The question was to be handed over those individuals, who used to work with the previous dergue regime and now living as political refugees, getting citizenship and in working terms in these countries..
What justice have the suspected individuals who are imprisoned got.
How many of them have got a chance to defend their cases in the court?
Hence, these countries need to seriously ask the lack of justice, suppression of individual rights, delayed justice, etc, when taking in to consideration the question they were asked.
On the other hand legally appropriate institutions such as EHRC, Lawyers' Association, Journalists' Association and other legally appropriate groups and opposition forces should intensify their struggles so that an order of justice rules over and for fair judicature.
The people should no more be convenient for a government that comes with disrespect and mockery in justice and judicature..
From Tobia September 4, 1997
Democratic Order Through our Struggl.
In a democratic government structure it is not without any reason that government work departments such as legislative body or lawmaker, court of law and interpreter of the law are formed. .
The purpose of making one control the other and maintaining the balance in government working procedure and leadership is to curb the strength and pressure of especially legislator who holds in his hands the finance and military force which can be out of control and dominate the public.
The experienced democratic countries use this government method of working procedure as a mechanism of controlling and maintaining balance.
In our age, this tripartite government working procedure, the "fourth force" which is the free press added, would make government and officials to be governed by the laws previously drawn upon by the legislative body, so that there won't be government tasks that are done in obscurity and behind the curtain, for the free press follows and makes it public; if government officials commit any transgression out of the drawn up legislation and the authority they have, there's order in place that could bring them to justice..
When we look at the situation in our county although for the consumption of propaganda when we look at the situation in our country, although for the consumption of propaganda there's a council elected by the people, a government which held power through public election, free judicature, free economy, free press, in actual practice the situation we see is a force which came to power through gun force, and carrying on its shoulder the ideology of revolutionary democracy and people who came from the same source..
In the name of free economy, the party's economic institutions are strengthened.
In the name of free press, the publications of the ruling party are disseminated, even with the support of government structures..
In the name of free election EPRDF controls the political forum all by itself..
This group controls council's legislative body..
Including the Prime Minister, cadres and members of the legislative body that have key and decisive role in government bureaucracy who are of the owner of the gun, in the council as "representatives of people" decide and have them decided through the legislative body..
This legislative body trains and recruits judges and proposes them for promotion and then sits in the council and approves their promotion.
So, is it possible to say the tripartite government bodies (the legislative body, interpreter of the law and court of law) are structured and the situation has been conducive for the development of democracy.
In a government regime, the order of judicature is structured and is said to be working independent free form influence and pressure, so that citizens in the relations they may have with one another and the government wouldn't receive unfair treatment, which is out of the legislation, and so that if this happens, they could go to the judicature and ask for justice..
In our situation, to take root such procedure, the government and official discharge their responsibilities based on the legislation and rules that had already passed on, and if they astray from this, to be accountable by the legislation, can be said there is no interest in this kind of working procedure..
And this didn't happen without a reason.
The ones who control the leadership of government used to claim that they were progressive leftist politicians, until international situations change they officially claim to be "followers of Albanian Communism", and when international situation changes, they wisely claim to be guided by "free economy" and entered the camp of the modernists..
Their ideology is still "free economy" which is soaked by leftist outlook.
In our belier, it is not possible to get democrats from Albanian Communists.
Indeed, that's why today the inclination of suppressing national reconciliation and following the way of confrontation is seen..

"Making the constitution of the country form the outset assuring the majority of the people's rights.
Based on this, the different legislative decree that would pass on would become assuring the rights of the majority of the people, and should become impediment to acts of enemies.
The institutions that keep and assure the constitution and legislations would be structured in such a way as to keep people's rights..
When the ruling class attempted to curb the rights of the majority of the people, it's possible to punish and subdue each of their impeding actions.   .
When they violate the constitution and the legislation in the form of rebellion attempted to suppress the rights of the wide population, it is possible to incite the majority of the people and destroy them.
"Based on the revolutionary democrats' (MLLT communists) elucidation, a law stands and serves not for all citizens but for "wide population or majority of the people". .
A law is controller of "the enemy of the wide population"
That's why to day oppositions are suffering behind bars, given names as committing different crimes.
It's based on this polity that the ones who have had different dreams about our country other than EPRDF's, especially TPLF's, are becoming targets of propaganda by being given various names.
As we repeatedly said free judicature is a forum that would enable them based on the legislation to request to return their rights when it's violated.
Today, a worker is sacked from his job in administrative decision; his rights are violated.
The case of a worker that should get a verdict in two months' time due to meetings of court of sessions would be postponed for years.
The district officials cold seal anyone's home.
They could throw away things from the house.
There's no speedy working to oppose the working procedure and seek justice from the judiciary order.

When salt becomes flavorless what would you use to sweet on sauce?

From Tobia October 2, 1997
In Order to Control the Malaria Epidemic that Widely Attacks People Establishing an Independent Office is crucial
Malaria Epidemic is now deep-rooted plague that takes a way many people's lives all over Ethiopia.
Although malaria has long started spreading not only in the lowlands but also in the highlands, including Addis Ababa, driving people out of jobs, no successful measures have been taken so far to control a deadly epidemic such as malaria..
It was age since malaria plague was known to be deadly and that's way an independent malaria eradication office was formed with its own professionals and budgets, and that's why malaria was never out of control during that time.
This was because controlling mechanisms such as spraying medicine in all potentially tsetse fly infestation areas..
Nonetheless, after some years the office was demolished and made to operate within the ministry of health, so no independent body could take responsibility to control malaria, and as a result, malaria epidemic has become threatening..
What has to be seen in relation to this is the fact that the medicine given to protect malaria is no more healing for it adapted to it, so it is questionable whether it's going to be eradicated with the newly arriving medicines..
Hence, before this plague goes out of control, we recommend that government give due attention to control and eradicate this unparalleled epidemic through establishing an independent office.      .

"These Clashes have no use for the stability of the two countries as well as the regions," and the minister, further continued, "The only thing it may bring about is increasing the number of refugees," Ray-Al-Am reported.
Sudan has been the home for more than half a million refugees of Ethiopia and Eritrea who have been victims of the previous clashes, the report said.
Ethiopia and Eritrea are members of IGHAD who initiated the dialogue to stop the clashes between Sudan and the rebel group, who were fighting for 15 years.
Approximately 1.3 million people were killed since the new clash began in 1983.
The Christian-dominated but also pagan-inclusive southern people liberation army, SPLA, wants to be alienated form the Arab northerners and have an autonomous administration.
In May, during the peaceful talk in Kenya, the right for self-determination with the intervention of international inspection was granted to the region.
Although the two sides would convene a second-round dialogue in August in Ethiopia, the foreign minister doubts whether IGHAD could do this peace talk mainly due to the border clashes between the two sides.
It is regrettable that IGHAD couldn't resolve the conflict that surfaced between the tow member states," said foreign minister Ismael"While Kenyan foreign Minister, Bonaya Guwedana, pays official visit to Sudan on Saturday and "there will be a discussion on Ethiopia and Eritrean clashes, its impact on the stability and security of the region, and the peaceful dialogue between Sudan and rebel groups, which was expected to take place in Addis Ababa," told reuters..

In Oromia Towns Education would be given in Amharic
This year in the different towns of Oromia region there has been pre preparation so as to give education in Amharic in the baby's mother tongue and has now been practical, the news it reached us pointed out.
The different nation-nationalities found in Nazareth, Shashement, Nekemt, were made to learn in Amharic due to the failure of the education in the last five years as revealed by parents and their children of each city and teachers of each school, and because government permits; similar activities have started in Oromia towns where various nationalities live together, it was disclosed..
More than 90% of children who were not Oromifa speakers an who were deprived of the international and national right that allows children to learn in their mother tongue, the repeated request their parents put forward to officials of Oromia region were neglected an for the last five years, teachers' knowledge, students' time and people's money were unfairly spent, the complaint reached to very critical stage, it said.
Due to this, the regional officials passed an order to make pre-preparation for students to learn in the language the want, but before that to investigate whether the question was raised from the people, whether the complaint was presented by representatives of parents and whether the complainers were really students' parents.
But some groups related the parents' complaint that they made legally in their rights to do so with crime and conspiracy and claimed as if it was "the measure taken in hatred of Oromifa" and considered as there were no complaint from the people; in the pretext of being sympathizers they were disseminating the reflection of their own selfish narrow feeling and interest, it was disclosed by the report it reached us..
The complainers, however, said "our request was presented without violating the rights of Oromo people, without touching its spiritual and moral feelings and with decency, so we are rather proud, not embarrassed about it."
While the people have the right to complain to government representatives individually, in groups, through representatives, demonstrations and public meeting saying "we're done wrong or our rights have been violated", at a time the complainers were presenting their case and even after response was a given to them, these individuals were disseminating rumors underground to the public, "the Amhara riflemen through AAPO, Amharas whose benefits have lost put forward the Tigrean and Eritrean riflemen as forerunners rose to suppress the Oromo people again," they said.
Moreover, they even say "strangers" blaming and calling names arrogantly, it was pointed out.
But the complaint these people put forward includes the Oromo, Gurage, Tigrean, Kenbata, welayta, etc. and in general it includes the different nationalities that live in the towns..
These groups haven't stopped their efforts to thwart the decision passed to start teaching in Amharic since 1998 especially in Nazareth, the information our reporter sent us form the place explained..
Although in a teachers' meeting held in the zonal education bureau on August 6, 1997 an idea that said "students were made to choose the Amharic language due to the influence of teachers and anti-oromifa propaganda.
It is the child, not the parents who must choose in which language to learn," an idea with lame reason giving it a political touch was presented but the teachers didn't accept the idea, it was disclosed.           .
Previously teachers Eastern Shoa Zone conducted a week's meeting and decided to use whatever means not to make Amharic language the language of learning, internal sources disclosed to our reporter.
"If we permit today to teach in Amharic it means that our political power has been snatched away and, therefore, this should never happen," was the decision that passed and party cadres were assigned to work together with officials of the education bureau, it was pointed out..
The cadres even approached some parents whom they thought have been popular and asked them, "Why do you want to teach your son in Amharic while you are Oromo".
For this question, the parents, "Although we are Oromos, our children haven't gained any result for the last five years through learning in Oromifa, so we want them to learn in the official language and communicative language of the people, Amharic," was the precise response they gave..
In general, in the decision they made again, the people approved its standpoint, but the form filled by parents and students could be intrigued, so the people should follow attentively, these information sources disclosed to our reporter..
In the mean time, Mr. Mitslale Dengel Muluneh who mainly contributed for the permission of learning in Amharic in Nazareth town and who was coordinating parents' committee was arrested..
The cause of his arrest as it was told by the authority who took the action was it was it was the case of a sport teacher who was found dead while he was working in a public school, although the people of the area said that in the activity conducted in the town to learn in Amharic, he represented the committee of parents of the town and persistently followed up with the zonal administrative officials, and it was due to this, most people said..
The Amharic language that was permitted to be given in the present year, in some schools (for example, Dejene Sime Primary and junior secondary school) parents were told when they went to have their children registered, that "priority is given to children taking Oromifa language.
We don't know when Amharic starts" they misled and engage parents in bureaucratic muddle..
The issue of giving education in the regional language has been problematic for long in Harar, Jijiga, Nazareth, Debrezeit, Ambo, Jimma, Nekemte and other areas where multinationalities are living together.    .
Due to this in some regions some parents have been sending their children paying expensive school fees to private schools that give their lessons in Amharic.
Even the area officials send their children to areas where education is given in Amharic and to the so-called "best" schools.
The children of the poor who have no choice, however, learn in Oromifa, if they can, but if not, would hold the fate of being unemployed..
It's to be recalled that in the last five years, many teachers from various parts of the Ethiopian regions were sacked from work just because they struggled to keep the freedom of education, and in the pretext that they don't know the language of the region, and that they oppose the educational policy. .

From Fiameta September 15, 1999
One Thousand Workers were given the Sack from Dire Daw.
The Dire Dawa Textile Factory known for its being veteran and huge in the name of structural adjustment, more than one thousand workers were dismissed from their job as from August 9, 1997 together with not less than 5 thousand families of them, were exposed to great difficulties..
Based on the list presented by the factory's structure-study committee, 840 workers were made to be pensioners, those who served for more than 20 years and their age reached 45, while 260 regular workers who believed that the situation would be much worse resigned and based on the application they submitted to leave their jobs, were paid their service compensation and made to leave..
Our reporter who went to the area and asked as to why the company needed structural adjustment and the aim of reducing working force came up with various suggestions..
Some said, "since the factory has long years since it inception, the production instruments have become old and the products which come out at present couldn't compete with the free market and the government has stopped the amends that it used to give the company is operating on loss..
Therefore since maintaining the 5 thousand workers would intensify the problem, the reduction was needed," said some of them.
Others suggested, "since the factory is famous and its profitability is not wanted to enable the recently built Almeda Textile Factory in Adowa become successful in the free market, and hence, it's a measure taken to weaken it." They said.
The evidence they give for this is that technical experts who were in key posts and supervisors are said to be recruited to be taken there with high salary.
The reduction of employees wouldn't stop there but stage by stage other 1400 individuals would be reduced so as to make the factory profitable or else it was decided to be sold for investors with only 2000 workers, internal sources who knew the matter closely told.    .
Even if the reduction seems to be appropriate in line with the system of free market economy, without making the workers psychologically ready, where a husband and wife being dismissed together and the nearly 5 thousand families who are supported by these people being without any means of subsistence, and may also withdraw from next year schooling, filled the people of Dire dawa with dejection..
The Dire Dawa textile factory among all other textile factories in the country, which was known especially for its production of khaki and calico (cotton cloth), has started to transform from profit to loss since the last two years when it was made to receive cotton which was below the standard of quality and the products started to be unwanted in the market..
Although the workers' association insisted on taking measures against the individuals who made the purchase them, it was only meant for a one-time media consumption and didn't do any good, most of the victims of the problem spoke with regret..

From the Press, January 30, 2002.
The Regime That Campaigned on the Legislation and Judicatur.
In Federal Courts there are 72 thousand substantive files for 20 Judges -- shortage of Judges has been aggravating
In a country where a popular law school which has produced professionals for over 30 years and where the new "Civil Service College which is the training institution for members of the regime are said to have trained law professionals, the shortage of judge from time to time in federal courts aggravates the situation for people with cases in the court who seek justice, are in great problem, it was disclosed.
While the judges whom their appointment was approved by the Council of Reps were only 26, six of them left their work due to death case, on their own, and as a result of a not-so-conductive-working environment, and on sickness, it was disclosed.
In a statement the Federal Supreme Court gave in the second week of August in connection with last year's recess closure of the curt, (Addis Zemen, Tuesday, August 14, 1997) made official that 38,146 criminal, 40,189 civil, 3,116 work dispute files were transferred to 1998.
These altogether made the figure more than 72 thousand files.
This figure doesn't include new cases whose files are in the process of being opened and cases whose files are with registrars and judges but not given appointment..
In this case one judge should see 3,600 files this year.
If judges are said to be full and work 200 days in a year, one Court of Session should see not less than 54 files.
And if the word "seeing" may include listening to word evidence, investigating and giving decisions, it would be extremely difficult for the working judges to run judicature qualitatively and in haste, professionals in the field are saying. .
The problem that reigned in the courts which resulted in elongation of unsettled cases an injustice is also reflected upon more than 500 lawyers who take up their cases in the Federal court, so there are many who call up on Ethiopian lawyers association to make heard its voice focusing on the issue.
They mention as proofs that the judiciary system is in a difficult situation and in order to show that it is plodding along, files which have been postponed year after year are many; that including cases which need urgent responses are being postponed; for example, case related to employer-employee which need to be resolved in 60 days is postponed for years; that judges of each court session mostly spend their time in the new year giving appointments.
"The regime doesn't have interest in strengthening the judiciary system; instead it opens a campaign against the legislation and judiciary system," and continued, these groups saying, "The fact that it sacked old-timer law professionals from the judicature and in their place assigning those 12 graders, and even those who are below this grade, by giving them short-term courses, for the positions that need a long-year training and maturity even in regular education; so if there had been willingness to strengthen the judiciary system, even recently before the council of Reps was closed, judges could be appointed and could have made preparation for this year," they said.
The nation's judiciary system is in a "bush like" the law of the jungle?    .
) Way that they wanted to operate in this way and are now controlling everything, adding that the civil servants are sacked in great numbers; at a time when illegal decisions are being taken on the business community by the legislative body, and where the judiciary system is deliberately weakened so that sides who have been done wrong administratively would not be able to go the court in search of justice and judicature and strengthen decisions of politicians, they expressed.  .
They pointed out that this is done so that ways could be established where especially citizens could be put behind bars without legislation and judiciary order, and couldn't go to the court and get urgent decision; it is a campaign they deliberately carry out to cripple the judiciary system.   .
These revolutionary democrats, who preach free judiciary system on a propaganda level, see legislation and judicature not as a tool of respecting human rights, but as a protector of their power and authority from the opposition forces; this is how observers are telling;
While the interest of politicians is this, there are who claim to be law professionals, sitting on the chair of the judiciary system, who had the legislation and judiciary system killed; they would never escape from being accountable by history and the generation, many are pointing..
It's to be recalled that whether it was from the problem around the judiciary system or not, Mr. Mahteme Solomon, the ministry of justice who resigned use to say "the golden age of Justice.

... The trade relation we had with Ethiopia was said to reach a highest stage merely on Teff cereal..
We used to buy up to 50 million Birr Teff cereal..
But now it stopped.
Just because Teff cereal has stopped being imported or because Teff is not eaten, it doesn't mean that Eritrean economy meet with crisis, he concluded..
In the mean time, many trucks that carry Teff and other cereals were obliged not to cross Eritrean border, and in the same way, trucks which carry salt have been banned up to recently from getting in to Ethiopia..

They closed it.
The activities around the port were ordered to be withdrawn and closed.
Cars were ordered neither to get out or in..
Since the situation in Asab and Mitsewa were said to be dangerous and they sent a message that movement should be stopped..
The ships which were carrying Ethiopia's cargoes were ordered to come via Djibouti and so they went there.
The port was said to be closed..
It is closed..
The fact we know is this ... I couldn't make out why this was decided..
If that is done to run dry the economic benefit of Eritrea, we might think ... until situations charge or till another curtain is uncovered, he responded.
Well, the other curtain of war is uncovered.
Both sides sent their troops to the place and started the war..
The Ethiopian army, who was on alert, is aggressively moving forward..
The feared war has started bringing about blood sheds.

From Fiameta June 3, 1998
An Aged Skeleton is Found
(ENA): At the Polio Anthropology Heritage Center in Konso the group that is conducting the study disclosed that it got a human race skull that lived before 1.4 million years, the discovery of which appeared in scientific publication, organization for Heritage Protection uncovered..
According to the statement the organization made to ENA yesterday, the study conducted at Konso Polio Anthropology Heritage Center on the skull of the ancient human race which was found in 1993, known by its scientific name ‘Australopitiks Bozy' has been completed and it would appear to day for public reading on scientific study magazine..
The studies that were conducted before years indicated that the two different human races by their scientific names, ‘Homo Eraktis and Australopitiks Bozay' used to live together, the organizaton disclosed..
In addition, various animal races that used to live in those days were found in great number and stone tools the ancient man used to utilize were also found in great number, out of which the age-old heritage known by the name ‘Ashuliyan' was found it was disclosed.
The organization for studies and protection of Heritage indicated that the skull of the human race discovered in the study was not found in the heritage centers of north of Konso, Hadar, Central Awash and Melka Kunture, the ancient human race was expected to have lived from 1 to 2 million years and then become extinct on earth..
The konso Heritage studies is believed to give answers to questions related to the ancient human race and unanswered questions, and questions pertinent to the general biological cultural growth and change of human races who lived between 1 and 2 million years, the organization disclosed..
The Konso Heritage Center has been said to resemble the Tanzanian ‘Alduvay' and the Kenyan ‘Turkana lake' Heritage Centers..
The Heritage Center has a great significance not only in showing the development of ancient races given of heir to human races, biological development and change, creation of the ancient material culture and development, but also the fact that it has become heirloom of Ethiopian and world history is great, the organization disclosed..
The Konso Heritage Center was found in September, 1994 by a group led by a research named Dr. Berhane Asfaw in a search campaign while the skull of the ancient human race which appeared in scientific publication was found by a Mr. Awoke Amozaye who was a member of a study group at the ministry of culture in southern Nation and Nationality Region, the organization revealed..
For the last five years the Organization for studies and Protection of Heritages disclosed that a group has been conducting a research led by the archaeologist Dr. Yonas Beyene and Paleontologist instructor at the Japan Tokyo University, Dr. Gen Suo, the organization disclosed.

From Goh January 12, 2002 .
In Ethiopia the Hope of Democracy is overshadowe.
Netherlands Minister of Foreign cooperation and Development
The democratic regime that was expected to flourish in Ethiopia after May 1991, was never brought to light and the hope of reviving it is overshadowed, one higher official of the Netherlands government disclosed in Amsterdam; Mr. Yan Teronk, who expressed this concluding remark that showed a great change of standpoint on the part of Holland government, is minister of Holland's Foreign Cooperation and Development.
In his official speech at Fu-Sositiat Hall in Amsterdam town on October 8, 1998, the TPLF/EPRDF government from the outset didn't have all-embracing feeling and hasn't participated most of the political organizations, and so the democratic process that was expected to happen, has been aborted now; consecutive discussion programs have been carried out round "Hints on an overall Issues about Africa".
Mr. Yan Teronk was invited as the main speaker on one topical issue among other programs.
The topic he chose for his October 8, 1998 speech was entitled "Conflict should be avoided;"
In the speech he made on this topic, after he detailed the critical problems that are predominant in Ethiopia, the outlook that Holland had two years ago up to some time on wards was positive but then as from the outset, the TPLF /EPRDF/ administration hasn't make inclusive and since it has become, in the process, pushy and exclusive of other political organizations, the formation of democratic order that was highly looked forward to, has been hindered, he underscored.
At the time it was common to popularize TPLF/EPRDF in Holland, the Ethiopians living in Holland who were highly concerned and felt uneasy about the issue ‘said' "For us Meles and Mengistu are the same! Don't make us choose form two dictators!" and repeatedly were made to go out to the street for demonstration, to express their bitter protest..
This protest which was part of the democratic struggle of Ethiopian people have bear fruit today as pointed out by Mr. Yan Teronk's speech, many observers suggested; During the occasion of Mr. Yan Teronk's speech other than invited citizens, a number of Ethiopian living in Holland and citizens of other African countries were present.    .
Many questions and criticisms were raised based on his speech.
In a situation where previously by the powerful soviet Union, in the name of socialism, and today the powerful Western Countries in the name of democracy, bring to power dictator leaders on Ethiopia, and in a situation where they make the country a land of extermination for three decades, could conflict be resolved from Ethiopia and horn of Africa.
For this question which was raided from one participant Mr. Yan Terok gave a response;
In his answer, after the end of the cold war, that is, after the fall of Dergue regime and Soviet union, there was a great hope that in Ethiopia a democracy which is backed by the west would flourish, but this hope was aborted, he underscored repeatedly.
In addition, he said Africans should not raise the past history of colonization and the actors of the history and put the blame on them, rather they should use the positive changes that came about after the cold war and, organize the basis for facilitating public order and building up development, he reminded..
He also explained about the critical issue of refugees case that has become discouraging to Ethiopians living in Holland.
He strongly reminded that the refugee whose case was given a negative decision on the law court after his/her applicaton for right of refugee has been viewed up to the end, is obliged to leave Holland.
It is to be recalled that last August the Holland government signed an agreement with TPLF/EPRDF government to return from 700-900 Ethiopian citizens whom it identified as illegal refugees..
Based on this agreement, Ethiopian citizens whom the court passed judgment as having no sufficient reason to live in Holland would be given money to establish themselves and return to their country..
However, no Ethiopian citizen has applied to willingly use this opportunity and return to Ethiopia, it was told.
As Ethiopians Immigrate not in search of money but in search of peace and life security, there's a predominant feeling among Ethiopians that there may be no one who would be attracted by money and return home.
In fact, while the number of Ethiopian refugees are like a drop in the ocean when compared to the number of refugee population in Holland, the question why have they been focused among the first ones to return, has been raised among them.
On the other hand, while other African countries are not willing to sign the treaty that was designed to return refugees, the fact that the TPLF/EPRDF government is the only government to sigh the treaty by itself may point out that there might be a plot or an intrigue which was made between the two governments behind the refugees, a hypothesis has been raised. .

This Year's Autumn Rain Exceeds Those Registered in 52 Years
This year's amount of autumn rain exceeds those registered in 52 years, National Meteorology Service Organization disclosed.
Mr. Diriba Korcha the organization's weather Forecast and precautionary Warning group leader in a statement he gave to the reporter of the newspaper, expressed that in Addis Ababa, Kombolcha, sirinka, Kofele, Sokru and Enewari, from 96.3 up to 48.8 mili meter rain was registered.
The expert reminded that last rainy season such kind of rain poured for only one or two days, but the rain that poured for 2 hours last Friday exceeded those that poured in 52 years' time.
The rain that poured for one hour in Enewari area, North Shoa damaged the crops on threshing floor, disclosed Mr. Diriba and pointed out that the farmers should collect their grains in communal Labor, but in order to threshed it has to wait until the autumn season passes, he reminded.
Especially, the part of the community that lives around flash fold should take the necessary precaution and protect themselves from a danger of flood, and when it rains it could be dangerous to take shelter in an open field and under a tree for it brings about lightning, he disclosed.
From Addis Zemen March 15, 200.
The Gun that was used to accompany the patriarch while he went to Kulibe was seized on the way
The Clashin-Kov gun that was make to accompany the patriarch who went to attend the annual church service at Kulibe St. Gabriel church on July 27, 1999, by the clergy was seized on its way, it was disclosed. .
According to our reporter's disclosure the patriarch's nephew, Mr. Yared Kebedew, Mr. Berhane who'd head of the security, and several security guards of the clergy, as well as various workers of the church who were heading towards the church, accompanied by many vehicles, were about to reach kulibe when suddenly the area government security guns made a search and the gun was seized.
Including the patriarch and his deputy archbishops went by airplane on the 25th of July, 1999 from Addis Ababa to Dire Dawa, while the patriarch's close relatives who went early by car to warmly receive him on the 23rd of July 1999.
Those Friend of the family who spent the night on the 23rd of July at Awash, were aught with the gun unexpectedly on July 24, our reporters disclosure quoting eye witnesses explained.
The patriarch's entourage who were sent to Kulibe were not only all armed with pistols but also a Klashin Kov gun is seized in their car explaining to the area security force that "it was held for the purpose of the patriarch's security" the report disclosed.
"Kulibi has its own security guns; and if necessary there is the area security force.
Why was it necessary for you to bring guns?
It was a question asked by the area people to the patriarch's entourage and armed members who were caught with pistols and the Klashin - Kov..
However, after so many ups and downs, the people were made to be released, out reporters disclosure explained.
The other news which we received from the clergy was that a lot of money was paid for the patriarch's entourage who hold the guns as per diem expense while no per diem was given to the scholar of the office of clergy who went to Kulibe.
As a result, there was a great discontent from the side of the scholar, it explained.
From Fiameta July 28, 1999
They Become without Country, without Government.
Ethiopian were evicted from Somalia, their properties appropriated – they couldn't get anyone that take their case stand for their rights..
According to the agreement reached between Ethiopia government and Somaliland Republic, from 900-1000 Ethiopians who used to do menial jobs at Hargesa, Berbera, Borema, buro and other forms were forcefully evicted at night through Togo Wechale Ethiopian border, their money and properties appropriated by policemen, kidnapped and beaten, the victims disclosed..
Since Ziyad Bare government was ousted in 1981, many Ethiopians who used to live for many years in the different towns of North Somalia, a country that declared as Somali land Republic, doing menial jobs such as dam work, Toilet digging and as servants in private residences, suddenly and without giving them chance to collect the properties they earned though their un preferred jobs, were evicted from the country through threatening gun-shots of Hagesa policemen, they told our office that the situation had left them feeling very dejected..
As if the maltreatment of Hargessa policemen were not sufficient, the EPRDF soldiers who received them at Togowechale left them in the bush for six days without any help, later took them at Jijiga revolutionary square which was unexpected from a troop that claimed to defend the country from attacks, and it also showed that the prevailing government doesn't care a bit about its citizens, the victims explained..
The people of Jijiga provided them with water and food supplies to its fellow-people who were hungry and suffered a lot but the government wanted to come out smelling like a rose by distributing clothes and daily rations attempting to keep them stable..
These sources indicated that the displaced people who were evicted, money they hardly earned doing menial jobs being appropriated and being beaten put forward their mistreatments to Somalia national regional administration which is found in Jijiga..
The displaced people explained there the Regional Administration wrote regretting letter sating that the agreement of the two countries underscored to hand over Ethiopians bringing them to the border and not appropriate their money and evict them by beating; since then the looting and forceful measures and eviction have temporarily stopped.
The cause for the displaced people, as widely heard in the area, was the request EPRDF government put forward based on the information reached it for the government to curb the flow of Ethiopians who engaged themselves in menial jobs in Hargessa, Berbera, Borema, buro and other Somaliland towns and were said to have flown into Oman through Bosaso port, where training center of the opposition forces are claimed to operate..
The Ethiopian government wanted to evict primarily Ethiopian ex-soldiers, some of whom with high and military ranks who were registered by United Nations Humanitarian commission for Refugees (UNHCR) and line these, but since couldn't evict those people, we were obliged to became the victims of the problem, said the information.
Although the number did not excel that of the present year, as many Ethiopians were forced to evict from Northern Somalia, these victims reminded that three years back, too 90 people were evicted from that country in late at might their money and properties appropriated, they spoke with regret.    .
At the time when Somalia have become without government after the downfall of Ziyad Bare regime, and when Somalia has been in great trouble and anarchy reigned, Ethiopian people opened their arms warmly received somalians and up to now many hundred thousand refugees are considers as fellow - brother and sisters, the displaced mentioned, and the Ethiopian government having kept their rights even of those who don't get have permits, it has saddened them to see a government who claimed to lead the country to be negligent when such kind of injustice and humiliation were done to Ethiopians.
While somalians who are registered as refugees, especially those who live at Hartishek, Harshin, Kamaboker and east Gashamo, have opened stores and built big ware houses and without any question import cars crossing borders, trading as far as Addis Ababa, and takeout passports to go to some other countries, the Ethiopians who were engaged in menial works not in big businesses, were considered criminal and forcefully evicted, in any criterion is in humans, full of racism, the displaced underscored..
One Ethiopian who was in Hargessa at the time asked "While the somalians in Ethiopia more freely with their rights protected, where do you evict Ethiopian appropriating their money and properties, who have been working in your country in menial jobs for along time?
In response to this, "Ethiopia is a country where anyone is allowed to live.
But Somalia is only for Somalias, we don't allow other to live in it" they responded with obstinacy, the victim who listened to this conversation expressed.
In order for the Somaliland police to take forceful measure, especially the ALETHAD group members played great role, these sources also disclosed.
It's known that Hargesa, which secede from Somali, which is a country with out government and call herself Somaliland Republic has not yet recognized would wide..
From Tobia August 7, 1997
The Spy got married in Ethiopian Embassy.
"Was it because the Ambassador's wife is Eritrean?" Mr. Tadesse Gebre Egziabhere who was born and grew up in Eritrea, was told by many, as one of those engaged in spying career, threw a lavish wedding on September 1, 1999 in the premise of  Ethiopian Embassy in Bon, it is disclosed.
The report that reached us explained that Mr. Tadesse was sent to Germany for education and he remained there, when meeting was held in Germany about issue of Ethiopian Unity, he was known for insulting and shouting in the hall, especially when EPLF and TPLF were mentioned..
What was most astounding about this individual was the fact that he had a wedding extravaganza in the premise of the residence of the Ethiopian ambassador, it was said.
These sources added that the individuals did this in order to show their contempt on other Ethiopians as some said..
While the Embassy represents the people, the Ambassador's residence is considered as a palace..
However, from which policy does this kind of irresponsible act of throwing a party emanates? Say some people on telephone form the place..
The other contentious issue was the Ethiopian Ambassador Mr. Berhanu Tinsay's wife is Eritrean..
Opinions were given that this lavish wedding party was thrown because the wife of the Ethiopian Ambassador is Eritrean..
Tadesse Gebre Egziabeher secretary at Ethiopian Embassy in Bon who came from Eritrean made the wedding extravaganza colorful, observers commented..
Internal sources told us that the General Secretary, Mr. Tsehaye Wolde Gabriel contributed a lot being EPLE member when he was an immigrant in Germany..
It was regrettable that while the Embassy invited Ethiopian immigrants twice to discuss about the prevalent situations in Eritrea and Ethiopia, the meeting was not held in the Embassy compound..
The reason given for deciding not to hold the meeting within the Embassy premise was to make oppositions not appear in the embassy, it was disclosed..
Due to this reason, they rented a hall outside the embassy and in the meeting held there, it was agreed to raise fund for the displaced Ethiopians and the meeting was adjourned..
To rent a hall outside the embassy 28 thousand Birr was expended..
So, why do the diplomats who refused to discuss issues about Ethiopia in the premise of the Embassy allowed the premise for an individual who's claimed to be a spy for Eritrea? What did the Eritrean spied in this wedding? Who did he recruit? We'll leave the response to government bodies..
From Fiameta September 6, 1998
In Adowa Town more than 37 million Birr Development Projects are Underwa.
In Tigray central zone, in Adowa town different development projects that cost more than 37 million Birr are underway, the municipality of the town disclosed.
General Manager of the municipality Mr. Habtu Mebrahtu recently disclosed that the development activities that are being carried out in the town are made possible due to the contribution of the residents, investors and the municipality.
Among the development activities that are being conducted in the town, a five-kilometer gravel road, a 15-kilometer cleaning of interior roads, a five-kilometer asphalt repair, amendment of two flood protection tubes for two intermediate bridges, and a three-kilometer road-repair work are found.
Moreover, the residents and investors, allocated more than 33.4 million Birr capital to take part in hotel, children's school, supermarkets, plastic factory and different small-scale industries, received more than 18 thousand square meters, and started construction works, the general manager disclosed.
When the development projects are completed more than 10 thousand residents would be beneficiary, and it would create job opportunities for more than 300 people, the general manager explained.
From Addis Zemen, March 24, 2005
Eritrea is Going to Train the Young with Special Army Commando
The Eritrean government is prepared to send and train thousands of youngsters to Israel..
To this end, youngsters who gave services and returned are being gathered form everywhere..
During their stay in Israel the youngsters would learn skills that enable them attack in ground force, air force and navy..
The requirement asked was one whose age is not beyond 25, not married and healthy, it indicates..
According to the news report, the call is reaching these recruits, but most of them didn't accept the call, escaped and are found immigrating to Ethiopia.
In the mean time, Eritrean defense minister ordered those who took school leaving examinations last year and didn't get enough results, those who graduated form University in degrees and diplomas, and those graduated form technical schools in diploma to get in to Sawa and take the 7th round soldiers training. .
Political analysts who follow Eritrea's situation from various directions believed that the wide military preparation may be dangerous not only to Sudan and Yemen but also to Ethiopia, the report it reached us pointed out.        .
