From Addis Zemen May 1, 2001.
"Computer Technology Helps for a Country's Development"
Mr. Fikre is what he's called.
He was born in 1952 in Gondar town around Azezo area.
He learned his elementary education in Gondar town.
Since he went to Asmara when he was 15, he got the opportunity to learn at Leul Mekonnen Secondary School.
As soon as he completed grade eleven he was employed to serve as an Air Force officer.
Because he got good results in school leaving certificate examination while he was in the air force, he joined Addis Ababa University.
A little after having earned diploma in Accounting he went to the former Republic of Czechoslovakia and got now master's degree in Management Information systems and ‘computer science', and now he's the manager of Alpa Lumber Corporation. .
Ato Fikre who's currently doing research on Computer Science Font technology has become our guest today. .
Addis Zemen: What kinds of work were you doing after you have earned your Master's degree?
Ato Fikre: As soon as I completed my education, I returned to my home country to help my fellow people.
Then I have taught a computer course entitled system 'Analysis and Design' in Addis Ababa University for eleven months..
At the time I was teaching in air force, too.
Nevertheless, since situations were not convenient and the time was not reliable and since my wife and children were in the capital of Italy, Rome, I asked to bring my family so permission was granted..
As soon as I went there I was employed as a programmer and computer expert at food and Agriculture Organization (FAO).
After serving for four years I went to Canada.
Addis Zemen: why did you choose to learn Computer science.
And how far had this field got recognition in our county.
Mr. Fikere: When I returned to Ethiopia after studying computer science I came to realize that nothing was known about the field..
Well, this was in 1983.
During the time there were few who had computers.
Since computer was not known, it was not widespread.
It was during this time that I returned to Ethiopia from Czechoslovakia (now called Czech Republic).
I was interested to study the subject for I knew about the various disciplines of University.
When I though of the field I first studied in diploma, Accounting, it worried me how it would be useful to me and where it would take me..
When I joined university computer science had just started.
I thought about it.
So, I took one flyer about computer science and started to understand what the field is all about.
I had mathematical and a technical skill, what could be difficult was logic and integration.
Hence, I decided to study, this field in and become ready in the belief of having a good future.
I presumed that thing called computer may become the powerful thing of the future's world, and I found out later that my assumption was true and its result was amazing..
Of all the things I am surprised of is the fact that different professions vary in accordance to the country's culture, economy and development..
For instance, if an electric engineer would go to Canada and work he would face difficulties.
He may not get a job because he's expected to have the capability in line with their standard and discipline..
In order to fulfill that he need to learn and pass various examinations.
It's only after he adjusted himself to the prevailing level that he could perform his job.
The field of medicine is similar.
But the one that has acceptability in all fields is computer technology.
It doesn't have difference in any country.
Of course, some standards are being designed now.
However, the field of computer makes one busy.
It needs caution, it needs thinking.
It needs to take many things in to consideration.
Because the job is fire some, many people don't want to take it as a profession.
Addis Zemen: computer is known for having great contribution to work facilitation and reducing tiredness..
And you're saying it's tiresome, would you explain it to me.
Mr. Fiker: our work is to make the computer work.
To me that computer fulfills its purpose for the user. .
Our task is to enable the computer think and serve.
In order to accomplish this, there are certain programs to be worked out.
What's a program?
In order to answer this question, we have to see it broadly.
Computer has its own directions.
Each direction tells the computer what to do.
These instructions put together are called program.
That is, by entering the computer it could decide the communication between people.
Therefore, our task is to primarily think and design.
Addis Zemen: After you went to Canada from Rome in what profession were you in?
Mr. Fikre: I knew my profession would enable me get reliable job in Canada..
But it would be difficult to get job immediately due to my job efficiency..
Although I put forward as many applications, the responses I got were not satisfactory.
After that, I reduced my job efficiency and applied to one company for a ‘junior programmer' position.
I got a job as a result of this.
At the company where I got the job, we were two programmers and a boss.
At the first month, I had the capability to perform the tasks of the two..
I was registering result, too.
In the second month our boss resigned and left.
In the third month after he went, the company's higher bosses asked me to take his position.
I immediately became controller of programmer.
I think I got this opportunity because working software programs is tough.
The job may be tough for some but easy for others.
As a matter of chance, it was easy for me.
The programs I do have become precise and good.
For some, it would be tiresome to find difficulties in the program.
Addis Zemen: what's a computer?
What about Software.
Mr. Fikre: computer is a broad subject.
If we want to put it briefly we can put it in three categories.
The first is called personal computer and this are computers that could work alone.
They call the second one as super computer and Mini computer.
These are meant for middle-level companies.
Such kinds of computers can serve up to two thousand users.
Their tasks also vary.
For example, they could perform engineering works or else could perform production yields.
The third is called main frame computer.
This serves for big and heavy industries.
It has the capacity to collect a lot of data.
In Ethiopia, I mostly saw personal computers.
Mini computers are few.
Software's have also levels.
The first one is what is called operating system (Agafari), it is known that computers is done by electronic instruments (devices).
It's he software that moves those (instruments).
When the Agafari is pressed it means the computer is ready to take as well as give command.
This means that a communicative language has started.
The other is called "application" software.
This is software that could perform special task for the user.
There is word processor software that enables words to express easily.
This has a limited function of only processing words.
Hence, there is an instruction in the process that tells how to create files and how to write.
How to print, magnify, enlarge and create lines, it has become easy to perform each application software..
Addis Zemen: what's the study you make previously on computer.
Mr. Fikre: It was reporting to decision-making bodies by identifying the problems computer can create in our company by the year 2000.
Based on this, I started my research.
Since I knew the software's of each company, I tried to show in details in my study what effects it could have. .
Based on the research, I put forward three kinds of remedies.
The first was what would happen to the company if we don't take any measure.
It would give answer to this question.
According to the study, nothing would happen.
But we have to employ many workers.
This pointed out that we have to get permission from our company to have about half a million dollar.
The problem the year 2000 could bring about was not as such mal functioning but mixing issues related to dates.   .
Or else it gives mixed up responses to questions related to dates.
For instance, a person retires at the age of 65 according to Canadian law.
When he exactly reaches 65 he'll be sent a cheque at home..
The computer that does this would affect the person if it has problem of dates.
The man might have been born in 1960.
The computer would write him a cheque in 1997.
The next year it would give him a cheque in line with the figures..
In 1999 the man would get his retiring cheque for he becomes 69 years.
Since these computers which are expected to create problems, have no four digits, they would be forced to deduct form 0 by 2000.
Therefore, the man who was born in 1930 wouldn't get a cheque by 2000 for the computer would deduct his age 30, and makes it below zero.
Due to this it means that at one time Canadian Retirement strategy would be disrupted.
To amend this, it would help to enable the computer read four digits..
This problem was not considered by software producers twenty years before.
But software's produced after nine years were made not to face this problem.
Actually, there are cases where it's being done as an option.
It asks whether to do in two or four digits.
Thus, the first remedy that is, it wouldn't bring about any difficulty if we didn't make anything, so let's employ certain workers.
The second was finding the issues that are related to dates and amending them.
Then if this is the case, we need to employ five programmers.
If they work for two years consecutively they would solve the problem..
However, we have to expend 800 thousand dollars for them.
The third idea was changing the old computers with new ones.
For the long-term plan, this would be the convenient way.
And for this we have to expend 1.2 million Birr.
I presented these solutions for decision-makings.
They liked the last idea and when I came here they were changing the old computer with new ones.
Addis Zemen: could computer problem arise in our country?
Mr. Fikre: what was heard in Ethiopia was a little bit exaggerated.
There are very few computers like the ones in Ethiopia.
There are not many works that the year 2000 computer problem is related with.
Personal computer users would never face problems..
Perhaps small computers which were made of the old software's and if the number is two-digit, it will have problems.
But since the problem was identified eight years ago, it was resolved..
Since computers stated to get in to Ethiopia after the problem was resolved, There won't be any problem.
Even if the problem exists, it shouldn't be seen as a big difficulty.
Addis Zemen: what initiated you to do the Amharic software called the Geez font?
Mr. Fekre: The position wouldn't give me any other opportunity other than the one I have now, Manager of Management Information System..
The company which I administer operates six hundred million dollars per year..
And I thought it would kill my profession if I am inclined towards management work.
Therefore, I believed I was expected to do the technical and managerial work integrative.
And completing this task would ask for a little sacrifice.
And for sacrifice working eight hours a day is not sufficient.
At least it needs 14 hours of work a day.
So, I wanted to sacrifice a little and decided to do so.
When I thought about this, "why do not I attempt to create something helpful to my fellow people?'
I asked my self.
I started doing research in subject area about producing Amharic software – it made it easier for me to produce one.
It took me eight months to complete the work.
Addis Zemen: why did you give it a name Geez font?
Mr. Fikre: To my mind, Geez seems to me the father of Amharic.
Hence, it took a position that in order that Amharic software develops, it has to start somewhere.
I want Geez to be the basis for development..
Due to this I used the name Geez.
I used ‘font' because the entire technology I used are of font.
I believe that in order to develop the Amharic letter in line with computer, in most ways, it's the font technology that we should use.
Addis Zemen: how convenient are the Amharic letters to computers?.
Mr. Fikre: we professionals know the language of computers.
We are not linguists.
The question that may create problem for us is that which letters and languages should we accept?
These kinds of problems should be resolved by linguists.
Efforts are being made to create computerized standardization where all can use.
On the other hand, if linguists gather and standardize letters if would be easier for our works.
Unfortunately, we can create standards of letters.
We don't have the skills and professional efficiency.  .
Addis Zemen: how do you see our country's computer usage strategy?
Mr. Fikre: the problem we have in Ethiopia is the inability to use computer power appropriately.
If we buy computer to use it for writing purposes, it can be compared as buying and using truck for the purpose of buying a monthly expense.
This means we never use the power it has fully for services?
If we want it for writing purposes, it would be better to buy typewriter.
Perhaps if it gives writing service for eight years, it may be good..
However, as I see it, the majority of the people didn't get the service the computer could give.  .
Indeed, computer service varies according to the area.
If it is a small organization, you may study and examine about project provided you connect it to the internet.    .
You can put in place, software that can strong them your accounting.
Because the use of the computer means doing works efficiently which are repetitive.
It would avid repetitive tasks.
It helps to work efficiently.
If there is problem in accounts, and if handling money shows wastage, working procedure is chaotic, the computer could help it.
Because computer has a lot of numerical strategies.
As a result, organizations could avoid damages and bring about speedy developments.
Addis Zemen: It's said that computer aggravates unemployment; how far is this true?
Mr. Fikre: This is not a correct concept.
Computer service should go in balance with a country's prosperity.
If computer working strategy were to dismiss people from work, the computers in each organization would be able to dismiss many workers.
At the moment, the number of unemployed number in America is below 4.8.
It needs to be broadly aware of about the use of a computer.
The first us of it is to be productive, and increase production immensely, as well as avoiding redundant works.
This would enable growth at the level of a company.
It would prosper a country's economy.
When economy booms, the unemployed gets the work one wants.
Perhaps at one place, one person might be sacked.
On the other hand, at another place there'll be vacant places for five people.
When computer technology is expanded its impact on the economy of a country is immense.
Addis Zemen: what did you feel when you return to Ethiopia after twenty years.
Mr. Fikre: In the previous regime, every thing used to incline to politics.
Economic development was not seen.
I was obliged to leave the country then for there was no good condition.
But now economic development is underway.
This is one encouraging change.
Big institutions are being built everywhere.
This is an indication of economic development..
The company I work for is involved in construction field.
Addis Zemen: In which development field would you like to involve in the future?  .
Mr. Fikre: I saw many computer companies.
This has great contribution for introducing the technology.
I am thinking of coming to Ethiopia to invest money and do my level best.
I will share my skill and profession for my fellow people.
I have a plan to perform my share in the economic construction.
Together with other I am willing to create situations that would enable the country to develop.
I'm studying some situations to do this.
After ensuring suitable situations I will return in a year's time.
But now I came on vacation.
Yet, I'm doing certain things that are important and go back.
When the computer standard association was recently established, I contributed my share.
Addis Zemen: Do you have anything that should be given focus vis-à-vis social life in our county.
Mr. Fikre: First of all, focus should be given on being punctual, doing big or little tasks efficiently without erring and respecting work whatever kind it might be.
Canadians developed it as a common thing, and since it is crucial for development, it seems to me that it would be better if it is given focus here, too..
From Addis Zemen October 11, 1998
"In order to stop the emigration of wise men, the clergy requires caution."
The fact that the news of a reformation movement which was on a level of malicious gossip for many years, now being officially declared by the clergy is to be admired, it was disclosed that the clergy should take caution for under the camouflage of "reformation" wise men of Orthodox church could emigrate..
Last week in different tabloids, especially in the one named "Hamer", took up reformation monks who were condemned and among them there were insiders like "Aba Gerima Tesfaye" and those sides pointed out that Aba Gerima Tesfaye is the one who highly condemns reformers, respected, and in his teachings highly popular scholar among the Christian laity..
Due to this reason, Satan out of jealousy, acted upon him as is commonly known and considered him an enemy, otherwise we never doubt that he's not are former, they said..
These sides mentioned other spiteful news..
The enemy rumor went against the experienced preacher, Aba Wolde Tensae Ayalneh, whom the clergy as well as the Christian laity know very well, and referred him as a "reformer"..
But this Holy Father is at the moment teaching the good news in different states in American and has been a great support to many fellow Christians abroad..
His popularity has become world wide; his gospel teachings abroad have been recorded in cassettes and sent to Ethiopia, has been used by many Christians..
He's still in the service of the gospel, but the church and the laity missed him..
Our clergy should deeply look in to these godly people whom the church brought up with her discipline not to be victims of the enemy, he pleaded..
These several people of the Orthodox Christians' faith who assuredly described Aba Gerima's lives and his firmness in his faith and love said that there are people who have double-face like a bat, and who approach these people in different directions to that people who excel them in education and skills do not come out of the church to fulfill their nightmares, with the help of their supporters, contemptuously hoping they would be heard, in the pretext of helping the church, they wanted to hurt her, hence, the wise men of the church are expected to differentiate the truth from the take, sifting the straw out of the wheat..

From Fiameta June 30, 1999
Message of Fiameta
The Designating Feature of Democratic Government is its openness
A democratic government which is chosen by the people and which stands to serve the people has its aim to make all the works it does vis-à-vis political social and economic issues and the resolutions it pass clear to the people.
With authoritarian governments this culture is missing..
Whether the people knows or not, without consulting and informing the people, issues of a country and the people would be operational merely on leaders' will..
Due to this, most of the work couldn't give solutions to the people's burning questions and puts the country into a worst trouble.
However, in a democratic government order, not only is there any thing done out of the people's interest and will, but also both positive and negative issues that happened in the country would be announced to the people on time..
Since suppressing things that happened or undermining and misinforming are considered betraying people's trust, the democratic order oblige to put straight all phenomena without misdirection.
Government in consultation with the people would seek remedy for the bad situations on the ground.
Out of this, there's no mechanism where people cannot take participation in the matters that concerns them and to willingly accept whatever is decided by the leadership..
Unfortunately, the way things are done in Africa is to nominally accept democracy but not respecting human rights, which is the first chapter of democracy..
Although it's common to hear that the people elected their leaders democratically, the democratically elected leadership bodies soon prove, to be non-democrats with their deeds..
The leadership group in everything he does is not open into the people who elected it..
As soon as the African leadership bodies hold power, they pare theirs and their dears' future lives with the people's money, and so put the people into the abysmal poverty, turning his lives into hell.    .
When causes of the country's problems are pin-pointed to the people in the free press, the governments have an experienced culture of taking server measures on journalists..
Nevertheless, sooner the crime these journalists have been accused of would be uncovered and every time it's observed exposing each government.     .
In most respects the situation In Ethiopia is better than several African countries..
However, among the many missing things, the main one is that government doesn't show openness.
The situations happening in many national issues are concealed from the public or misinforming the public through government medias or even sooner the real situation would be exposed in detail by foreign medias and the people would hear it..
This operating mechanism that becomes common from time to time and which lacks openness makes the people to lose trust on the government..
Just before Eritrean government and EPLF leadership invaded Ethiopia, it was a recent memory to observe the former commanding Ethiopia more than Ethiopians do..
After the border conflict surfaced it was disclosed that the EPLF government was conducting spying information and fund-raising activities through its underground anti-Ethiopian organization.  .
Yet people believe that it would be difficult to say that government was unaware of it when the organization has been operating for a long time.

Since the recent clash in the Southern People Region between Gedio and Guditu nationalities and the resulting severe causalities and displacement was not officially disclosed, it has become the other issue that lacks openness..

So if government wants to prove the path it is following is really a democratic order we say that it has to be open in the first place..

From Ethio Sport January 9, 2002
The European Parliament Passed a Decision on Ethiopian's matter
The European parliament recently disclosed in the decision it passed strictly condemned the illegal killing, horror, imprisonment and kidnapping carried out by Ethiopian government and military, violating what is stated in the constitution as well as in the amended fourth Lome Convention of which she accepted;
Although the parliament appreciated the ongoing democratic process and structural change, it expressed its worries on the measures taken following this, the pressure and persecution on established and organized professional and public associations, Ethiopian Free Press journalists, Ethiopian Teachers' Association and Ethiopian Workers' confederation leadership members, most of whom were obliged to go in to exile.
Moreover, the parliament mentioned that the killing of Mr. Assefa Maru who was executive committee member of Ethiopia Teachers' Association and EHRC was very horrifying and has passed a 7-point decision with regards human rights condition of Ethiopia.
The decision were,
1. "Strictly condemns Mr. Assefa Maur's killing,
2. Strictly condemns all violations of human rights carried out by government and defense force,
3. Calls for immediate half for acts committed by the country's higher officials on Ethiopian citizens violating their basic human rights illegally kidnapping people relating it to political affairs, persecution, arrest and rape.
4. Asks the Ethiopian higher officials to accept the rights to freely express one's ideas fully, and respect citizen's rights to organize in associations and freely express their ideas;
5. Reminds the Ethiopian government to urgently release all political prisoners who were arrested as prisoners of conscience and for the judiciary body then to give free and fair judgment, taking measures of amendment.
6. Asks the European council, commission and member countries to closely follow the treatment of human rights condition in Ethiopia and report if any kind of improvement is seen.
7. The president of the parliament gave this decision to the council, commission, and Ethiopian government, United Nations Secretary and United Nations Human Rights Higher Commission so as to make them aware of the condition and be able to execute the policy" it stated.
It's to be recalled that European Parliament took similar decision on Ethiopia on July 18, 1996 pertaining to Ethiopian human rights violation and asking for constraint of the time and again persecution carried out on citizens.

From Addis Zemen June 3, 2005
Message of Fiamet.
You brought it, You Took it!
About two years ago there was one controversy.
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) put Eritrean and Ethiopian Economic Delegates on a round table and started a discussion.
The basic idea of the discussion was to propose that they use the similar kind t economic policy, and if this is not possible, stop using the same currency and produce their own each of them.
At the time Eritrea used to follow macro-economic policy, while Ethiopia, micro-economic policy..
Both sides didn't want to change their economic policies; or didn't agree to change.
So, they were obliged to take the other option of IMF.
This second option was for both countries to stop using Ethiopian Birr ... they agreed to produce their own currency.
Based on this, they produced and distributed their own currency, in accordance with IMF's order.
After this money was printed, it brought about another problem.
In Eritrea, great economic doom was to come.
Tension reigned in the border of Tigray and Eritrea..
In the new Ethiopian currency, a map that included Bademe was seen.
The economic problem of Eritrea was transformed to war..
In a few months after the publication of the currency, because of IMF and Bademe, war broke out.
And now IMF gave warning for both countries..
Unless they stop the war it warned that it won't give any kind of aid.
One of the instigators of the war was IMF.
Today, it gave an order that says "stop the war".
Since these countries are economically colonized in the eve of 21st century, they are going to accept the order..
As to us, what if we call IMF, mockingly the modern colonizer ... "you brought it, you took it ...".

Are Children of the Poor not going to learn from now on?
Costly School fees have been contentious..
It's planned to have them paid up to 8 thousand Birr in a year.
The decision to have students paid in addition to the social and political problems the Addis Ababa University students have, and facilitation have been underway so as to make those capable pay and those who can't would pay borrowing from the bank.
In the meeting conducted towards the end of last academic year at Business and Economic Faculty Hall, it was told that the issue of payment has been one of the very contentious ones that has stayed for long and even passed on to the new year, University students who are close to students' congress told our newspaper..
Out of the reasons given by those who explained were "Based on the free economic policy the government won't interfere in any other sectors except defense and Administration: and in order to go forward independently the university has to design its income sources; and in other European and African countries education is on payment basis; and that it opens an opportunity for those who can pay but couldn't learn, and to elevate the quality of education."
The students who brought this to our office disclosed that the payment would be varied according to the type of the course, and for medicine law and engineering, approximately up to 8000 (eight thousand) Birr may be needed for payment, and also explained that various questions were raised on the side of the students;
Since one out of the different taxes government collects form the public is expended for education, the reason that "In order that the university will have its own income" is not appropriate, told the students.
Comparing Ethiopia to Europe and their African countries and trying to do all things in accordance to Europe and America is not appropriate, for Ethiopia whose development is the least among the countries who are less developed, and whose people's living condition is low and whose people are suffering from hunger, and the students expressed that who are not free until they pay their debts, and it restricts the ability to further the education of the future intellectuals, expressed their opposition against payment.  .
This issue of costly higher education fee "out of the general public I stood for the 85% farmers".
A government that claims to follow a rural focused policy" and in a country where education has not yet widened planning such kind of policy would rob the educational opportunity of the majority of the farmers and the poor children of most people, it has been widely discussed.
With regards to the payment decided by the government, the congress who was said to be elected by students, is preparing to call a meeting and discuss with the general students community in the coming year 1998, the majority of students in order to express their opposition through open demonstration the students asked the congress to facilitate this, but the administration of the university is thinking of suppressing this activity, these students who reported the news disclosed..
Especially, the sidist Kilo campus has been the source of students' protest continually for the past and present governments and if pubic demonstration is conducted against the payment, the university administration is terrifying and threatening that the government is going to charge it, once and for all, to a research center, and the coordinators an supporters of the protest would be selected and only those who aren't would be assigned in the different regional institutions and learn, the students also mentioned..
These students who disclosed to our press department said that suppression and injustice, in the university has become increasing that those who are entrusted with authority are conducting atrocious embezzlement..
The embezzlement is conducted under the cover of food supply and they insisted that investigation should be conducted with those university authorities who are involved in this corruption..
The embezzlement has been going on in purchasing beet cheaply from debrezeit town from oxen that are slaughtered mainly for the purpose of research in veterinary science, rather than from the Abbattoir House but fraud it with regular purchase register; in purchasing expired and spoiled bread flour in cheep price but presenting a forged receipt for expensive price, in reducing some amount of fuel out of the fuel carriage, which is bought with lots of money for the purpose of the university vehicles, and selling it for an exchange of goods, not from those who win bids but form those individuals, whom the university purchaser and dean prefer..
The butter which has been bought with costly price was spoiled and proved to be inedible and was exposed, while the fuel that was reduced by these people from the fuel carriage was caught red handed just before it was about to go out of the campus, the informers pointed out..
While the individual who was arrested due to embezzlement was released in two months time an assigned in another work post is surprising, individuals who were suspected of embezzlement were relieved, and it was recently given press statement on the radio as if the theft was carried out by other individuals.

These "students" who were assigned in the university, not with their results, but with their contribution, have special "alliance" and operate in the campus during the vacation, it was disclosed..

Among the questions raised by the students, solution should be sought for students who came back after with drawing for a year due to sickness, for they are devoid of having food and accommodation services, and this working procedure created a lot of problem for students who are poor and that come form remote areas; the working procedure that make students disqualify without seeing their problems and reasons, for a year just because the time for registration has passed by a few hours or one day should be avoided, the payments students pay for appealing to investigate when wrong results are given to them should be left out; assigning students who have enough results without their interest and inclinations should stop; the university's administrative and academic working procedure should have clarity and stop talking about receiving this and that number of students each year just to draw donors of education, while half of the students are made to sleep on the cement floor and grass-mat, sending out half of them in the middle of the academic year deceiving mechanism of income – generation should stop; these are only few of the questions, the informers explained to our press office..
While the questions of university students problems and questions are then ones mentioned, the newly established students' congress in order to get recognition in foreign universities, was organizing students in tribes, strengthening EPRDF's structure in the university, and for this it was helping students to be members of their regional development associations, it was understood from the informers..

In Two Colleges and Alemaya University Dispersion was Don.
The Kotebe Teachers' College, Bahir Dar Teachers' college and the Alemaya Agricultural College which have for several years shown rapid progress with not apparent reason, their faculties and departments were obliged to stop and close the degree programs, become weakened as a result;.
In a report that reached us the agricultural economics, agricultural engineering and Forestry departments which are the backbones of Alemaya Agricultural University were decided to be closed as of 1998.
As the reason for the closure was not official, the fare of the lecturers who used to teach in those departments and faculties was also unknown..
Instead of the closed departments it was decided to start secondary teachers and Health officers training, the sources that reported to us disclosed.
the Alemaya Agricultural University which is the only agricultural university in Africa which operates with a lot of foreign aid, and its research center which was in Debrezeit town was given to the formerly known as Agricultural Research Institute and now Ethiopian Agricultural Research Organization, which shows that it is intended to totally devastate the university, say educational professionals, the animal science, which has been playing a great role in producing efficient professionals, is also encountering several obstacles, they said..
In a country where millions of tons of fertile soil are wasted annually, where the use of dam has not passed more than fifty percent, where one-third of the production yield is wasted only during harvest collection, closing the agricultural engineering department which was in Alemaya Agricultural University and stop producing professionals in this field is deliberately aimed at hurting the country, they criticized. .
The decision to close the agricultural economics department which graduated 1194 professionals in bachelor degree and 38 in master's degree in the last 35 years, has shocked many..
Although the Alemaya University and the Netherlands' Larensten Agricultural College in a study they conducted jointly in the 5 years between 1996 and 2000 alone 4 PH.D level, 117 master's level and 3590 bachelor and agricultural economists are needed by the country, the action of clothing this department has made many sorrowful.

The Alemaya University was established before 40 years and by now it has a staff of 28 doctors, 104 masters level and 21 bachelors level professional.

In the mean time, the Kotebe Teachers' Education college which has now 28 years of age since its establishment, has been showing rapid progress in our country, and finished its preparation to graduate trainers in Master's degree, it is now obliged to discontinue its first degree /bachelor degree/ program, its representation would be for Region 14 Administration, interior sources disclosed to us..
The Kotebe Teachers college has not only been limited to graduate teachers in bachelor of education but prepares training, sets formats and produces graduate teachers to the colleges which have been formed recently in the regions: Dilla, Wendo Genet, Nazareth, Technique College, Makele, Bahir Dar and others.
The institute used to graduate teachers in degree programs with Mathematics, History, Geography, English language and Literature as well as Ethiopian languages and Literature, in general with five departments including Health and physical Education, sources of the report disclosed..
For the above departments, preparations of material, building, human resources were completed by the college, sources disclosed.
The Kotebe Teachers Education College not only graduated more than five times in degree programs that had already been started previously, but also with the relations it has with an institute in Germany named Ho Ha Ho and the Homerton which is under British Cambridge University, sends trainers in scholarship with various professions to learn for Master's and PH.D degrees, and it was disclosed that there are some who are under their draining..
The college has more than 20 assistant professors and teachers with various years of experience, it was known..
Established in 1970 under Addis Ababa University, strengthened during the process of work and become independent, after which the teachers who graduated became fruitful and were praised, several professionals witnessed.         .
In relation to this one whose name need to remain anonymous worker of ministry of Education, in the letter he sent through our address suggested that the Kotebe Teachers Education is one of the first institute that covers 69% teachers' need of our country.
Last September 1997 when the college received degree students and continued its teaching process, the minister of education questioned "Why did you receive students while you're told it's to be closed?.
And without any study and meeting conducted and minutes held in the ministry, the program was discontinued just because she ordered "since it's to be closed, don't receive students", stated the report we have.
The injustice done to this college which fulfills very modern language and science laboratory and other necessary pre-conditions, and whose contributions to the country is so great, when compared to the "Ethiopian civil service college" and the two college and one university which were opened in Tigray, that were intended to train servants of the regime which is given great care and focus, the formers condition is very regrettable and history won't forgive such injustice, the reporter explained, and one of the reasons given for taking this measure was "Two institutions which conduct similar degree programs in one region (region 14) are not necessary." .

If any Ethiopian chooses another citizenship, it is disclosed that he/she would immediately loses his Ethiopian citizenship..
Ethiopian Deputy Police commissioner Major Alemseged Gebre Amlak in the interview he gave to the Vice of America on September 2 responded that according to the legislation passed on July 1930 with regards to citizenship on the day on Ethiopian took another citizenship, he/she immediately loses his/her Ethiopian citizenship.
The Major gave this resopnse to the question wondering whether most of the Eritreans who were evicted from Ethiopia have lived in Ethiopia for many years and are Ethiopians.
So why were they evicted, was the question of the radio reporter..
Responding as to why they were evicted, they said they were found operative forming clandestine political party and considered dangerous, evidence was also found that proved so, and their eviction was announced to the people..
Among the evicted ones, it was disclosed that there were people including priests..
Reasoning out their eviction, they assured that all of them were organized in groups under EPLF's underground organization, people's front for Democracy and Justice, were operating in various aspects, that is, in gathering information and propaganda work, and because this was proved they were evicted, they explained..
Although the Eritrean government is overestimating the figure in the media, the right number of evicted Eritreans, were only 5874 major Alemseged assured..

At least Let's honor the Current Legislatur.
As we are people of information anything said about information will concern us.
We followed last week's celebration of "Information Day" and what was said commemorating the date just like any other listener and reader, from outside.
Among the festivities presented to make the date colorful, was the symposium that evaluated the different looks of mass media.
But ideas representing the free press haven't been heard.
Even when they were heard, they were the ideas of few participant individuals.
This was because, they didn't want the presence of families of free press.
The "Information Day" which was said to have been organized integratively by Walta Information Center, Television Organization and Ethiopian science and Technology Commission, Opposition Organizations (at least which are said to be legally registered) and even the free press to which the date directly refers have been put aside, which Vividly points out whose ideas are boldly listened to and whose authority is wanted to be seen on the fore.
The drum that was beaten as "Free idea, Free Press, Free economy, Free election, Free Judicature," for democratic order has been clearly seen that it's used for the consumption of foreign propaganda so as to make sue the money from the International monetary Fund (IMF) and the world Bank comes.
What is amazing and sorrowful is to see the organization which claims to stand for the development of the country's science and technology, it victimized, otherwise, we know Walta Information Center and Television Organization.
It is not expected from the EPRDF's propaganda source, "Walta Information Center", which struggles to weaken the Ethiopian News Agency that has been serving the country for over fifty years, and is official News Source of the country, to have positive image for the free press..
Forum-84 which was established for the purpose of the new bureaucratic service, including the chairman by full of defectees of EPRP who were in prison and in the Dergue bureaucracy, we are not naïve to expect that it would be any different from the present Television organization.
At the time the "Information week" was commemorated, it's known that 18 free press journalists are in prison.
Nothing was said about them.
The International Journalist organization (            ) in the statement it released in 1997, that is, this year, categorized Prime Minister Meles Zenawi as one of the ten press enemies of the world.
This reality was not disclosed to the people who have been said so many things about them.  .
The ideas of political opposition organizations were made not to be entertained on the government mass media.
But for the sake of propaganda consumption, legislatures for working procedure of government mass media have passed on.
Next to the government media, the ruling party is trying its best to establish the monopoly of ideas by forming its own propaganda order calling them, Walta Information, Radio Fana, Abiyotawi Democracy, Efoyata, etc.
On the other hand, it opened a wide propaganda campaign on the free press.
All these problems were not mentioned on that date, "Information Day", which was praised a lot.
But in that forum, individuals who have been meddling all the way up to now, were observed to be seem critical, where we appreciated their ability to see the direction where the political wind blew.
If we get the opportunity our big question would have been, "the ruling party and the authoritative government, at least let them honor the legislature they passed on!" this was our question.
The Ethiopian Federal Democratic Republic Government in its Article 29 decreed that every individual has the right to hold on any attitude he believes in.
Nonetheless, individuals are chased by being called OLF, AAPO, and EPRP.
We think that being an OLF, AAPO or EPRP means holding to one political outlook.
We can't see why it has become a reason for being taking to custody or killed.
Leave alone other things, free press journalists are made to be arrested or accused for the ideas they put on their newspapers and magazines.
But according to the constitution and press low the free press has the right to get information.
But the door that takes to the information is sealed.
In the rights to hold and express ideas freely mentioned under the constitution, article 29 sub-article 6 "the sanction on the right to get ideas and information could be operational only by laws that are asked on the products of attitude can not be obstructed.
"A clause that says like that is written.
The free press journalists, however, are even now are being arrested and accused, by the opinions they wrote (even in opinion articles), of "troubling the ideas of people".
When government realizes that there are problems in any life sectors it passes on problem-solving legislatures.
We know that there are several problems around press that do not help the development of press.
Yet, if not passing on legislature and solving the problem, the previously decreed legislatures which are operational should be honored.
Leaving alone what is being done in other countries like subsidizing and reducing tax for developing press which may be done only for friends, we say let the pressure and arrest stop..

The teacher of the Book was told that at first since he had not been presenting his job without sufficient reason, his December salary was suspended, but within a short time, his salary was released, yet a last warning was given stating that he should be working at any position the parish administrator usher deacon assigns earlier, it was possible to understand from the report..

From Fiameta September 25, 1998
Statement Given from Ethiopian Federal Democratic Governmen.
Since recently the instability that lived quite long and the disruption of learning-teaching process occurred, government has traveled a long distance to listen to the students' request and respond to those proper ones, it was disclosed in mass Medias.
Having listened in detail to the questions students forwarded, a discussion was held between the Ministry of Education and Student representatives in order to identify the proper and improper questions and agree on their remedies.
In the discussion held between government and the students, government accepted questions which it believed were proper..
The government proposed remedial notions that it believed to solve the problems raised around the administration and, more or less, agreement was reached on all issues.
At that moment the question that had not been resolved and didn't reach agreement with the students was the urgent pulling out of the security police of the University, and even for this, it was not without remedial suggestions, although the students were observed pushing hard without displaying patience.
While government proposed remedial suggestions that answered students questions and indeed that would satisfy students who wanted to scrape their administration problems, this remedy, however, could not be accepted by political organizations that held their own political agenda behind the students, and for few students who marched off determinedly.
These political organizations and some students who were members of them considered the temporary problem that was created in EPRDF as lasting weakness, planned chaos and lawlessness to rule over..
Therefore, the result was, through few students and mainly through the leadership of the city's hooligans, they attempted to carry out the herd activity and widen unrest in Addis Ababa city..
They considered that government doesn't have the diligence and preparedness to take legal measures and involved in activities of disturbing the peace of the people.
The Ethiopian Federal Democratic Government has never retreated from entertaining any proper question that is presented legally.
And even after this it would never fail short of its effort to entertain legal and proper questions.
However the government wouldn't accept any attempt to benefit out of chaos, in a misunderstanding of situations, with a baseless hope of assuming that EPRDF is weakened, and instigating disturbance and violence.
Since the prior task of any government is to maintain peace and stability, it won't pass with negligence the creation of disturbance by political organizations or some students who follow their suit and the violence instigated by especially city hooligans..
Due to this, Federal (government) decided to take strong and lasting measure on groups who disturb people's peace and security and incur damage on people's and government's property.
Based on this, the Federal Police is ordered to take all the necessary measures on illegal individuals who disturb people's peace and security.
The Federal Democratic Government strictly warns that students who are found at any edge of the country, especially higher education students, apart from presenting their questions, if they have some, in a legal and orderly fashion, if they try to incur damage on people's and government's property by them selves or in collaboration with other illegal bodies, the responsibility is theirs and theirs only.
In the mean time government warns political or so called human-rights organizations who operate to instigate chaos, being defeated by student's question, to be reserved from such acts..
Ethiopian Federal Democratic Governmen.

From Addis Zemen April 19, 2001.
The New Generation Leaders Who Were Looked Forward to Change Africa are Said to Lose Track
The deterioration of the successful relationship that never seemed to be shaken between Ethiopia and Eritrea has been shadowed by the intervention of World Soccer Cup that was looked forward to by many people around the world.
After the game resumed, however, we started wondering what Satan interfered between AddisAbaba and Asmara, what exactly was the wrong thing that happened?  .
For the last recent years, the two rations' leaders drew many news agencies and medias, as many adjectives of praise were attached to them: clever, open, organized, determined, proud, and on the whole, they were elevated as young.
Eritrean President, Isayas Afeworki and Ethiopian Prime Minister Meles Zenawi were regarded among the new generation progressive African leaders.
The new-generation African leaders include Uganda's Yuweri Musevini and Ruwandan Paul Kagame.
People considered the leader of Democratic Congo , Lore Kavila, too, in this category of leaders.
Nevertheless, since he now couldn't go along with his partners in Kampala and Kigali, he was said to be dismissed from the group..
These new leaders have no doubt drawn the attention of other African peoples out of their respective land.
Whenever Yuweri Muserine speaks before Kenyan people they used to shower him with admiration.
Last year President Moi had not always been at ease when Congo's Kabila was mentioned due to the clashes between the change seeking rebels and government police.
In the national press, they wrote articles, in comparison, what happened to the ex-dictatorial leader of Zaire, Mobutu se se seko may happen to Moi if he continued on his stand and do not amend the constitution.
Besides, some opposition party leaders coined him a new name, Moibutu.
Just because Moi was very angry at the press, for they compared him with a dictator, he denied the criticism openly when he made a speech to the public..
Among those who put great faith on the new generation African leaders, were leaders of United States of American and South Africa.
These governments have widely talked about the resurrection of Africa through these leaders.
Although genuine political observers were worried by the fact that people's hearts were melted through these talks, i.e. these leaders becoming Africa's saviors, the shocking incident for many people was the war that broke between Eritrea and Ethiopia..
Evaluating it now, there is no doubt that thee new-generation African leaders have transformed the former ways of coming to power and handling issues in the leadership.
President of South Africa, Nelson Mandela in a recent conference of African leaders in Burkina Faso, questioned the significance of the legislation of Organization of African Unity that forbids one country not to interfere in another's internal affairs.  .
Governments  are expending the highest budget from their budgets in order to fight back internal rebels.
On the other hand, the clash between Asmara and Addis Ababa presented an Achilles heel for critics of new leaders to say that they are very quick to act militarily for political problems.
I my self was a big supporter of Musevini, but when I heard him repeatedly saying he's going to wipe away Joseph Konin and Lord Resistance Army, I lost my hope in him.
The recently appointed Kenyan government officials, especially those of them who have been for the last 3 years, said that President Moi moved a lot better democratically than the new leaders.
However, Moi has been in a state of high pressure, especially, from the donor group.
Presently, Kenyan political pundits and the civil society leaders are found in a stage that leads to a process of forming democratic constitution.
Even though confusion ad disloyalty rules over the practical process, we are moving, using the true Kenyan figure of speech, towards the solution.
We don't hear our people talking about going to the bush, rather is discussing about the means and ways to rule over democracy.
Commentator: John Giton.
Director of African Strategic Research Institute .
From Fiameta July 10, 1998
The Memory of "Roasted-Bean" Student
The orbit of the countryside student's memory draws even that of the city ones astonishing like a bolt from the blue transporting it to the place where it belongs.
The life of countryside means more than anything for the roasted-bean student.
The translation for the book, the lesson for the church song, the skill for poetry, localities like Dima Debrework...Axum Debre Abay...Zur Amba Bethleham Wadla...Chegodi Lij Anbera...Gunj Washera...all these are the learning and graduating places for the roasted-bin student; and these universities of roasted-bean student are found in the country..
While attending his classes, the roasted-bean student had so many memories, out of which we present the following for today..
The "student" never always lines mocking at people with his Amharic poetry..
Sometimes he, too in his turn, would be taunted at by his teachers.
He is a student who came from around Washera have been learning "usage of letters" and poetry of Washera from master Gedlu to learn the poetry of Wadla..
He was skillful.
But what good does this bring? He has a habit of theft..
He picks up whatever he gets (on his way).
Do you know how many students "leather grain bag" he ransacked, he might not he identified.
A lot! He's surprisingly strange..
He had "looted" from his earlier school, too.
What's surprising was his had already heard about it.
So that's enough.
His wise master Yared decided that he should leave before he infected the school.
Cause he was sick and fired of his theft..
He had him called and said to him "My Berhan , Go the your family, the education you got is sufficient...after all... with a diplomatic language."
He responded, "...Ok, but let me stay for a little while...until I finish what I started and learn grammar usage, but the master said, "No, No, what you learned...suffices you...and as I heard from your friends, you used to be good at it, in Washera, too".
Hey, you have finished all of it here...so go to your place.
And he had him take his departure.
He, too, understood.
On the morrow he packed off..
But such student of bad character is rare to find. .
Well, the roasted-bean student's goal is to widely learn the word of God..
And the majority of the students are dedicated to their cause..
In order to learn the gist of the word of God as it is taught in various localities, he raves from on place to another. .
So are many who remain at where they went..
While some of them give service in the skill they've graduated teaching the word of God to many, others travel to "remote end of the country", got married and live there, getting rich or poor without seeing back to his birth place..
There are even some who through others, turns as bad as can be even while he's at school.
Yes, the one who sees this and the futility of the world leaves school "run away" and would be shattered in a monastery..
While for others their parents expect to "see them reach some place and be somebody" they, contrary to their expectation, would suddenly come home turned monk, having his cap on his head.
Some of the cases are heart-breaking.
It's depressing..
He'd be caught by a certain kind of illness or suffer from contagious disease, and "perish" in a foreign land.
The mother who heard here son's death after a number of years in a fire accident while he was in his class, yelled in regret "I sent him to Washera to have him learned I heard he became sharp and fired" expressing metaphorically..
Except very few, it is customary for the majority of students not to tell where they came from and their names, in good times, let alone when they're ill..
While his name at home was "Biyazin Destaw Azmeraw ...charges his name to "Ezra Sutel Elias ..." when he is enrolled in school.
Worst of all, the mischievous student makes his name complicated when one ask him "what's your name?.
He'd say "Telgel Telfelsor".
When they mischievous student sees especially the innocent country side peasant found it difficult to pronounce the name, would laugh uproariously..
Even though the student laughed at times with certain occasions, deep down his heat he has sour grievance..
When he sometimes had nothing to eat, or a dog chased him from the house he stopped by to beg for food, he desperately longs for his home which is full of everything; his heroic father, his sympathetic sister and his mother who often cries her heart out for him it is then that he sits down lost in thought, "I wish my mother saw, I wish my sister saw when a dog chased me for a slice of breads"..
Humming away to him in tears..
Yet, when this student sometimes wants to beg for a slice of bread, we saw him doing funny things..
Was he teaching wisdom of switching a time of difficulty to laughter and systematically pass it?
Who knows? .
... Let's add for you another theater, in the country side, "come, and going round" means return after short time..
Or come later.
Just as we say "Go around and come".
One day the student went out begging, and he reached just as the griddle, disc of day in which bread is made was put on the fire, and the disc was not heated enough..
He begged, standing in front of the door.
The woman looking at him said, "Hey, student, the disc hasn't yet heated" she said to him.
The student responded "But you're heated and you can listen to my question.
The woman, who was wise in the language, and understood his mischievous ness, responded shortly by saying "OK, student, until I bake one or two bread go around and come".
The student didn't go any where, but he turned around his face and entered the house facing his back. .
He didn't realize the presence of her husband..
"What do you want?" shouted the husband at him.
"Your princess told me to turned round and enter..
The student replied.
But the student's humor didn't work out that day.
He didn't meet an innocent laughing farmer..
A trouble has come..
The farmer hit the student severely.    .
One day this farmer and the student suddenly met in a big wedding..
The student harbored the grudge against him..
But the farmer didn't take the student in to account..
He forgot it.  .
What angered the student most was this..
His belittling him..
Leave alone the others..
The student was not even considered an enemy...the feast of dining and wining went on at about evening, all become drunk,
Dancing and war chant had started.
When one took his seat the other stood to dance.
When one sang uproariously the other war chart.  .
All showed his bravery by displaying patriotism through war chants..
Everybody boasts war chant to show one's patriotism. .
The student had to display patriotism today.
He thought.
At least he had to show off his "brevity" through chants.
But then ... the farmer is a strong man.
What if he prodded him by provoking?
He was frightened.
He was worried.
When the student repeatedly said to himself "whatever comes" and sipped the local beer, he became drunk..
His small heart which was filled with fear suddenly enflamed with anger and regret, the student..
All of a sudden... , he said "I the hero, servent of the master," and stood up. .
People started listening to him attentively. .
Touching his upper garment made of tanned sheep skin with his stick he went to the crowds and got in the midst of them, starting his war chant.
"I the hero" said the student.
"Hurray! I the student, and hero, yes, a hero
Whose armor the poem, his whip the hymn book.
The gateway of the church, his den
The leather bag, his shield, the book of psalms its necklac.
Prayer his bulle.
Never surrenders in desperatio.
When a priest is troubled, people yell
Loots remain of food one and all
Who were there on the day of the memorial feast for the dead?
People like melkamu, Mamaru
Servant of the master who wears the hymn book
Never fears death, the student..
He said, and sat down.
It's all over; he said it all and got relieved..
But the audience up roared over him..

In order to give finality to the border controversy between EPRDF and Eritrean government the international tribunal that was seeing the case is expected to pass on a resolution in the coming February 28/2002.
In a related development, the security council of the United Nations ordered the two countries to accept unconditionally the resolution passed.
In its regular session on January 15, 2002, the Security Council, it was also possible to know that the Security Council assigned delegates that would execute the resolution of the international tribunal.
This team which was led by the Norwegian born ambassador Ali Peter Kolbay is said to make the EPRF and EPLF government give it their last assurance for accepting the resolution passed on by the International Court a week before the latter makes it officials, that is on February 21, 2002.
The resolution which this International Tribunal Passes on not only would be the last and necessarily going to be implemented but also the international community would give it full support, the written message that was read in the meeting of the Security Council disclosed.  .
After the border is demarcated on the map, by he international commission, the hammering of the "peg" on to the actual ground marking the positions would follow, it was pointed out.

Ethiopian living Abroad Have Made Great Demonstrations Protesting Against EPRD.
In demonstrations conducted in Ottawa (Canada), Washington DC, London (England), Haig, Brussels, Sweden ...etc. as it is necessary and in different ways expressed their strange protest against TPLF/EPRDF saying that racial regulations should be reversed so as to cooperatively protect our country from EPLF, that fellow people who were kidnapped and whose address is not known should be disclosed, that chasing away oppositions, terrorizing, killing, kidnapping and torturing them should be stopped, and similar banners were carried and statements were shouted on the streets.
According to Hawarya who closely followed the Canadian side of the process and execution of opposition process in the great effort the coordinating committee made on the date (July 7/1999) in Ottawa, many Ethiopians who came from various places participated in the demonstration.
In this Ottawa demonstration youngsters participated widely, while the encouragement and strong participation and mothers and sisters showed should be mentioned here.
The demonstration was accompanied by police, carried slogans and banners, at times shouting the statements, colorfully passing in front of the Canadian parliament, then to TPLF/EPRDF embassy office, crossing the main road, keeping traffic regulations many by stander Canadians receiving leaflets and reading the slogans and even some of them joining in the demonstration by holding slogans, taking to the coordinators about the aim of the demonstration, showed their support by giving different signals.
As soon as the Ottawa demonstration was over, Ethiopians living in Ottawa held a reception to Ethiopians who came all the way there from other areas.
These Ethiopians living in Ottawa invited to their reception starting from an organization, who requested them permission for demonstration up to security – related preparations, including the peaceful participants in the demonstration, not only left them with appreciation but also, proved that there are Ethiopians everywhere who would spend their time and money for their country.
In the journey that was going on to Ottawa from various places, and in its return journey as we observed that of the Toronto, the continual agitating songs, and chanting and brotherly, sisterly love that was in the rented big bus was unforgettable.
At this time, as it's heard from most of the Ethiopians living in Diaspora, the fact that TPLF/EPRDF is not using the historical coincidence to reconcile with the people and opposition and not being ready to defend the attack waged against the country; in addition, the fact that it gave verdict of up to 20 years imprisonment, the fact that, as we heard recently, the renown medical scholar and founder and president of All Amhara People's Organization, professor Asrat Woldeyes, being behind bars for a long time and after having been tortured, though he was allowed to have medication, couldn't survive and passed away ...etc.
These all are proofs that the TPLF group can never be and want to charge and correct mistakes, they said.               .
Hence, such kind of opposition demonstrations and the struggle that goes on at different angles would be expected to go width and continuity.
Those who supported and are thinking of supporting when the "country is said to be attacked by aggressors" have now become hopeless and discouraged to the political measures TPLF had taken and is taking at the moment, this has become known to all..
From Fiameta July 28, 1999
Properties plundered by Illegal individuals are being returned through police search
Many people and government's properties which were illegally plundered the day before yesterday are being returned in different districts through police search.
The ENA reporters in their observation at district 2 and 5, they have seen police having the looters returned TVs, Decks, video cassettes, radios, watches and shoes from Anbesa shoe store.
And sieves of hold and various tools of jewelry stores are being under control together with criminals through police search and informants form the community.
In these districts dwellers are leading their normal lives in a stable situation, chairman of district 5 Miss Meseret Bekele and chairman of district 2 and sub district 13 Mr. Jenberu disclosed.
Police is having a tight security in every place, it was disclosed.
Similarly, the disturbance and plundering that occurred the day before yesterday in Addis Ababa by few students and hooligans was completely controlled yesterday and the people are leading their daily lives, the city is also in perfect stability.
According to the Ethiopian News Agency reporters' observation the day before yesterday there was great plundering form government and private properties, and seeing such kind of plundering was not a very common act among Ethiopians and there told that it's indecent.
From Addis Zemen April 20, 200.
In the Election Held in Somalia Region the Incumbent party is leading
In the election held last September 3 in Somalia region for regional and council of representatives, the incumbent party is leading, the electoral board disclosed.
According to the disclosure of the electoral board yesterday, out of three parties and privately competed individuals 23 seats for council of representatives and 168 seats for regional council, 470 candidates had competed.
Based on the result so far attained, the Somali People Democratic Party (SPDP) is leading in all the nine election zones, the electoral board told..
Out of the 1,150,000 people who was registered to vote in the region, were than three-fourth gave votes and the participation of the people in the election was great, explained in related news.
From the start up to the end, the election process didn't face that much problem, some observers told.
It was possible to know that in the election in both councils the Somali People Democratic Party presented 191, the United Somali Democratic Forces, 123, the West Somali Democratic Party 81, and privately 156 candidates, totally for 191 seats 551 candidates were presented. .
In the mean time, in two election regions of Gode zone, United Somali Democratic Forces (USDF) and Somali People Democratic Party /SPDP/candidates won, the zonal electoral board coordinator Mr. Wondwosen Wube disclosed last Monday..
Out of the five election regions in the zone, the results of the three regions couldn't reach the zone due to communication problem, and hence, was not possible to make winners official, Mr. Wondwosen mentioned.
In the two election regions were counting was done, the winners would get acceptance if the National Election Board receive and approves, the zonal electoral board coordinator explained.
Form Addis Zemen September 6, 200.
A call has been made for Opposition Organizations to Form A coalitio.
A War is being set on Fire in Afar
-Tension due to Arrest in Asab – Concern in Asayt.
Recently a conference on peace and democracy has been conducted in regional and zonal level, where leadership reshuffling was said to occur in Afar, and where ARDUF, the opposition activist leadership members, were said to have come to the peaceful forum, redundant clashes are taking place in the region in a short-time, and Asaita town is being protected by machine guns, it was disclosed.
After the clash in Afambo and the president, Mr. Ismael's residence had been hit by a launcher grenade, Asaita town was attacked in a week's time, where electric light and communication were also disconnected..
Asaita town residents who were concerned about this situation, few of them went to Nazareth town while most residents, assuming they could be attacked at night in their homes, started frequenting to stay out to the fields at night, it was disclosed.
The clash between EPRDF army and ARDUF forces are spreading to other areas and war is being set on fire, it was disclosed.
In the mean time, the EPLF army which happened to be in Djibouti was seriously attacked by ADRUF and FRUD coalition operation, so in order to strengthen its forces, it recently conducted mass arrest in Asab town.
On the other hand, the Afar Revolutionary Democratic, Unity Front (ARDUF) and the Sidama people Liberation Front (SPLF) leaving aside the separate struggle that they used to conduct, for it didn't help any good except elongating the minority national ruling class who claim to rule Ethiopia in the pretext of Federal regime, integrate their forces and agreed to struggle in coalition, and disclosed this to others calling all opposition political organizations to join their coalition.
The chair persons of the two organizations Mr. Mohammed Gaaz and Mr. Wolde Amanuel Dubale recently have met in London and signed a agreement, releasing a mutual statement saying that maintaining the existence of each organization, they expressed they have reached a mutual agreement to form a coalition between Afar and Sidama peoples, together with the rest of Ethiopians so that the country could be saved from racial politics and dictatorial regime of one political organization.
The two organizations were able to reach this agreement: .
1. In order to peacefully resolve the problem created in the country, the separate effort they made was given a response from EPRDF that showed force and didn't want to open doors for peaceful negotiation;.
2. The suppression and intervention TPLF/EPRDF regime is making on Afar and Sidama people's political, cultural and economic life, there has been found no other alternative to keep the legal and self-protection right of the two people, from the perspective of the present practical situation; ARDUF and SPLF, integrating the political, diplomatic and military struggle of Afar and Sidama peoples, and in order to keep their national and democratic rights, they believed to form the mutual cooperation.
3. ARDUF and SPLF agreed to resolve any misunderstanding between the two people peacefully and strengthen their healthy relations.
4. ARDUF and SPLF agreed to recognize the two people's right of self-determination and respect their democratic rights.
Both organizations took the multiparty political regime in to consideration, and through peacefully resolving misunderstandings with all democratic and national forces of the country, have reached a mutual consensus to oblige the dictatorial regime which held power in the country to subdue to all-embracing elected government which can be accountable for democratic order and the people.
5. Both organizations believe that the constitution that was drafted by EPRDF and put operational doesn't have power distribution and it's led by Stalin's ideology, reflects a one-party dictatorship.
We realized that the principle of self administration that was said to be given to the regions is indirectly fenced by the ruling regime, hence, it couldn't make it control the government which is in power.
Therefore, both sides understand that the constitution which is operational at present doesn't reflect the basic rights of citizens which is decreed in chapter three and doesn't have an order of free court of justice, which opens doors for human rights violation and killings of peaceful citizens..
6. ARDUF and SPLF strongly condemns the TPLF/EPRDF divide-and rule policy and the distrust that is wanted to spread among Ethiopia people, and in its place, they facilitate the situation where all Ethiopians could live trusting one another and in brotherly cooperative spirit..
7. ARDUF and SPLF request to urgently leave the areas the Tigrean forces who camped in Afar and Sidama, who have been instruments to elongate the years of the ruling regime, and are suppressing the peace, humanity, freedom and democracy of the people and human rights violation.  .
8. ARDUF and SPLF make a call for all political opposition organizations which are struggling for true democracy, the right to self-administration, subduing to the rule of law and peacefully resolving this understanding, to stand by their side.
9. Taking in to account the complicated situation the controversy of the country brought about, ARDUF and SPLF call for the international community to stop, for the time being, the comprehensive aid they offer and listen to the shouts of Afar and Sidama people who are found in a tormented and oppressed situation.
The two organizations request and remind the international community especially countries which have diplomatic and economic relations with TPLF/EPRDF to put pressure on the regime so as to make it respect the basic human rights of its citizens and resolve misunderstandings through peaceful means of negotiation rather than through force..
From Tobia October 30, 1997
690 Ethiopians Entered their Country from Asmara, 220 Eritreans were seen off Through Rama
690 Ethiopian civilians who were in Eritrea entered their country, Ethiopian Red Cross Association Tigray central Zone Branch Office disclosed.
Head of the office Mrs. Roman Zemichael expressed yesterday that the Ethiopians entered Adowa coming through adiquala, - Rama.
Having been identified by the international Red Cross the returnees entered their country, Ethiopian officials received them the head of the office told..
It's known that last February 17, 2001 488 Ethiopians returned to their homeland in a similar way.
In a similar way, based on the request they made to go to their country, 220 Eritreans with recognition of the international Red Cross, were seen off through Rama. .
Ethiopian Red Cross Association, secretary of the Adigrat office Mr. Berhane Alemu disclosed that Eritreans who were seen off to their country were 155 from Tigray eastern zone and 65 from Makele.
The secretary who reminded that the Eritreans were seen off for the sake of a nation's security, they were living peacefully using their wealth and properties properly and with their human rights kept, before their journey they sold what's to be sold and, what they wanted for themselves, kept with then and went to their country, the secretary disclosed.
