From Fiameta April 29, 1998
242 Eritrean war Captives Returned to their Country  .
In the agreement reached between Eritrea and Ethiopia, 242 Eritrean war captives who were kept in Dedesa captive Center started to go to their countries yesterday, the International Red Cross Committee disclosed.
The captives who started from Dedesa yesterday morning would reach Dangela when the night fell and pass the night there, the committee disclosed.
The Eritrean war captives who are traveling being supported by the committee, keeping their human rights and given the necessary care, would pass their country's border the coming Sunday, the committee disclosed.
The information that came out from Dedesa captive's center recently showed that 54 Sawa trainees and old-timer EPLF soldiers, went to Yemen, Germany, Italy, America an other countries, on their own will.
Based on the question 220 Eritrean put forwarded to go their country, last March 1, traveled with the recognition of international Red Cross, the committee also disclosed.
From Addis Zemen March 9, 200.
The Secretary who Looted the Cathedral's Money was again Exposed to Crime.
Deacon Haile Ghiorgis Mamo who took 6500 Birr but never retuned to the church, flew to another church and was again exposed to crime in the church were is working as a secretary, it was reported. .
Out of the 6500.00(six thousand five hundred) beer he took from the cathedral, the secretary returned only 1000 Birr, denying the remaining? It was decided in a court session held on March 5, 1997 that he pay the 5500 Birr he hasn't returned yet, and 300 Birr loss, although he hasn't paid as yet, for he kept low profile in the place he took a transfer.  .
His not paying the money brought about many disputes among many innocent fathers, observers told. .
The Addis Ababa Office of preaching assembly wrote a letter ordering deacon Haile Ghiorgis to return the money to the cathedral, and Afe Memhir Haile Marim Gebre Libanos was suspended from job the following day after this letter was written..
The story didn't end here, on December 27, 1998 he took 260 dollar and 450 Birr that was given by laity who made vows, making use of the chaotic coincidence but when the church administrator asked him, he replied I forgot it at home in my pocket of the clothes I have just changed, and I will bring it tomorrow; later he pleaded to deacon Fantahun Mihret not to expose him, but later falsely accused of the controller, deacon Fantahun, of taking the money from him, misleading the office of preaching making the controller to be suspended form job, bringing misery to both people, the report explained..
The secretary who's said to be smart aleck and has the ability to tie him self with higher bodies and who undermines preaching assembly of Petros we Paulos whom he work with as well as the secretary at times put his signature on documents even while the official is around; he's so money-minded, and due to this he asked bribe from the contractor who does lament work and statue, and forbid him his contract money for not giving him bribe, although after so many up and downs the contractor's share was made to be paid, the report pointed out..
Because this secretary is known its demagogue nature different misdeeds, the administrator of the church and the secretary of the preaching assembly suspected that he might destroy documents and as of June 12, 1998 has sealed the office, although the secretary hid and come to the office on June 3 at 5 o'clock in the morning and removed the sealed paper and attempted to take various documents when suddenly caught red-handed by the church security guards, went to district 25 police station helped by police offices, it was known..
But according to the observers, due to the special relations the secretary had with Aba Gebre Michael and Mr. Yared the salary for Deacon Haile Ghiorgis was raised by 173.00 Birr and reached 763.00 Birr, though the budget allocated for the secretary of the church was 590.00 Birr; yet, he was not satisfied with the favor he received and his remaining discontent is regrettable, they said..
There are commentator who say "Before the tear dries".
Haile Ghiorgis Mamo's friendship goes as far as the patriarch, and at one time relying on the patriarch's friendship, he had a confrontation with Aba Gerima, in which case the latter sent priest Haile Ghiougis to some remote areas as a demotion, and wandered for almost light months; Aba Paulos, whom he relied fully couldn't save him, as the Ethiopian saying goes "a donkey's husband doesn't save the wife from hyena"; so the secretary who was told not to repeat such misdeed and returned to his work, was again into it before the tear dried, which was shameful act, concluded the commentators.
However the Secretary once again on may 29, 1998 his where about was not traced after he had taken 100 dollars which was given as vow offering, in a pretext of exchanging it into Ethiopian Birr, insiders are telling..
Since the church's preaching assembly was aware of the Secretary's lack of skill and ethical problem, it suspended him from his work and salary..
Other commentators suggested that it's unthinkable for a worker who took 5500.00 Birr of a church and was not requested to be suspended form his work and salary: for if there were a judge he would have returned the money he took.          .
From Fiameta June 24, 1998
The Board Postponed the time Table by a Month when it would make Election Results Official
The Ethiopian National Electoral Board decided to postpone the time schedule by a month when it would announce election results.
Acting Registrar at the office of party Registration, Mr. Makonen Wondimu disclosed that the board postponed the time schedule in a meeting it conducted yesterday;
The reason as to why the time table was postponed was because the board believed that it needed additional time to add up the election results of higher educational students from the various polling stations and make it official.
Besides, in order to investigate and identify the complaints and petitions presented from different parties an finish all the election procedures and make official, it has found it impossible with the previous time table, it was disclosed.
Therefore, in order to make the results official on a national level, the previously schedule June 9, 2005 has been postponed by one month, and it has disclosed that results would be announced on July 1 2005 in all the country on a board level.
The board extended its time schedule based on the amended election law proclamation 111/87 and proclamation 438/97.
More over, Ethiopian electoral board announced that out of the total polling stations, it received temporary results of 515 polling stations.
From Addis Zemen June 4, 2005
The commission gave Response to the Question Raised Vis-à-vis Eritrans
We talked to the pertinent bodies of Office of the commission about Eritreans who used to work in United Nations African Economic Commission but now expired.
The responses which were given to Fiameta for the questions we raised would come out in our coming Wednesday edition, but the questions we raised are published in this edition believing it may serve for awareness.
United Nations
African Economic Commission
A.A subject:- Asking about details of Eritreans who used to work in the commissio.
1. Is it possible to have the names of 27 Eritreans who used to work for the commission?
2. Does Ethiopian government have the authority to expire these Eritreans, for they work in the United Nations organization?
3. Staffs of the United Nations should work free from politics.
Nevertheless, it's known that Eritreans who work in ECA were working form being a member of EPLF up to Chairmanship of Eritrean community.
Knowing all these, why were they kept in ECA?
4. It has been in the legislation that administration workers of United Nations should be employed form the incumbent country.
However, up to recently, Eritreans were kept in their positions in administrative works at ECA.
Why?
5. Instead of returning him to Eritrea, why was chairman of Eritrean Community Mr. Mesfin Haileselassie was with ECA cooperation, sent to Nairobi?
6. After 15 days Mr. Mesfin Haileselassie left the county, it is known that his office was opened by a security group led by the Nigerian Olo Kodana..
During this time Eritrean name lists and other documents written in Tigrina language were found.
What does your office know about this issue?
7. The money Eritreans who work in ECA have in Ethiopia has said to have been transferred to ECA account after they have asked for it before a month.
How much is this true?
8. Would Ertreans, who have now been sheltered in some embassies and are going to be evicted, go to Asmara or to the country of their preference.
9. Would Eritreans be transferred to similar offices in an optional county or would be expired after offering them their service remuneration.
10. Is there any way ECA could prove that these lists of Eritreans who were now said to be evicted are really Eritreans?
If there is/are individuals who were falsely claimed to be Eritreans, could the organization defend them?
We thank you in advance for the cooperation and answers given to us.
Dawit Kebed.
Editorial Chairman

The Relics that were taken from St. Mary Lideta, Church Disappeared
One Tablet of the Law was Under Police contro.
The unique relics that were taken at different times from the sanctuary of St. Mary church by the officials of the church office, threatening the head of the treasury house of the sanctuary had disappeared, it was disclosed.
Among these priceless unique antiquities, golden mantles, silver sistrums, silver prayers sticks, written documents made on parchment, are found.
In a pretext of borrowing them for the wedding ceremony of the secretary of the sanctuary, Deacon Fisseha Kidane kal, several expensive and modern carpets had never been returned, the report from the area pointed out.
The illegal acts and theft performed in the sanctuary are by now being exposed, and in this shameful act the secretary and including these "so-called controller" and financial bodies seem to not only to be suspicious of being drowned in to it, but are surely told to have been taking part in it, it was disclosed. .
The report explained that from those spouses that grew up from childhood up to the age of marriage in a pretext of "the wedding certificate price, 3000 (3 thousand) Birr was stolen illegally, and had been the cause for the failure of the spouses chances to go abroad; in general it's from this sanctuary that such despicable looting was conducted.
The spouses believed that they must take the wedding certificate from the church "that we grew up and got married", but it was despicable to see such shameful and unclean crime committed by officials who were given responsibility. .
The spouses detailing the injustice committed up on them requested the church to pay moral compensation, paying the money that was taken from them illegally, while the secretary was sent to prison but after a while were released on bail for the long sickness together with the shock he got made him in severe health crisis, it was disclosed.
The secretary who was said to have had many changed in the court was called "thief! Thief!" by the people around the area the court while appearing these, the news that came from there pointed out..
The report which expressed that the secretary had for long stopped going to his office due to sickness, also pointed out that although the office of National Preaching in a letter written to him by No. 8030/28/99, July 31, 1999 requested him to hand over the seal of the office, he declined to do so.
As a result of this exposure of financial and property embezzlement all the pertinent necessary offices of documentation are still sealed.
The area Christian laity and priests unanimously agreed to have him "audited" where as there are still positions taken to "have him audited by government auditors".
As the embezzlement of Lideta church's finance and property have become aggravated from time to time, as a result of administrative deficiency there are priests of the sanctuary who are striving to take the case to the legal institution and take the necessary follow-up, but the secretary's group are heard to have made an attempt of attack, and are said to have plans to do so now, it was disclosed.
After the new preaching forum and administrator started strict control, it was unbelievably witnessed to have gotten 280,000 (two hundred eighty thousand) Birr only in a month time, which surprised many.     .
The secretary as well as its groups whom the income have stopped coming, are trying to hide their wrongs, that had already been obvious to all, and are now in public attempting to connect the case with politics irrelevantly, are plotting to accuse the rest, the report explained..
In the mean time, it was disclosed that one tablet of the law was caught jut before it was sold by district 22 police.
While nothing is known as to where the tablet of the law came from, the person who was in possession of it and the tablet of the law were caught by priests of the Lideta church and district 22 police force, had stayed for some time in district 22 police station, and were sent to central police investigation and coordination office, the news that came from the area disclosed..
Up to the time this report was organized, nothing is known as to what happened to the tablet of the Law that went to the central police.
Nonetheless, since the individual who was said to sell the tablet of the law by 70 (seventy) Birr was caught red handed, observers said it was a historical work..
From Fiameta August 25, 1999
Meles Zenawi presents a 32-page report today.
Prime Minister Meles Zenawi of EPRDF government presents a general quarterly report to the council of representatives today.
In this 32 pages report although it may not be so different from his previous reports, it's disclosed from the report that we got that he wanted to put pressure on some decisive issues.
In the report he presented the opposition parties and the free press under the same heading, he stated that his government plans to perform an integrated work to create a better relationship his government has with the free press..
"In order to make the free press operate under the law and order of the regional governments and as to what kind of measure the government should take a wide study is bring underway..
To study the positive and negative sides of the free press, identifying the ethical behavior of the media, why and how the laws of the country are violated and how should they be respected, a wide work is being conducted.".
Says Mr. Meles' report, "...we believe a conducive environment would be created to strengthen the press which play constructive role and correct or sift those which have destructive aim and mission."
He said.
With regards to the army that would be reduced, the report stated that it had successfully conducted the army force human resource reduction plan. .
In order to make the remaining force combat efficiency and preparedness excel more than any other time, make its outlook according to what government intends, the conducted evaluation and training bore fruits, it was stated.
As to reducing the military and housing problem and the building of contingent force, a study is nearing completion, it's stated in the report.
With regards to foreign relations, one of the issues the report mentioned was the case of Djibouti. .
The relations the country had with Djibouti was good but in the midst of continuing friendship, some problems have cropped up occasionally, the report disclosed..
Unless the root causes, of these problems have been identified, government is aware that they could develop in to a dangerous characteristic, it's underscored in the report.
The Somalian situation which is related to terrorism has been widely included in this report, "Unless terrorism is fought with determination, peace won't reign in Somalia," and continued, "except trying to bring peace in Somalia, it's impossible to fight terrorism permanently an in a lasting situation..
It said.
"If the international communities have the interest and capability to do away with terrorism from Somalia, we believe that a much more fruitful work could be done with fellow Somalians and the surrounding counters.
Hence, Ethiopia in her capability to make IGHAD's decision practical would be willing to work cooperatively with all sides..
Said the report.
The report that raised certain issues regarding Ethiop-Eritrean relations, praised the ongoing debate that is conducted at international level.
The report that praised the contribution of historical searchers who are friends of Ethiopia, also mentioned that, "we have contracted the lawyers with lots of money who bore fruit representing Yemen" during the time of Yemen and Eritrean border conflict, the report disclosed. .
In the report that would be presented in the parliament today, other than the MPs, Ethiopian government ambassadors and diplomats who are currently attending the meeting in the ministry of foreign affairs are expected to participate, parliamentarian sources disclosed..
From Tomar January 29, 2002.
Ethiopian Unity Front Released a statement!!
Ethiopian Unity front (EUF) announced in the statement it released on March 9, 1998 that it is a coalition front formed by EDFC, Benshangul Peoples Freedom Movement, one wing of ‘Kefagn' (that's ‘Kefagn' peoples Patriotic Movement).
This front who's led by the secretary Mr. Mersha Yoseph and announced by various national and foreign media, released a statement vis-à-vis the coalition..
Based on the release of this statement which came out on March 5, 1998, it's at present engaged in killing injuring and taking captives soldiers in gorilla fighting, confiscating different automatic, semi-automatic ammunitions and other important materials..
Three comrades were killed on the side of EUF while other 4 were injured lightly, it said..
In addition this statement explained that most of the fighting's were conducted in Gondar region, Chilga district.     .
On the other hand, the newspaper which comes out every two weeks and the gazette of EUF, Admas gazette, in its 2nd volume No. 4, April 8, 1998 edition, disclosed that Ethiopian Unity Front Support an Aid coordination committee are devotedly doing their activities elsewhere..
Based on this, the support and Aid committee which is found in Netherlands (Holland) made its statement official..
According to the explanation of this committee...the solution for the severe problems our people have, at the present as well as in the future is undoubtedly when the kidnapping and suppression stops and ever happens, the equality of all Ethiopian people is assured and their rights respected..
And this calls for bitter sacrifice...first of all, those who sacrificed their precious and only life for their cause and those unique Ethiopians who will sacrifice have special responsibility and duty for Ethiopia and he children, and concluded its statement by questing "A promise is a debt of faith and not of a father or a mother"..
Although continued statements are being made regarding the Ethiopian Unity Front, no response has been given by the government..
Except that occasionally government bodies say that this is a rebel activity; there was no time it gave recognition to Ethiopian Unity Front..
Ethiopian unity front has for the first time revealed its military activities with the help of photographs.   .
From Fiameta April 29, 1998
Editoria.
A New Direction in a New Year
Today it's the day the Ethiopian New Year, 1990 begins and from now on we will be saying farewell to the year which we call "the old year", 1998.
When we feel that we are now in the New Year we should also feel how much we lagged behind the other nations.
In a normal chronometry, today we are eight years back.
However, this has been the result of our calendar.
When we look at it from the stand point of our real existence, what should worry us is our remoteness in light years in comparison with those who reached great development stage.
23 years ago today the military forces that shook the government of HaileSelassie I, they officially disclosed that more than 100 thousand people died in Wollo and Tigray due to drought and famine that resulted from drought. .
After that we all started exposing the flaws accusing the regime.
Add this continued for long.
If it was according to what we said, if it was in accordance to our accusations, there wouldn't be famine any more, and even one citizen wouldn't have died as a result of lack of food.
Yet, around 1984 – 1985 that same guest, drought visited more than 9million people..
It brought along with it a special kind of disease called "Ergotism".
Once again, we became proofs for the international philanthropists of famine propaganda, once again for the routine poverty.
At this moment, we are in the hands of another government. .
When this government came to power, it vowed not to see famine..
It bragged to show to the world Ethiopia's prosperity in crops, the land's blessing and its natural endowment..
In fact, it was broadcasted before the world as having brought about results within a short period of time..
But the reality on the ground shows that millions of Ethiopians are dying from drought and famine.
"From now on guns would be changed in to plough "it was said.
Nevertheless, we still have clashes and civil wars.
As we see it from the main report of our newspaper, although they say "its peace", children of the country are dying from war that is hidden form the people.   .
Why?
The death-toll in drought, contagious diseased and others such as malaria and those who are terrorized by lack of peace are countless.
Out the 57 million Ethiopian people, perhaps for few of them a reliable shield may have been built against famine and disease.
But the majority of the Ethiopian population is the victim of the famine, disease and war.
So, it's naïve to think that the Ethiopian people would have something to hope for in the New Year..
The term Ethiopian people doesn't refer to the few, modern city dwellers.
When we say Ethiopian people we don't mean those government officials who work at Arat Kilo, and live at Bole district.
These do, by no means, represent the majority of the Ethiopian people. .
At these places, champagne could pour out, whisky could be drunk, and an ox could be slaughtered. .
If we try to measure the living standard of the majority of the population by this scale, it would be a sin.
Because the Ethiopian population has for ages been put down, suppressed and suffering and even to day didn't say "enough"..
It's a population whose throat always dry and famished..
As if this were not enough, its national dignity, whom it relies on has been violated and vanished, and his hope is being robbed from him..
Even Ethiopianness which is his last public pride lost value..
While the conditions are not as such commendable to say "A good year has come" out hearts would fill wit hope when he hear that there are fellow people in some places who shout for unity.
We are pleased to see the work-lover people of Gurage coming to unity, humiliating the "children" who were saying "we're not Gurages" and disturb the peace.
On the question of whether the people of silte is Gurage, or not, the people chose to be unified rather than divided.
The people of Gurage taking the Ethiopian flag as the sole embelm raised a principle named "in unity mutual development".
It's for all a gesture of good example.
When we hear and see government mass media that used to spread the poison of racism among people yesterday, are now condemning "narrowness and racism", we came to understand that the seed of unity the united forces planted and developed stated producing fruit..
Therefore, we celebrate the New Year watering this good seed and promising to bear more fruit.
In a spirit of national reconciliation, let's bury racist politics and hatred, and stand united on poverty, famine and demagogue.
We don't want any of our fellow individual to wake up suddenly in the middle of the night with a dying hope, and with a departure of good feeling.
One should not continue cursing itself, "I'm destined to ..."
Instead, as of today he has to struggle to take his destiny in his own hands, to make his country his own, to decide his future life himself.
There's no other mundane fore that wipes his tears, amend his hope.     .
Anyway, Happy New Year.
From Tobia September 11, 1997
Our Youth Team Passed for the World Cup in Argentina; An Important Milestone is Registered.
The Ethiopian Youth National Team Yesterday defeated South African team at Addis Ababa Stadium in a wide margin 4 – 1 holding first position in its group and assured that it has passed for Argentina's Youth soccer World Cup.
Our Youth team has succeeded in achieving its goal of passing for the semi-final for the 12th African Youth Soccer champion through the goals scored by Hussien Seman and Yordanos Abay in the first half, and Zewdu Bekele and Ashenafi Girma in the second half..
According to the decision of the African Soccer Federation (CAF) to cancel Cameroon's and Egypt's results and replay to defeat one another, on Saturday, Ethiopian Youth team bet 4 to 1, that is, defeating by 2 more goals, in 4 points and 2 goal difference, it stood first.
At the same time, in a match held between Egypt and Cameroon at Abebe Bikila Stadium, Egypt beating 3 to 1, passed for the semi final being 2nd from its group..
Mr. Melaku Petros representative of Federal sport Commission, Mr Tsehaye G/Egziabeher, leader of the team, Mr. Tamene Yerdaw, assistant coach of the team, coach of South African team, Captain of the team, Defyalew Tesfaye and Ashenafi Girma whom we talked immediately after the game said they were satisfied on the results achieved and happy and thank the Ethiopian people for its co inexhaustible moral support it renders for it enabled them to become successful..
The fair decision of CAF not only showed its good heartedness for the development of football but, above all, it made us get the opportunity to pass for world Youth Soccer cup, said Mr. Melaku Petros, and continued that the result is critical to the country's football development and heartily thanked all who helped and supported for the success of the competition, and the people.  .
The Youth African Coach on his part said except that the air was heavy, they didn't face any obstacles and he didn't regret his team didn't pass for semi-final..
He was satisfied with the support the spectators gave them and then he passed his congratulations message to the Ethiopian people. .
Foreign journalists and experts who followed the games, from the stadium pointed out that Ethiopian team got what it deserved and found the support of the spectators fantastic and wished our team reached for the final cup..
The spectators in the stadium and the people who were following the game on television came from different quarters and gathered around the stadium expressing their extreme joy through dance, music and cars' horns, lighting cars and waving flags, turning the city in to jubilation, the whole evening.  .
From Addis Zemen March 27, 2001
Sudan Government is to file Charges Against Ethiopians who kidnapped Airplanes..
The Sudan government is to file charges of being terrorist against five Ethiopians who kidnapped one Air force Airplanes while it was having local flight, obliging it to land in Sudan, according to Reuters..
Reuters quoting Al-Anba daily Sudanese newspaper from Khartoum, in the report it broadcasted the day before yesterday, the kidnappers would also be filed charges of putting in danger the lives of peaceful citizens..
The Sudanese Foreign minister, Ismael previously told that according to the agreement reached with the kidnappers, the charges would be viewed in Sudan..
The minister was heard being quoted that they may home death sentence, the report reminded..
The report also disclosed that Ethiopia asked the kidnappers to be given to her.
It's to be recalled that the five kidnappers after having obliged the airplane that was having a local flight on April 26, 2001 landed it in Kartoum, released the people on board and gave themselves up to the Sudan government..
From Addis Zemen May 15, 2001   .
There's Worry Ethiopia Might Lose Abay Due to Algiers Agreement .
After the Ethio-Eritrean border conflict that lasted over two years was completed with military victory of Ethiopia, the Algiers agreement that was signed in the hope to bring lasting place is said to put at risk Ethiopia's ownership of Abay.
The Ethiopian Democratic Party (EDP) in a statement it gave regarding the public demonstration it called on Sunday February 11, 2002 at Masqel Square from 9:00 o'clock on wards, stated that if the agreement is not finalized soon, it could be considered as giving in Abay just like that of Asab, it said.
Since the Ethio-Eritrean peace agreement signed in Algiers, capital of Algeria in December, 2001 mainly rested up on the 1900, 1902 and the 1908 colonization treaty Ethiopian and Italian governments singed, it gives away Ethiopian's benefits, and, hence, signing, this document knowing its repercussions, said EDP's statements, put in to question its sympathetic feeling to the country.
In addition, the Algiers agreement quoted from the treaty make between Ethiopia and Italian governments, so the EPLF government could not negotiate on them; the treaties were made under the compulsion of the Italian government and not under equivalent benefit, they do not have acceptability in international law; besides, they were violated in 1936 due to the Italian invasion and based on the peace treaty Italy made in 1955 with the winners of World War II (America, England, Russia) she promised never to claim Eritrean as a colony and, so since they are cancelled, they are considered dead and buried, they said.    .
While those who gave responses to the raised questions in the press conference were higher officials of EDP, they stated that if Ethiopian agrees to be governed by these out dated laws in front of the international community, in the same token, she would be obliged to do so with other treaties for it was not only with Italy that she signed a treaty in 1910, they said.
TPLF/EPRDF is bringing out treaties from the grave which Ethiopia signed under compulsion and trying to give them legal basis, and especially the treaty Emperor Menelik signed with Italians in 1910 was the main source of their concern, EDP stated.
The treaty that was signed with the former colonizer of Egypt and Sudan, England, decreed that Ethiopia can not work any thing with Abay river without consulting Sudan and Egypt, and if EPRDF gave Asab with the 1902 treaty, it cold be realized now that the question of Abay would be the next thing under consideration, EDP higher officials said. .
The officials who gave responses for the questions raised during this press conference pointed out that since the United Nations decided Eritrea to unite with her country with federation in 1950 and based on the decision reps of Eritrea passed on in 1962, the federation decree was violated and Eritrea's issue had been decided to be incorporated in the unified sovereign state of Ethiopia, so all the treaties the Algiers agreement mentioned do not have legal basis, they explained.
For the question that reminded that the former government fought more to the land than to the people with regards to Eritrea, they responded EDP's focus was to bring the people with its land to Ethiopia, it was disclosed.  .
EDP holding this stand point continued the agitation it started to carry out a public meeting on February 13, 2002 at Masqel Square. .
From the Press February 6, 2002
The Patriarch continued Dismissing People out of Wor.
One Holy Father Too Encountered Suspensio.
The suspension of former holy fathers from their jobs as it is, the patriarch has continued dismissing more people from their work..
Sources quoting Holy Father Melake Aba Mihret Yimer stated that he has been brutally treated, inflicted injustice, suspended from job and when he appealed, nobody heard him for half a year now, and unfairness imposed upon the church by the patriarch still persists, explained the sources..
Melake Selam Aba Mihret has been working in different capacities and responsibilities for over 20 years and has been Chief Administrator in many churches; he was suspended from his 40 years church service by this patriarch, he explained..
The main cause for the suspension of this Holy Father from his work was the claim that an ascetic who criticized the patriarch was allowed to teach in the church whom he served as an administrator, and the suspension was enforced on him from the letter written by Nazreth clergy..
However, the chief Holy Father of Nazareth town, Nebure Ed Kifle Yohannes Mekonnen, disclosed that he took this measure of suspension on the Holy Father under the influence and command of the patriarch, and when Melake Selam Aba Mihret came to appeal to the patriarch, he wasn't welcomed; it has now been eight months since he was suspended. .
The cause for the tightening of the suspension after the patriarch discussed the issue with the chief Holy Father of Nazareth was believed to be his dire hatred to the ascetic..
Although the patriarch closed his doors over the suspended Holy Father, the administrator is still begging to be considered, he pointed out.
However, the efforts have been in vain..
We found out that measure of suspension took upon Melake Selam aba Mihret Yimer, who was transferred to Nazareth St. Gabriel from Addis Ababa, just because he was accused of not controlling the ascetic, reveals the patriarch's hatred to the ascetic..
Any way the 50 year old Holy Father have been a victim and his suffering as a result of the patriarch's hated to the ascetic.
These sources clearly stated that the patriarch is avenging his hatred of the ascetic on the poor administrator of the church, Melake Selam..
Melake Selam who was suspended form his job since March 1998 without having other additional reason, except that the ascetic were free to teach in his, church, has been continuously appealing to the patriarch at his place, though of no avail, internal sources reported. .
From Fiameta October 21, 1998
Twenty-eight MPs are to Leave the Council  .
In their representation by the people about twenty-eight MPs are to be ousted from the appointment they were given in the council, sources of the council disclosed to Tomar newspaper.
According to the sources, these EPRDF members whom most of them have first degree were given examination and after passing it they were needed to work in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and in various embassies.
Among these members of the council who are to leave their seats in parliament and to work full time in government work, Mr. Belete Rada, Mr. Yohannes Ginda, Mr. Ibrahim Abdela (from OPDO); Mr. Abdulaziz Ahmed, Mr. Shemsedin Ahmed (from Somali), and Mr. Denberu Alemu (form Southern Region) could be mentioned; it is also disclosed that there are two individuals from Gembela region and three people from TPLF.
According to the close sources to the issues, these members of the council were made to leave for they were recently raising strong questions regarding the salary of the MPs; and to avoid them in case they would bring forward other questions in the future.
The measure that was to be taken therefore, on these members who are believed to have better education was to remove them form the parliament and give them increment in the office of the legislative body so that they would keep silent, it was believed.
Those who see the measure that was to be taken in this perspective showed that while appointees in the office of the legislative, body get increments and high salaries, for MPs salaries are no made to improve and as recently questions have been raised a round this issue.
In a meeting held a week ago in one meeting of the council, this issue was raised; that the salaries of ministers who are also MPs are high; that ministers whom they appointed goby cars while these members do not have vehicles were said to be raised.
At that time, the House speaker Dawit Yohannes told them that the Ministers can get high salaries for they are workers of the office of legislative body,
To this remark of Mr. Dawit Yohannes some MPs suggested that either the ministers work in the parliament as well as in their ministries and let us get whatever benefit they get, in an equivalent level, or assign other professional people in their place.
At this time the house speaker Dawity Yohannes retorted, "We are elected to serve the people, but we didn't come here in search of money" it was said. .
In response to this speech of Mr. Dawit, one parliament member fired back, "If we came here to serve people, we all have to pay equal sacrifice," at this time the house speaker's temper flared at the meeting and said, "If at all I resign from this council, I would live by driving taxi," at which point the participants laughed.
It is to be recalled that his Excellency Mr. Dawit Yohannes used to live in driving a taxi while he was in the America at the time of his struggle.
Although it's not known whether there would be another election to substitute those members whom EPRDF is to take out of the council, according to observers, the EPRDF members who are needed to stay in the MP are those whose educational level are not more than diploma level.  .
Most of the MPs of EPRDF members who came form the regions were workers of agricultural development, elementary school teachers, farmers and small business people, the information available indicated according to the sources these reports..
From Tomar January 22, 2002
The Calf that got used to Sucking ...
The Eritrea's Red Sea Corporation was asked to pay in dollar... in Eritrea, tension still reigned
The Red Sea corporation or better know as 09, Eritrean business corporation won the bid to buy sesame from Humera, but while asking to make the payment in the "old" Ethiopian Birr collected from Eritrea, the pertinent Tigrean officieals requested the company to make the payment in dollars, ruling out acceptability, it was disclosed.
The company in the preceding years made several Ethiopian business people out of the market, by winning the be same bid for buying, amassing of lot of profit and the Tigrean officials ruled out this year's bid not only because they wanted to have them paid in dollars.
It is because they were annoyed to see this agricultural product that came from Tigray being exported preparing it as it came from Eritrea, and the Tigrean officials took this measure to punish them, our reporter from the area disclosed.
As the disagreement the bid created hasn't settled up to now -- the authorities of the Red Sea company, not only tried to convince the economic officials of Tigray but are trying to persuade the central government officials, while the issue was referred by the area people as "the calf that got used to sucking ......" quoting Ethiopian proverb.
Earlier it was reared to bring controversies for the fact that Ethiopian officials said the business transactions of the two countries would be conducted through dollar, white on the Eritrean side they had a strong interest that the transaction be through Nakfa and Birr it was to be recalled.
The statement both country's national bank governors gave to Reporter magazine showed that these was a wide difference between the officials of he two countries.
While the Eritrean officials and their consultants stick to "Nakfa" and "Birr" as means of exchange between the two countries, the Ethiopian National bank governor held dollar as a medium of business transactions.
On the other hand, the case of almost 3500 Ethiopian youngsters that were kidnapped from different towns of Eritrea at midnight twenty days before (most of whom were Tigrean nationals) hasn't got resolved.     .
The whereabouts of the youngsters not known after they expressed their opposition at Sawa military training center.
Their parents, forming a committee, put forward their appeal to Tigray administrative officials..
Although the Tigrean administrative officials had already made a secret arrangement to discuss with Eritrean government there has been no result yet.
Many believe that the youngsters were either put behind bars or else were made to work on Aligder Farming gathering cotton with a Serious army encircling.
Our reporter disclosed quoting some parents that there were some children who were attacked by gun fire shot from EPLF soldiers while they were attempting to escape, and they are worried.
The other news that reached as, was that a radio reporter in Asab town killed a colonel, who was his boss.
The assassinated colonel was the area commander-in-chief.
The operator was instigated to kill his boss due to his boss' receiving a message to conduct a military campaign to put the area youth in a mass arrest, take them to military training, and disarm the area farmers, which annoyed the operator, it was disclosed.
In order not to subdue himself under the hands of EPLF security forces, he immediately killed himself.
In the mean time, Eritrean accused that Sudan Army planes crossed the border and conducted an attack.
Sudan on her part said that in order to fulfill America's mission, apart fro helping oppositions, Eritrea sent infantry and her mechanized army, too, to the south, disclosed recently.
Since Eritrea didn't find enough to help oppositions only on the eastern front in her campaign towards Sudan, so she sent several army and artilleries to the South, Sudanese chairman of the Security and peace council, General Mohammed Abdella disclosed recently to "Akber Alyoum", his country's newspaper.
Eritrea, on her part, the Sudanese warplanes crossed up to 10 kms through gash and Setit districts, attacking the area.   .
Moreover, the Sudanese oppositions have widened their differences, and this created a problem for Mr. Isayas for not going his way, which is the other problem of Eritrea.
Sudan is investigating the opposition movement that had started in the western lowlands of Eritrea so that they become victorious over EPLF, there are some elites who are heard "... (Eritrean National Coalition)..." should be formed..
Among these Eritrean elites one of them was Dr. Tesfaye Medhane who was present in the annual festival Sewrawi Bayto prepared and presented a research paper highlighting the importance of the coalition. .
However, the organization which arranged the forum didn't accept the idea, the Indian Ocean Letters recently disclosed.
Sewrawi Bayto in its own paper, "Eritrean Newsletter" disclosed that it supported the establishment of the coaliton, but then, didn't want to work cooperatively with factions who made their aim the establishment of Islamic regime.
The national council which has been led by Abdela Idris, and the Islamic group that has been led by Arafat are operating as members of the coalition, Indian Ocean News Letter, mentioned.
The other thing that made Sudanese case difficult for Eritrea is the passivity of Ethiopia.
The anti-EPRDF government force are strengthening on the side of Sudan border, so it took out certain number of troops from the border area, while the activities of Sudan Embassy in Addis Ababa, has showed improvements.         .
The Sudan Club that is situated around Sarbet area has been opened and started to be functional, which could be one indication for this, as some said.
This change of stand is believed to be the main cause for the disagreement between the two countries;
On the Southeastern side, too the area that connects Tigrean and Afar Regions has been an obstacle for peace in Eritrea.
While there's an occasional clash with EPRDF army, priority is given to those who do not accept being Eritrean, the activity which is going on around Afar area.
The area is also dangerous for EPRDF, too, for they previously had had mutual military campaign but without getting results.      .
Among the different efforts to abort Afar activities recently, Ethiopia and Eritrea made a mutual military training.
In the man time last October 30, 1997 Yemen warned Eritrean government to stop the searching for natural gas.
According to Reuter's disclosure, it was the Yemeni foreign ministry that sent the warning to Eritrea.
The Yemeni Socialist Party newspaper, "Altawra" on its pat disclosed that the organization which signed a treaty in search of natural gas was ANGASO, the American National Gas Search Organization.
This organization whose lead quarter is in Huston, got a permission to search natural gas on an area on nine million hectare width, at the moment is digging three wells to start its activities, the Yemeni government warning expressed;
the Eritrean government hasn't said anything about the warning writer by Yemeni government.
It was disclosed that Yemen won't accept the decision given by the International Tribunal on the petition for Hanish Islamds and it is mandatory to prepare for war, conducting agitation under ground;
And internally, in Eritrea at this moment the Eritrean people is expressing its hatred of Mr. Isayas' regime although it doesn't get a forum that enabled it openly express its ideas, fade up with the unsystematic mass arrest of the youth, the bombs the oppositions blast in towns and the country.
Different sectors of the community are leaving the area heading towards Ethiopia and Sudan, which was part of this hatred;
Isayas Afeworki who was tensioned by these repeated crisis, had a mild surgery in the United states and came back to Ethiopia, where he has been in hiding from the public since then, which created various feelings among the public.
Although Mr. Isayas, was believed by all, to have been in hiding due to health problems, it's not known as to what kind of ailment he has?
There are some who said he had a mental sickness.
Mr. Issayas had arranged a forum always on September to answer questions that were said to be raised by the people.
But this year, the questions were raised but they haven't been responded, which exposed him.
Besides, the man is said to have secretly gave abroad for medication.
Some observers said that the right time for Isayas to leave power, by what ever yardsticks, is now, nonetheless.
Others, are questioning that due to his dictatorial characteristics, who's going to substitute his position?
They are worried that in the race of substituting him, could create a greater problem.
Especially, now that many observers fear that the difference that has been forcefully suppressed in districts and religion could burst out.
The fact that there is no opposition that may topple EPLF from its power and could lead the country, is the other problem, as some observers disclosed..

From Menilik, January 18, 2002  .
Three Ethiopian Business organizations who are Engaged in the private Sector Got International Award
Three Ethiopian Business Organizations who were engaged in the private sector got international award prepared by International Research, Business and Technological Efforts Expansion advancement Organization.
The organizations that got the twenty-seven annual award that was given in Germany, Frankfurt city last Monday, March 4, 2001 were Bahir Dar Tour and Travel Agency, Africa Insurance Company Share Company and Aleto Lucks Import and Export Organization.
Among the criteria these organizations met were customers' needs, satisfaction and healthy guest entertainment strategy, as well as Information usage, and analysis method are included.  .
Mr. Wondwosen Lakew, Manager of Bahir Dar Tour and Travel Agency, yesterday disclosed that since his tour and travel organization offered the proper entertainment to tourists who came to Ethiopia, the tourists didn't present any complaints to their country's travel agency when they returned.
The manager also disclosed that the other criteria their selection was Fesort Hotel, the hotel which the company at present is building for the purpose of giving services to tourist and its status as international standard..
As the German Voice Radio disclosed the day before yesterday, the three Ethiopian Organizations were chosen in their miscellaneous public services an in the midst of economists they were given the awards, mentioning that they met the requirement of the quality standard of the International Awarding organization and were found excelling their competitors. .

On the Ethiopian side, the enormous aid provided by the American government is still continuing..
