From Fiameta October 21, 1998
Individual who were Caught transporting Heroin were Charged.
ENA – Four foreign nationals who were found transporting dangerous herb called appeared in the Federal Higher Court First criminal bench Court of Session.
These accused individuals who were nationals of Nigeria, Togo and Tanzania were caught and arrested at Bole International Air port last years for they were found having more than 3, 800 gram heroin, the Prosecutor General pointed out..
All herb transporters tried to pal the heroin by swallowing a package that was prepared for this purpose and especially one of them tried to pall swallowing 1520 gram, it disclosed..
According to the prosecutor General's description it was understood that among the accused individuals, three of them were transit passengers who were traveling from India by Ethiopia Airlines.
But the one who possesses the 1,520 grams of Heroin started form Holland and when he reached Bole Airport he was caught, the file of the charge described in detail..
The Federal Higher Court First criminal bench Court of Session that was held on last Friday ordered assignment of translators for the accused and gave an optional date for December 2, 1998 to investigate whether the Court of Session has authority or not to view the case..
From Addis Zemen December 2, 1998
Injured Armies Promised to Fight against EPLF /Shaebia/
The abrupt war that broke out in three fronts in May between Ethiopia and Eritrea was the cause for hundreds of people's death; since the two countries accuse each other of initiating the clashes, border tension has been aggravated, and although both countries agree through U.S. mediation not to conduct air-attacks, CNN reported that there is  clear that fighting on the ground may continue; in the mean time, formerly injured armies have be registered to go to the war-front, the report stated.
The CNN reporter who broadcasted this news from Adigrat on June 23 stated that the civilian-targeted air bombing by Eritrea took the lives of 48 civilians, killed hundreds of elderly people and injured ex-combatants, and this filled them with rage and initiated their patriotic feeling, register and go to the war again.
A government official form Adigrat district by the name Andualem pointed out that out of the 500 volunteers registered, only 200 of them were not granted permission for they didn't qualify, while the remaining were allowed to join, the report stated.
Injured ex-combatants with mental impairment and those in wheel chairs also asked to be granted permission to defend their countries in the battlefield, but since most of them didn't qualify, permission was not granted, and hence, become sad, the report added.
In Tigray, many considered it as their own war for they felt as if their friends deserted them.
CNN reporter quoting officials told that pride in the nation-nationality has been strengthening and thousands of ex-combatants have voluntarily joined, took a second time training and went to the front.
"I've never expected to fight again," said Gebre Amlak, filled with anger, who lost his left leg in the fight that took place in 1988, and he continued, "but now I'll fight because this situation calls for prompt action and I'm prepared to give not only my right leg, but my life, too," CNN reporter concluded quoting an ex-combatant..
From Fiameta June 24, 1998
Sudanese and Djibouti Leaders passed a Message of Condolenc.
Oumer Hassen Albeshir, Sudan Republic President and the country's Defense Minister Major General Bakri Hassen Salih expressed their deep sympathy on the death of Mr. Kinfe Gebremedhin..
In the message President Hassen Albeshir for Prime Minister Meles Zenawi and Major General Bakri for Deputy Prime Minister and Defense Minister Tefera Walwa Sent, they expressed that they heard Mr. Kinfe's death with great shock.
In a condolence message the president and the defense minister sent, they reminded that Mr. Kinfe contributed greatly with regards to establishing security and peace in the two sisterly countries..
In the commiseration the Sudan President and minister of Defense individually offered, they expressed their sympathy Mr. Kinfe's family and fiends as well as to all Ethiopians over the death of General Manager of Authority for security, Immigration and Refugee Affairs.     .
Moreover, Djibouti's president Ismael Omar Gele expressed his deep sympathy to Prime Minister Meles Zenawi over the death of Mr. Kinfe..
President Ismael in his commiseration expressed that he heard the sad news of assassination of Mr. Kinfe who was General Manager of Authority for Security, Immigration and Refugee Affairs..
The assassination of Betrayal on Mr. Kinfe who was a great servant of Ethiopian government, and whom he shared great friendship with, has been a shock to Djibouti's President, Foreign Affairs Ministry disclosed.
The president expressed that with his efficiency and loyalty, Mr. Kinfe would be greatly missed, the president expressed..
President Ismael disclosed that whoever knew Mr. Kinfe who was always generously willing to serve; his readiness and good behavior would like him and give him respect.
The president of Djibouti, in his message, said he would share the Sorrow with his family and his close relatives..
The message president Ismael sent to Prime Minister, Meles expressing his sorrow over the death of Mr. Kinfe, General Manager of Security, Immigration and Refugee Affairs, was broadcasted in Djibouti's mass media..
From Addis Zemen May 15, 2001    .
There have been obstacles not to teach lessons to children in their mother tongue
The decision to teach Non-Oromo children, who live in zones of Oromia regional administration in their native languages, Amharic, as from 1998 academic year onwards have faced obstacles by administrative and educational departments in Debrezeit, Nazareth, and eastern Harerghe, it was disclosed;
This international decree which the United Nations passed on and which the Ethiopian Federal Democratic Republic government also ratified it in its constitution, the authorities didn't want to implement it disallowing the borrowing of texts written in Amharic language, warning teachers not to teach, they are just wasting the children's golden time, according to the reports that reached us;
In 12 primary & junior secondary schools that are found in eastern shoa zone, Nazareth Town, the hidden intrigue done on children of Amharic speakers has become the worst of all, the sources mentioned, the situation that is seen in the town seems to have the inclination to suppress students who have other native languages learn in one Language;
The details of the intrigue done on the children are that attempting to teach them with a language they don't speak as a mother tongue before, with a Latin letter, with teachers who didn't take training, unwillingly through worry and great difficulty, just wasting the children's golden time, the sources disclosed;
Even if in 1997 through a lot of efforts made by parents, and through so many ups and downs, they have made higher officials decide that children learn with their native language, the zonal education department and on the administrative sides this was made not practical, they even started to consider it political upon those individuals who follow these and openly or indirectly problems were made to occur on them, it was disclosed;
At the end of the same year in the schools children who were below 18 years were made to choose the language they would like to learn the coming year, among whom the parents of 1187 chosen Amharic while 542 preferred to learn through Oromifa with Latin alphabets, although this was not made practical, the sources recalled.
Today, it is not with the language the parents chose for their kinds that they learn, but students are assigned at any school where the authorities chose for them, without the consent of parents.
Without making any preparations for the lesson by the pertinent zonal education department officials, the 1998 academic year has started;
In Nazareth No.3 primary and junior secondary school, Mr. Zewdu Debela, the principal of the school at the beginning of the school gathered the school teachers told them that except fourth and eight grade, there' wasn't any teaching books so teachers getting in to other classes have no other work except controlling the students and warned them not to use the former books written in Amharic and forbade the store keeper, to lend these books;
In this way, the children, who are the citizens that would be replacing today' generation, their early youth time is wasted in futility; while teachers, instead of producing productive citizens, are making them unwillingly, burdens of a country, the sources disclosed;
In the mean time, parents in Ada Liben district, Debrezeit town and county-loving elderly people appealed to higher authorities and similarly got acceptance, but the implementing bodies are striving to avert the situation, the report which reached us indicated;
In a meeting held in Debrezeit town on September 4, 1997 at the Hall of Emperor Lebnedengel School, teachers of Oromifa, parents board members an selected Oromo nationals who were expected to protest the proposed idea, participated but this intrigue was exposed, according to the report, the administrative and education bureau officials warned that those who learned in Amharic wouldn't get jobs;
Out of the decree of the United Nations and the constitution that the government approved, saying that children of six and eight should decide the language they would be learning and making them sign was just wrong, said the report, but due to the people's cautious and active participation in the meeting, after a long and tiresome dispute and argument it was decided that parents and children should choose the language, though not without some conspiracy, a fruit was gotten at last, it disclosed;
Although the result was as shown in the table, when parents went to register their children, they told them, "We don't have places for Amharic speakers.
We have places only for Oromia speakers.
We don't have books.
If you don't learn in the Oromifa language, you wouldn't get work ground here.
Go, transfer to another school.
Every precedence to Oromifa, etc...
"By saying such annoying things they made sure that parents become furious, the report disclosed;
The oromifa language that has been given from 1st – 6th grade up to now, is told to be given to higher grades starting from 7th grade from this year on wards in different districts and towns of eastern Harerge, which made many non-Oromo speakers to leave their education, our eastern Ethiopia reporter disclosed; although parents who have the financial capability were able to resolve the problem by sending their kinds to Amharic-speaking schools, parents who have poor, small and meager income had no choice, so they either forced their kinds to learn with the language they don't know or keep them to home, the reporter disclosed quoting the parents;    .
Narrow-racist officials and teachers who strive to chip away at the rights these parents and country-loving citizens, who followed the case up to the end and after many ups and downs, have then respected, should be exposed, reminded some sympathizer citizens and pointed out that parents should not lose hope due to the confusion that was created;
The people and government should struggle this hidden and obvious intrigue enacted upon a generation asked the parents and especially requested the central government and the Oromia Regional Administration which passed on the decision, to take immediate measure.      .
From Tobia November 13, 1997
Preparation is Underway to Pass an Aviation La.
(ENA): In order to enable Ethiopian Investors (to) embark on air transport services, a law that makes this done is in preparation, the Civil Aviation authority disclosed..
The authority disclosed that the aviation law which is to be formulated would put in place legislative decree that enable ownership of airplane, establishment of air ports with rules and regulations they abide by, and how to operate air transport business.
The authority which explains that those who are going to embark on this career as well as those who hare already been giving services need to have law and regulation that they should follow; it is also disclosed that organizing the documents such as separate proclamations, regulations and instructions that are under operation in line with the practical situation of the country and common global practice would have great benefit for the activities of the sector..
Besides, in order to efficiently control and enforce strong punishment resolution upon airplane hijacking, including air brigandage and other different crimes, the presence of the law is mandatory.                        .
According to the statement of the authority, it would help to integrate national and international organizations and bear fruit vis-à-vis searching air plane and rescuing it as well as saving lives and properties at the airport.
The law apart from greatly assisting the air transport business not to have chaotic operating system, it would also keep its service and economic security intact, and it's disclosed. .
While there has not been serious difficulty so far not having aviation rules in Ethiopia, occasional problems were there vis-à-vis search of air plane and rescuing, air security and others.     .
From Addis Zemen August 13, 1997
Editorial
The Multiplicity of Statement Bring About Nothin.
It's known that the All Amhara People's Organization (AAPO) was an organization that was established among the first ones and it had many members in Addis Ababa and at the level of regions.
Apart form this it drew many Ethiopian people through its activities during the first years of its establishment.
The existence of the organization became questionable after its president the late professor Asrat was put behind bars.
After that let alone to continue its struggle with a unified aim and spirit, its members fell apart and fail to do their job and due to this crippled the organization.
Not only did a lot of central committee members go out from the organization, but also youth associations were also dismantled in some places.
The oppositions accused on their part that it's the first deputy president General Nekatebeb who's responsible for this.
On the other hand, the statement recently given by AAPO blamed the oppositions.
We would like to remind that since the multiplicity of statements bring about nothing, in order to maintain the existence of the organization and make its previous strengthened activities continue successfully, it's imperative and have no other resolve to mistakes, negotiate and with a tool of forbearance uniting for a true cause.
From Fiameta November 24, 1999
The Memory of the Brutally Killed Ascetic Fekade Selassie is to be observed tomorro.
The memory of ascetic Fekade Selassie who was killed in cold blood in St. Stephen church on January 9, 1998, is to be colorfully observed tomorrow by Ethiopians both in the country and overseas..
Ascetic Fekade Selassie who was brutally killed by gun shots on Thursday January 9, 1998 and whose funeral rite was conducted on the fourth day at St. Michael church, where the sanctuary of clemency turned out for him a wrath of God, it is exactly 2 years tomorrow since he was inhumanly killed at the presence of the Ark of he Tabernacle as well as religious leaders..
Since he passed away, the Christian congregation has never failed to show its fellowship in religious processions such as prayer for the dead on the third day, up to the annual memorial day; tomorrow, that is January 9, 1999 there will be prayer for the dead at St. Michael church, where as after mass, luncheon will be served for the disabled; Ethiopian abroad, too are said to colorfully observe the 2nd year memorial..
Regarding the prayer for the dead and the luncheon for the program, the congregation has started its preparation long ago, sources disclosed; while all the preparations have been completed in the country, money was sent from abroad for buying oxen, sources indicated..
Similar kind of observance is going to take place overseas, the sources pointed out..
At the time of his death, attempts had been done not to give him a burial place, yet his funeral ceremony finally took place at St. Michael church were it is believed to have no administrative control by the patriarch and have different kind of fellowship; however a statue hasn't been erected as yet due to some problems, but now every preparation is being completed, internal sources explained.
It's to be recalled that due to the assassination of the ascetic, members of ‘Associations of Saints' have still been attending court proceedings.        .
From Fiameta January 8, 1999
Tigray and TPLF – The Political Orbit.
The Time is approaching for the Leadership and Comrades to Evaluate Themselves
Reportage (3)
Situations indicate that the time is nearing for evaluating the role played and the real meaning of the sacrifices that leadership and comrades of TPLF paid in the context to the many years relation they have had with EPLF, EPLF's influence on Ethiopian politics and, in general, the feeling it left on Ethiopia, especially on the people of Tigray.
The third reportage focuses on the issues of the region and views the implication of the relation ship of the two regions.
Whenever Tigray is mentioned her relations with Eritrea can ever be neglected.
The relationship doesn't only emanate from it geographical position but the relations the two parties have had so far.
The bases of their relations were many, but the main ones are Mr. Isayas and Mr. Meles.
The political analysts who evaluate the content of the relationship both from the point of view of Eritrea as well as from Ethiopian perspective, say that both sides used to cooperatively fight the military junta, and after they held power in Addis Ababa and Asmara, they started putting oppositions behind bars and are playing a role in delaying the case of Eritreans living in Addis Ababa not to get resolve.
In a response Mr. Meles gave to one Eritrean newspaper, said, "Our relationship in reality is beyond confederation" while Mr. Isayas stated in Asar, A magazine written in Tigregna language, "Our borders would be meaningless after some time," the message was not obscure.
The Eritrean – Tigrean conferences being conducted time and again in Asmara and Makale, the fact that Ethiopian Civil code is being translated from Amharic to Tigregna, Tigray Development Association covering the cost, the fact that the number of Eritreans officials in Addis Ababa being numerous, the fact that Tigreans could use the Metsewa port, Eritrean consulate being in Tigray and Tigrigna becoming the language of work, all could boil down to proofs for the conception of the would-be established " Tigrean Tigrign" government, it is widely talked over. .
The fact that a huge dam that was being constructed at Tekeze river, twice that of Melka Wakena being under construction is to be seen in relation to this.
Its practicability, however, could incite civil war between the Eritrean lowlanders and highlanders.
The said main conspirators of this plot, Mr. Woldeab Woldemariam, at one time was repeatedly injured and sent out of the country, it was recalled.
With regards to Tigray, except to Mr.  Meles and his few followers, it is expected that it has no special meaning to remaining people of Tigray other than the one held by Ethiopian people.
It won't be acceptable for Tigrean people, too.
The two leaders (Meles and Isayas) are attempting to cover up their in tensions in the pretext of horn of Africa, the situation is being exposed, the opposition is also widening, so they're too worried.
It has been seven years since Eritrea seceded.
Before the secession was official among the controversial issues most of them are still not resolved.
The sides parts of the community who are worried about the relationships that are not properly designed, hold their own outlook; TPLF army is highly involved in this issues.
Because not only willingly but even while fighting against it, it's still allowing Eritrea to secede, so now is looking back to its role..
Although Eritrea is said to demarcate her border and left, there are some agreements which were made by the two sides (Ethiopia and Eritrea) and are not clear to the army or the people, and now that Eritrea is in confrontation due to the mutual agreement the two countries have, a confrontation which the army doesn't like;
Rather than returning its, favor for what has been done to it, EPLF army especially in the borderlines with Tigray, attempting to rise in revolt and wage an a attack made TPLF troops not only furious, but pushed it to put forward questions on the issue to its superior officials, the analysts of the situation say.
TPLF leadership don't have unanimous standpoint in relation to the relationship between Ethiopia and Eritrea.
One side says, "Since we joined EPLF and fought the rest of the Ethiopian people and become victorious, today also we should continue standing with Eritrea."
The said cause which it mentioned is not simply taken from history, it is still trying to suppress the oppositions that are seen at the moment, it prefers to cooperatively work with Eritrea, especially to win over ARDUF which is operating around the two borders and which considers the Afar as belonging to Ethiopia.
In order to strengthen this friendship, EPLF has to be made beneficiary from Ethiopian wealth without any condition; allowing Eritrea to us Ethiopian money in Eritrea for exchange (for the last six years); building a modern condominium for Eritrean consulate office in Tigray; belittling the activity that's going to settle Eritreans' case so that it's not on the public talk, has been functional as a strategy for work relations.
This is not alone..
The team in its interest to elongate EPLF's life span, it has repeatedly put behind bars and sent them out from the country those organizations which oppose EPLF.
However, later the outlook of this side has become defeated and Eritrean's issue has become out of control, these are situations that indicate this..
The other TPLF leadership on its side say, "After we cooperatively fought defeated the military junta, we don't have a remaining mutual agenda."
This side says "we should see Eritrea as a neighboring country while the rest of the Ethiopian people should be seen as Ethiopian..
Eritreans living in Ethiopia, too, on their own free decision could live as Ethiopians or neighboring country nationals..
When the situation at present is evaluated it seems that this outlook is getting acceptance.
The fact that now and them the controlling mechanism conducted in the toll stations in border lines of Eritrea and Ethiopia becoming strengthened, the fact that Eritrean nationals living in Tigray were said to forcefully change their properties in to money, the fact that Ethiopian identity card was forbidden to Eritreans living in Makale and its surroundings, are all to be viewed in this perspective..
These sides who are forced to hold various outlooks are said to be differentiated as these who previously joined the EPLF, those who took their primary level military and political training and even took part in the fighting for a short time and returned to Tigray, and those who directly went to the deserts of Tigray.
Ethiopian and Eritrean Ministers' Mutual Commission annually met in August and signed agreements which were not clear..
Tamerat Layne who used to lead the Commission on Ethiopian side up to last year was ousted from his positions, but then after the meeting discontinued.
This situation amplifies the situation of Mr. Tamerat Layne who was said to be ousted from his post, due to corruption, was in actual facts may have been ousted due to the stand point he took on Eritrea, it is said.
The outlook of Tigrean people, too, is said to have been divided on this issue.
Here, it would be appropriate to mention the complaints Tigreans who live in Addis Ababa raise.
Most of them say,... "If Eritrea claims to be a free country, her citizens, too should be considered foreigners, here..
"Why do they take our work in the government, in business and in renting houses, in the name of Tigrean Speaker?
"They ask.
Others looking in to it deeply say that it has to be amended not from temporary benefits point of view, but from the perspective of putting the situation of citizens in to order through legislation.
At this time, the difference in outlook on this issue between Tigreans who live in Addis Ababa and TPLF has become alarmingly increasing..
Except Tigrean nationals the Addis Ababa dwellers don't raise questions about the illegal relationship of Eritrea and Ethiopia.
The reason for this is the fact that what they have raised earlier in different forms didn't get acceptance..
TPLF listens to people's voice not willingly but when it's obliged to do so, so let it wait till then.
But there are those who attempted to make TPLF accountable for all the difficult situations created in the country, in general.
However, the suggestion of many is that there should be a demarcation between the outlook of TPLF and that of the people of Tigray.
The situation of Eritreans living in Ethiopia seems to be complicated.
Some of them were of anti-unity stand and supporters of EPLF since the time the organization was in the bush..
They didn't realize that the secession of Eritrea means the end of their being Ethiopian.
There were many who gave their support to Eritrea during the time of referendum.
After the independence most of them went to Asmara and wanted to construct a house, establish an organization, wanted to work in their profession, etc and asked the government, but "where ware you during the struggle?
..." was the question they were confronted with and returned shamefully.
Those who haven't contributed to EPLF form their wealth and who stood for unity were take and arrested on the morrow of independence.
As a result, the feelings of the Eritreans, too, were changed.
They started retreating.
At this time, those who have communication with the Eritrean embassy in Addis Ababa are few; those who used to say "we are foreigners" to Ethiopians as a mockery have now started asking their friends for forgiveness.
Besides they are now saying "Let alone being alive, even our corpse doesn't go to Eritrea," they said.
The money they got selling their properties have now been reinvesting it to establish organizations.
Apart from working silently, it's said that they have become the first to pay government taxes.
When most of them speak of their future fate, "...the secession of Eritrea from Ethiopia is intended for the benefit of EPLF, and they don't get any benefit out of it so, we wish if there's some one who could avert he secession,..." they are saying; the other thing that should be seen is the relationship of the two organizations.
TPLF and EPLF that replaced the military junta in Addis Ababa and held power in Addis Ababa and Asmara, though seems to they have had good relationship the growing difference is something that has become widely talked about.
Sides who are calmly following the situation are saying that even from the outset the relationship was based on Meles Zenawi and Isayas Afework is personal and blood ties but it didn't have reliable basis.  .
Even if there's a dream of unity between Tigray and Eritrea in the future, it would be the unity of the two people but not the rest, the sources disclosed.
They underscore the strong feeling the people of Tigray have for its Ethiopian ness.
While the two individuals have been able to cover up the differences us yet, the people of the two regions have, apart from defaming one another, transformed in to military clashes since recently, internal sources pointed out..
"Indian Ocean Newsletter" no.780 under the title "...The difference that has started Widening" presented a wide report with regard to this issue.
The newspaper mentioned that since the difference came as a result of deviation of direction, it would rather widen but not tapered off.   .
Especially, two weeks ago, since the temporary clashes between EPLF and TPLF soldiers surfaced, and for the time being unknown number of casualties (look at the main news) worry and concern reigns in Asmara and Makale towns, it's disclosed.
TPLF government is agitating the people underground against TPLF..
Including those who have been dismissed from EPLF army for various reasons for the last six years, there's a call for everyone who has in one way or another experience with guns. .
The area which the clashes took place, shire on the side of Tigray and Seraye, Gash and Setit districts on the side of Eritrea are found in one direction.
The second area is the connecting zone of Agame district, Afar and Eritrean Danakel district.
The obvious reason mentioned for this clash is border controversy.
The gun fire exchange that was heard especially around Danakil's area started due to a fertile land around a river.
The reason for the aggravation of the situation at Shire occurred while the EPLF was moving to now the grains it had planted, found resistance by TPLF soldiers, reports form western Tigray zone uncovered.
In the mean time, so as to give different name to the clash and to calm down the squabble, the TPLF army that attacked the EPLF army were said as if they had been those ex-TPLF soldiers who separated itself from the leadership.
Meles and Isayas whom the situation was beyond their control, met secretly in Makale and Asmara.
The main agenda of their meeting was said to discuss ways to loosen the tension.
But according to other observers' belief, the main agenda of the meeting was Mr. Isayas brought an assignment form America with regards to Sudan, they said..
According to these observers, the cause to aggravate the conflict between TPLF and EPLF was not only the border tension but also Ethiopia's softening relationship with Sudan, Behind EPLF.
The cause for not conducting the annual Ethiopian and Eritrean Ministers' meeting for the last four years what was led by Tamerat Layne on Ethiopian side, was the widening of their differences, it was told..
As the differences widen, the support of the people for the two leaders has reduced.     .
Although the Eritrean people have great hatred on Mr. Isayas, it couldn't bring out its protest openly due to the security and controlling mechanism.
On Ethiopian side, especially around the people of Tigray and TPLF, Meles' activities so far as well as his blood tie and friendship with Isayas couldn't make him maintain Ethiopia's benefits, so he should be evaluated, this rumor is spreading.
Moreover, there's a feeling that his organization and the responsibility he held in government needs another person, it was said.
In general, there are many who say that the time has approached when the TPLF leadership and comrades who have been sacrificing including their lives, to evaluate themselves and take a stand together with the people of Tigray and generally with the interest of Ethiopians.

Ambassador Sahnun Pressing Eritrea to Accept the Peace Plan.
Since United Nations has great concern and fear that the tension between Ethiopia and Eritrea may develop as an all-out war, the secretary General Kofi Annan sent his special envoy to the region last Tuesday and discussed with Eritrea's President Isayas Afeworki, BBC radio reported..

From Fiameta February 5, 1999
780 Ethiopians Returned to their Country from Sudan
780 Ethiopians who used to live in Sudan as immigrants returned to their country, the Amhara Rehabilitation Development Organization (ARDO) disclosed.
Mr. Mengesha Jatu, Head of the Gondar Immigrants coordination disclosed that the 17th round returnees who came to Gondar via Metema stayed for ten years in Khartoum.
After having stayed for two days, the returnees were given a nine month full-time provision and one thousand ninety Birr for building their financial capacity and would be seen off to their respective regions, the head stated..
ARDO cooperating with the United Nations High Commission for Refugees have been able to return to their country 9, 910 refugees including these ones, he explained and up to the coming the beginning of April, more than 4, 090 Ethiopians would return to their country.
From Addis Zemen March 1, 200.
Notes from Awasa Prison!
(From Dawit Kebede.
March 23
Weeks have passed since a report about the South Ethiopia President's abduction reached our office.
After many meetings and arguments I reached a decision to publish the news..
But before that I called in the president's office..
It was not possible to investigate the situation..
When we called in to some people in Awasa to ask about the abduction, they told us that years have passed since they heard the news years on here say level..
We couldn't go beyond this to investigate the matter..
The news was allowed to be published..
March 24
As soon as the news title "The President had his people abduct a 17 year old girl for him was written on the monitor of the computer, the computer specialist turned his face and gazed at me.
Then, smiling, he put forward his hand.
He said, "OK, good bye" and we shook hands.
After that the details of the report were written..
Tomorrow it will be available for the public..
March 25
After an hour of the news of the president's abduction, the news paper disappeared from the market.
More telephone messages than in the ordinary days started pouring to the office..
While this was going on, a preparation was underway in Awassa town, southern Ethiopia, to send me to prison.
It was then that armed forces were sent to my place to put me behind bars in Awasa prisons..
...The police armed forces at Awasa air port were assigned to keep an eye on Awasa prison..
One division army started patrolling the prison in shifts..
Before he was arrested in this prison, the writer of this news had undergone suffering in Addis Ababa.
Central government and Addis Ababa police were desperately looking for him..
It was in the midst of all these that Southern armed forces conducted a successful abduction.
The story goes like this..
Thursday April 2/98
Suddenly a telephone called..
It was From Addis Ababa Police commission Office..
I was told to reach the police station today..
As soon as I told him I couldn't come with such a hurry notice but I could reach there the next week, the call turned off..
After an hour the telephone rang..
It was from the Federal Central Police..
It was the lieutenant..
He have me a hard and fast order to reach there without wasting time..
Since you told me the charges I was accused of were many,...and since I can't bring bail for all these charges today, I asked him if I could go at another time..
But after the lieutenant insistently told me that I should come immediately and report and only after that I would call my guarantor, the telephone hang.
And I started my immediate journey; to the Central Police..
When I reached there they were in a meeting..
I had to stay for more than 30 minutes and I did.
Later I was given an investigator police and gave my words..
However, unlike the lieutenant's promise, I was obliged to go bail at least calling one guarantor, and give fingerprints..
Lastly, the head of the Central Police Force gave an order on the telephone that I should come to his office..
Starting from around the Central Police up to piazza area I met many journalists.
They were pleased to see me out of the station peacefully..
We stayed together until its dusk.
When I went home, having departed from my friends, in the moon light the conversation I had with top official was reverberating.
"If you must disappear you will..." Even if I said to him "you can't" I was shocked..
Of course, if I must die, I will.  However, I can't die a cowardly death..
When I got home, I understood that situations were different..
I was told that as soon as my leg stepped out, the police came home and ransacked my house.
How could it be? The integration and coordination became a puzzle to me for a while..
Friday April 3
I didn't get time to get into my office..
I was with the two Italian ladies in the evening..
My friend, the artist, was with me.
I introduced them, we spent the evening together..
I saw people holding two torches coming in front of me..
They came closer to me and told me the whole things..
And today the area was surrounded by police cars, armed people and civilians and I was being looked for..
They got in to the house again and ransacked ..
After I heard that I couldn't sleep in the night..
Next I called overseas..
I told them about what's happening and departed..
Having prepared for the next Wednesday last edition, I took some rest.
Saturday April 4
The night hasn't yet given way to the day..
When I went out of my house and looked around, I saw strange civilians in the area..
What I feared happened..
After 5 minutes they controlled me with a force I couldn't tell at present..
They took me with a green car that says "police 196" and drove fast.
This one was a search or kidnap group that was sent from southern Ethiopia..
Although the act was not appropriate, the task of kidnapping was conducted and continued our way to the capital of southern Ethiopia, Awasa..
My biological father was with me and the police officers until shashemene town..
But we didn't go together from shashemene onwards..
We have few minutes remaining before reaching Awasa, a city which is situated 275 kilometers from Addis Ababa.
The journey which we stated in the morning was completed after going through the Addis Ababa and Oromia regions then to black water..
This Black Water is a natural border line that separates Oromia from Southern region..
While the water is naturally black, reflection of light of the sun set of the water given the river a resemblance of blood color.
A flowing black river resembling - - black blood..
When we reached Awasa crossing black river, the police were welcomed..
The southern Ethiopia Justice Office Head Mr. Zerihun came to me adjourning his meeting..
He is young..
But you can read shrewdness in his eyes..
He told me about all the situations..
Especially he's concerned about the air line who was abducted by the president of southern Region, that's why I was abducted (?) from Addis Ababa; although the committed act was unjustified, there was nothing I could do, except being cautioned. .
Before I was arrested in the prison which is found in the police department, I saw people whose hands were tied in chains behind bars and they also saw me entering my room..
Two policemen were arrested in this prison, gave me a welcoming reception. .
But when the Justice Berau Head came again to the cell where I was put, the two policemen went out, we talked about the reasons I was arrested, and related issues..
Where we can agree, we agreed..
But with the rest leave alone to agree ... what I said to him didn't give him sense; what he said to me didn't give me sense..
(In the Evening) I ate dinner with the police officers..
The two police officers had high positions in southern Ethiopia, but later were transferred to some other work, until they were called for question and put behind bars..
I was aware of the people and the town through these police officers..
I was forced to accept imprisonment in southern Ethiopia..
I was told in black and white that unless you told us about the abduction of the president's girl or the person who told you other secrets, we won't release, you we won't leave you.
And I told them I won't be cooperative..
They can't get (what they went) through polite questioning, leave alone through forceful means..
It was a question unheard of and I thought how dare he asked me like this..
Sunday April 5/98
The head of justice Bureau came Sunday morning and started the usual tedious nag..
He shouted at me I talked back to him...after that he left..
After he left the each prisoner as well as the shift worker was talking; they all were talking.
Fortunately, he wouldn't hear to all of these and hence, he is lucky..
Apart from being a day for cleaning today families will come..
Nobody could come from Addis Ababa to visit me..
I was not allowed to talk to my brother-in-low who came from a town few kilometers far from Awasa.
It was only later that I knew I was not allowed to meet any visitor..
The order was given by the young head of Justice Bureau, Zerihun..
Monday April 6
I was called to come to Zerihun's office..
It was a big spacious room the floor of which was covered by a flower-paint rug..
He didn't take up an issue out of the ordinary..
Yet, his present speech was not that of a friend, but of a boss or in authority and, therefore it was mixed with anger and yell..
"Do you say you are a journalist?" he asked me.
"You too claim you're a man of justice and yet put me behind bars without any change" he said.
And so on.
You wrote in your tabloid a person was killed, but where did you see this happened?" asked in vexation..
"To show you evidence I won't take you farther; it would be sufficient to mention a prisoner in chain whom you arrested after you killed his father and mother in this jail," I said, we argued..
For long.
While I couldn't express the whole argument I had with him for hours, he finally allowed me to call to my lawyer counselor in Addis Ababa..
When I went out from his office he gave an order to the police..
That I should stay alone in the cell, and to move the officers to another place..
And it was so as he said.
I remained alone..
In the afternoon they took me to the court..
This was no confusion and queue..
Before I was given another appointment date, I had said what I needed to say to the judge.
How I had been kidnapped and arrived we from Addis Ababa, and about the criminal charges filed against me, how through the office of Prosecutor General, I gave my words to the Addis Ababa Central Police Office and how I went out on bail..
I told him that I cannot be accused twice with one charge, give my words and calling a guarantor twice was out of the legal enactment, and hence, I wouldn't cooperate..
Nevertheless, the court ordered me to appear on April 13 after completion of the investigation. .
I was taken to the police after Department I had gone out from the court..
There I talked with the deputy police commissioner about my case..
At the end of our discussion, he promised according to my request that no one should come to me, and even if one comes to me one is not allowed to enter my class for which I considered it as a peace of mind..
Yet, my staying behind bars has become inevitable..
When the sun was about to set, Head of Justice Bureau came..
Including what I had said to the court, I told him many things..
I told him filled with fury with arrest and persecution their won't yield any result, and I wouldn't cooperate with illegal enactment and he wouldn't escape from being accountable in the future.
Together with my rage, the day couldn't make me feel OK. .
But at night I saw a dream filled with hope..
Since long ago whenever I saw, that in my dream, I missed a train or airplane or car, the plan I had set out then wouldn't be successful; it's assign of a bad omen.   .
Today at night I saw that there was something terrible happening in Addis, and I was in search of a taxi; one taxi came filled up to the brim with people. .
After I ran some distance, the taxi stopped and I boarded in with difficulty..
Therefore, I assumed the coming days to be bright and full of hope..
Many People do not have strong faith in dreams and the like..
However, it is something important to see good dreams in a prison where that there's no hope..
Tuesday April 7
Today it's Id-Al Adha (Arafa) for Muslims and Hosana for Christians. .
And a day of hope for me..
When the sun was about to set, I was looking out of the window from my prison cell..
Excepting the trees, the cars and different people that move here and these, have special meaning for me..
To be a prisoner and stay out of freedom and moving freely are two different things..
And, therefore, the life beyond prison is tempting..
While I was looking outside the prison all the usual car of the head of the office came..
The prisoner who was breathing the outside air freely entered his room with a mixed condition of stability and hurry..
Because the head came.
Closing the door which was ajar, I went to my window waiting for the head of the office that was coming from afar..
After exchanged greetings with the head we kept quiet for a certain time..
"What's up?" I said breaking the ice. .
"Nothing.".
"How about you, didn't you charge your mind?"
"No, I didn't"
"Don't you tell who handover you this secret?"
"First of all the press law doesn't oblige me to tell the source of the news even to the court leave alone to the police..
And you don't get any thing by putting behind bars."
"How?"
"You'd rather not touch the untouchable and aggravate the issue..
When you dig a hole for me I'd the same for you for I'm also human..
You are accountable for improperly using your authority.
If that was not the case I wouldn't get in to the ditch alone. .
Just know this..
I said..
I was right..
After he explained to me there was no pitch that was dug, he brought up those discouraging words.
"Then you won't fly and go like a bird..
Until you reveal the secrets, you'll remain behind bars, up to the time you're fed up..
He said to me..
Since the conversation started to make me laugh, I took it into some kind of joke.
"Hey listen!" I said.
"OK?"
"Let's see it differently..
For instance, I wrote too that the crime was committed by the president and his followers..
This as it is as a professional lawyer why don't you ask them to be requested?" I asked..
I couldn't see his facial expression for my eyes traveled to the sun set while I was talking to him.
But I presume he was looking in to my eyes..
After having talked good and bad, he said "I appreciate your courage"; said out of sarcasm or not, I suspected that he had a shift of attitude..
Yet, he was annoying..
Mentioning about the tabloids that came out with issues pertaining to me these days, he said "We will see the Addis Ababa journalists take you out from here coming by helicopter landing by parachute..
It was usual him to annoy me like that..
Wednesday April 8
I was called and entered the lead of the bureau's office..
He and I read that day's newspapers that wrote about news related to me in that office..
He seemed to have realized that his act of touching the untouchables have now made situations worse..
"Is there any related news?" he asked me.
"The president at first had his girl abducted, now had a journalist abducted" I said to him.
My response seemed to have vexed him as well as made him laugh..
The officers who were at first with me were called but I didn't know what they were told ... whether it was from "shying away" or some other reasons they attempted not to be seen with or talking to me..
The situation was funny..
They told me with fear and jokingly that they could be persecuted if they were seen together with me, let alone conversing.
Even exchanging greeting was not possible.
I don't think they saw even the title of the newspaper which I brought that day let alone reading the news..
God knows what they did to them to have been fearful..
In the evening, the over-hasty security guards (comrades) took the newspaper from me and they read about my imprisonment there, and when they realized that they were reading politics, they stood dried like lot's wife..
That same night an urgent call was made to them and underwent evaluation or criticism..
I could hear from my room the criticism leveled at even those guards whom I gave coffee from the thermos bottle..
Especially they were harshly criticizing him..
"You never know what unusual measures would be taken against you for doing so!" They told him.
I started laughing alone..
And indeed, no one knows what kind of strange measures would be taken against him..
Thursday: - I was accompanied to wash my face..
The comrades used to talk to me freely when we were alone like that moment..
Today Afternoon
I had to negotiate about so many issues..
The first was to publish ruling out the previous news; it would be inevitable to restrain my self from mentioning the other issues.
In the evening, security guards (comrades) from another shift unaware of what it dealt with said, "let's see the newspaper" and start reading, but suddenly didn't know where to put it back..
Among them who read the newspaper un knowingly was the head of the evaluation or criticism..
When he knew it was a political newspaper, he tells like an electric shock..
Either he threw it away or put it somewhere slowly, gazing at people around him as to whether they saw him..
However, they didn't forgive him..
They were arguing in the night..
I started laughing thinking about their situation..
No one knows what kind of strange measures would be taken against him, too..
That day evening
I saw a friend of mine who's abroad..
We were laughing like our olden days, happened to me after I came to the South..
Both of us have one principle of life..
It says "There are as many tests in life..
But look at the greener side of the test, not the negative ones..
This is what we say to each other whenever we're in the midst of trouble..
And hence, now, I started entertaining looking at funny side of life..
Until I go out of this prison there would be some things I could laugh at..
My abduction was by itself very amazing, while I was troubled about the girl's abduction..
(Although there was a lot to be said, I don't have papers to write on..
It would be great if this paper sees publication; I would have liked to talk longer had this been considered sinful and aggravated my imprisonment.).

Ethiopia Called for International Pressure on Eritrea to Accept United Nations Resolution
Ethiopia called for international pressure on Eritrea, last Wednesday to take out her troops he based in Ethiopian regions as soon as possible, reuters news agency stated..
Prime Minister Meles Zenawi also called for both countries on the same day to accept the United Nations resolutions which states that both countries should immediately stop their border clashes.
"The Eritrean authorities haven't expressed their full acceptance to the resolution of the security council of the United Nations," said Meles to reuters.
And when he further explained the strategies of Eritreans, "Rather than fully accepting the organization's resolution, they decided to choose whatever suits them, and as if they took up the main issue they attempt to deliberately skip the key ones.
Reuters quoting the statement of Ethiopian Foreign Ministry detailed that the international community has the responsibility to continue putting pressure on the Eritrean government to take out its troops from Ethiopian locations, based on the proposal Ethiopia presented to the international community, and which was accepted by mediators and later by the organization of African unity..
Last June 28, the African leaders summit meting of the OAU approved with maximum vote the peace plan resolution of the United Nations Security council that could peacefully resolve their border clashes, and calls for both countries to avoid using force and abide by the peace plans.
It was to be recalled earlier that the Eritrean President had ruled out the resolution passed on by the OAU claiming that it basically took up the United States peace plan, while the same resolution was presented to them after having been supported by the Security Council, the Eritrea leadership said they accepted it.
Although the peace plan requires Eritrea to move her army back to where it was before the clash, there's no similar sanction for Ethiopia, the statement said.
"We're not close to peaceful situation; whether we're close to war is determined by the way Eritrea responds to the UN resolution, and when Eritrea leaves the occupied land," said Meles to reuters.
Dignitaries that consist of ministers were sent to Europe the request the international community to put pressure on Eritrea to accept and respect all the Security Council resolutions and take out her armies from the occupied Ethiopian territories, reuter told quoting Mr. Meles.   .
On the other hand, Mr.Meles pointed out that Ethiopia hasn't occupied Eritrean territory, and in fact, TPlF and his EPRDF government had criticisms for letting Eritrea scede from Ethiopia, reuters stated.
Finally, with regards to the last option, if the peaceful means turns out gloomy, Meles said, "If all peaceful means fail, we have the capacity as well as the power to take back our territories.
However, we prefer the peaceful means."
It's we who accepted Eritrea's independence knowing that we would be without ports.
But now the Eritrean leadership who are disseminating concocted stories was unable to convince their people why they hated their real friend, said reuters quoting Meles.
Since the border clash and escalated tension in the area, there have been 3 attempts, one after the other, starting from United States and Ruwandan governments, up to United Nations Security council so as to make both countries to peacefully resolve their problems, declaring ceasefire; Eritrea didn't accept it for all the peaceful resolutions insist on Eritrea's leaving the occupied Ethiopian land.
Diplomats said that both countries can, with a short notice, bring up to 350,000 army, this report said.                     .

During the struggle TPLF camped half of its army from Dedebit in this area and used to produce a lot of vegetable yield, while, on the other hand, EPLF, too used part of the area, but after 1991 it was divided in to two and named, Eritrean Beda, Afar Beda.
So as to have full control of this vegetable land named "Beda", that is the Eritrean Beda and "the Afar Beda" together, Eritrea /EPLF/ camped an army from 1991-1997 on the area.
The EPLF army passed the border and entered Dalol district in the second week of July and kidnapped the executive committee members of district 5, the zone 2 council reported to Afar national administrative government.  .
The president of the region Mr. Ismalel Ali Sero was born in Zone 2 district at Dalol, "Beda",and among the kidnapped council members two of them were his close relatives, and he said from the outset the Eritrean army which camped in Dalol troubled the people of the area, and urged the Ethiopian Federal Democratic government to camp its army at Dalol, and to release the arrested council members.
The council members who were released after two months were in a highly miserable condition, and to calm down the fury of the surrounding area, EPRDF had camped its soldiers at Dalol district, at a place called "Beda" Afar, it was to be recalled.
The Eritrean consulate in Asayita town asked the Afar National Administrative government, Federal government to uproot the EPRDF army from "Bada"..

The Afar people of Beda retaliated.
Since the war didn't calm down, the EPRDF soldiers stood by the side of the Afars and the exchange of gun fire stopped only because it became dark.
On another day, that is on October 3, 1998, another war broke out and in both sides there were injuries and deaths.
Although the Tigrean National Administrative government president Gebru Asrat and one EPLF commander-in-chief stopped the war temporarily, as long as the Eritrean army has a plan to take over "Beda" the war has just started, not ended.
Reliable sources are saying that EPRDF army has a plan not to defend EPLF but to send them away.
It's not to be thought that TPLF would give in "Beda" to EPLF, for she was an ancient place of products and provisions."
The sign for the worsening of the friendship of the two associates in struggle could be seen from Beda, as the saying goes "holding each other at bay."

After he was imprisoned at unknown location in Addis Ababa for a year, Mohammed Mefti was made to attend the conference, unwillingly, and then was sent to prison, it was said.

But Sero said I don't ask a brigand to be released.

The Farmer Discovered Three Improved Teff Seeds
Nazareth (ENA): In his 11years study on selection of Teff seeds in eastern Shoa at three districts, one farmer disclosed that he discovered three seeds that could give better yields..
The Teff Seeds discovered by the farmer is proved by professionals are no less than those best seeds that are found in formal research. .
In the annual crop festival aimed at evaluating the activities of the farmers who were embraced in the extension package, the farmer who discovered the farmer from wolenchiti district, Mr. Sisay Tekle Selassie, explained that the seeds have the capability to reach for harvest in a short time and to withstand drought..
He also pointed out that since 1987 he has been selecting different Teff seeds and completed the gathering work in 1990.
In his two years study test, Mr. Sisay explained that he got more than 20 quintals of yield per hectar, gave these selected seeds to 10 farmers and the cultivated Teff is found in good condition.
The farmer explained that these Teff seeds would give similar yield with the ones discovered at Awash Melkasa Agricultural Research Center..
The farmer named the three new Teff seeds Fitsum, Iyasu and Kidist, after his children and the names have got recognition in the research center and farmers are using them, he disclosed..
He explained that among these seeds of Teff, the one named Fitsum is planted on 3.5 hectar land and it would start sprouting in 30 days..
The Teff seeds have received admiration from professionals who came for a visit from Alemaya Agriculture University, Mr. Sisay told..
For the last three years he has been embraced in the extension package and due to the support rendered from professionals he told that he bought two yoked oxen and built a house with corrugated iron roof.  .
During this crop evaluation festival, the zonal Agriculture Department head, Mr. Getachew Beyene pointed out that the farmer has registered a great result that's no less than that of research centers, by discovering Teff seeds in his own efforts..
Mr. Melese Temesgen, coordinator of National Agricultural Mechanization research section at Awash Melkasa Research Center, on his part explained that the discovery of the three seeds by the farmer through the support of the center have been found in good condition on the tilled land..

From Fiameta April 1, 1998
Editoria.
It calls for a Belief from the Bottom of the Hear.
It has been five years since the existence of the legislation of the free press has become legally approved.
Although a lot could be said about the fact that proclamation 34/85 is not clear and from the angle of the penalty it may bring about on the free press it has its own share of making sure that the foundation and central pillar of democracy, the right to speak and write, and prohibition of censor ship has been legalized.
Side by side the products of the free press even before the press proclamation was decreed, and after, that, are paying heavy sacrifice with regards to the people's right to know, and has contributed one big chapter in the history of our country.
The freedom to speak and write has, once again, been validated. .
For the first time in the history of the country, numerous newspapers and magazines grew and developed people's out look.
The existence of newspapers and magazines by itself is not an end.
What's called press freedom is not the bodily existence of the press products.
Products of the press should publish and disclose all the news that need to reach the public so that the government could work openly and in a legal way.
Performing the work of the free press means, with out government intervention, the journalist delivering news to the public in a responsible feeling and assisting to amend themselves by criticizing the destructive tendencies of the government..
Is the Ethiopian Free Press in a level that could do this?.
No.
The reason it could not do this emanates from the free press itself and especially from EPRDF, gov't from which it claimed "the freedom was gotten by my struggle".
There could be shortage of experience on the side of the free press.
"As a result, it can not be said there aren't any problems out of the ethics of journalism.
This straightforward flaw, however, "the free press is the mouthpiece of oppositions."
The free press is the gathering of the defeated sides.
"Having claimed that there was no need to attack with the sword of propaganda.
Before teaching and correcting, there's no problem that could be resolved by chasing and arresting the free press journalists.
Basically there is no reason a journalist could be arrested claiming for investigation due to press crime, unless he/she is sentenced to imprisonment.
When we analyze the problems of the free press today in our country, we don't see the government in power has a belief from the bottom of the heart from the widening of democracy and strengthening of the free press in our country.
The products of the free press that are seen in Addis Ababa and few towns of the country, if they were intended to show off the democracy, a great intrigue is being made on the democracy.
The people want the government of the people, a government which hears the queries of the people, and a government that works openly and legally.
And to bring about such a government, the people do not have a better tool other than expressing its ideas feely, willingly voting.
For this, the principal forum is the free press.
Those who open a hate-campaign on the free press are the only ones who went to live on the shoulders of the people without the willingness of the people.
It's not without a reason that we say that there's no interest among the current governors to strengthen the free press.        .
On the one hand, the incumbent party and the government structure it controls strengths its own propaganda Medias, it opens a propaganda campaign on the free press which operate on small financial and human resource capability.
From the perspective of the press law and the country's other legislations, while journalists, who committed press crime could be accused and, if found guilty, penalized, they are gathered and put behind bars by investigation departments.                                    .
The Campaign opened by the EPRDF's press "Revolutionary Democracy" recently and the campaign opened against Ethiop, Wenchif, Urji and other newspapers openly shows the not-so-good attitude the government has on the free press.
The sanction befell up on newspapers and magazines not to promote their papers in radio and television, the now-and-then penalty of imprisonment and money upon the editors of free press are not the reflections of good attitude.
According to the very many letters we receive form the public, reading a free press for a government worker may lead him/her to be considered as opposition and even lead to be evaluated.
Especially in the Tigray and Amhara regions the products of the press are read in secret.
It means that the people are made to be out of the democratic process.
The press law itself which has counted five years since its inception should be viewed again from the perspective of constitutional decree.
The EFDR constitution, Article 29 the rights to have a different out look and to express one's ideas freely "could be sanctioned only based on the laws that would be decreed on the principle that the freedom to get access of ideas and information could not be sanctioned by its content of ideas and the result of ideas it may bring about," it has such a forceful expression.
The press law was not amended in line with this principle..
Charges are still filed against newspapers claiming "troubling people's ideas".
The constitution knows the right to get information.
But the free press is forbidden to get government's information.
If the free press is strengthened the beneficiary is not only the public.
Press for the government is a principal method of looking in to itself and take measures of correction.
And a government which doesn't look into itself would eventually lead itself to failure. .
Therefore, government would be the first beneficiary if it evaluates its outlook on the free press and make corrections, at the 5th anniversary of the press proclamation.
Confrontation with the free press and democratic forces wouldn't take anywhere.
Hence, the problems we pointed out at this juncture should be viewed properly.
It is only then that we can say that democracy and free press are believed from the bottom of the heart by the current power holders..
From Tobia October 23, 1997
Message from Fiameta
The Key to control the currently spreading malaria epidemic is to establish its own organization.
Since recently even the highland areas of Ethiopia have been hearts of mosquito and it's not only regrettable to see many people dying but also make historically accountable in the future.
The fact that there was an independent center for malaria-control on a national level with different branches elsewhere that was established based on a research that epidemic would occur in certain temperate Zones and lowland areas, spraying pesticides including with airplane, teaching both victims of malaria and those who aren't infected with it used to play an important role, and as a result, malaria has never been major enemy to Ethiopian people..
As soon as the EPRDF government took power it demolished this office and, in the pretext of restructuring, assigned it to be established in the regional administration giving ay to the scattering of professionals, and the problem was created..
If quick measures are not taken with clear understanding to avert the situation, the number of casualties will escalate. .
Although the people In Gojam, Northern and Eastern Shoa have long become victims of malaria, it won't be a panacea to accuse one another, rather than seeking immediate solution..
To oust the minister of Health from his position or taking measures on others couldn't be a solution..
Malaria epidemic just like locust plague is a campaign that is to be launched nation-wide and continent-wise in combination, not something to be left only for the regions..
So, we recommend that a nation wide malaria control and prevention office be established, and let the urgent task of protection and wiping away of malaria starts.     .
From Fiameta February 19, 1999
Ethiopia Accepted the Lifting of the sanction on Ammunition
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs disclosed that Ethiopia accepted the decision to lift the sanction from getting access to ammunition the day before yesterday which the United Nations had put on Ethiopia and Eritrea..
In a statement the ministry of foreign affairs released yesterday, it said that the fact that the Security Council expressed the sanction from getting access of ammunition which had been put on both countries wouldn't continue pointed out that the sanction is lifted..
The sanction from accessing ammunition the Security Council had put on for the last year reminded Ethiopia that injustice act of being sufferer of aggression, she was equally became victim of the sanction like the aggressor, the statement disclosed.
The statement that was released form the Security Council the day before yesterday reminded that in order to bring about stability in the horn of Africa, both countries should focus on economic development and negotiation rather than buying ammunition and other military activities, yet, Ethiopia, from the very beginning, when aggression was waged against her, believed that the international community would condemn the aggression, and this would happen.    .
The peaceful effort Ethiopia has been making to reverse the situation, not able to call her aggressor an aggressor and the fact that she couldn't execute international law, her effort became futile, the statement disclosed.
However, the lesson that was gotten form the past experience an aggressor should not, in any way, be encouraged, and it is only then that countries who gave precedence for their economic development would, without any impediment, meet their goals, the statement disclosed..
The statement disclosed that it is only then that lasing peace and stability would reign in the continent..
From Addis Zemen May 17, 2001 .
Ethiopia and Eritrean currency are said to be changed on the same date!!
While it has been several months since Eritrean made it official that Ethiopian Birr can be exchanged for "Nakfa", she hasn't made it operational yet.
The associate reports for Fiameta in Asmara quoting some sources said that both currencies would be changed on the same date.
The Eritrean currency has not been changed because Ethiopia hasn't been showing any interest on the issue, said the report quoting Teka Beyene, Eritrean Bank Governor.
But according to the recent agreement it is reported that both parties would change the previous Birr.
Although Eritrea proposed for both currencies to have equal exchange value, Ethiopia proposed that they should conduct commercial transactions with (American) dollar when they deal with big business.
This idea of putting dollar more often than Nakfa in trade troubles Eritrean officials..
The idea that the potential value of Nakfa could become lower as compared to Ethiopian Birr has been held by many people from various quarters.
Eritrean Bank governor Ato Taka Beyene, on his part, said that Eritrean Nakfa would be evaluated at the end of every fiscal year would be discussed upon and measures would be taken.
There are some observers who claim that this means if Nakfa's exchange values deteriorate, Eritreans would have once again a dream of using Ethiopian Birr..
In connection of this it was reported that the future Ethio-Eritrean trade relations would put Nakfa's buying power into question, for Ethiopia doesn't have many items to import from Eritrea.
On the other hand, Nakfa's impact on Ethiopian Birr is very negligible and its power many even be less than the present currencies in Somalia and Djibouti..
Meanwhile, both parties had been conducting continous meetings so as to make the change of the previous currency operational the same day.
Internal sources also suggest that the change may be take place in one of the Saturdays..

From Fiameta September 15, 1999
Sudan Disclosed it is only Sudan and Egypt that have Priority Right on the Use of Abay River..
Sherif Al Tuhami, Sudanese Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources in the statement he gave to Reuters on Monday, said since Sudan and Egypt have for 700 years based their civilizations and agriculture on Abay, they have priority rights with regards to the use of Abay..
The minister who discussed about this issue last Monday with Reuters, stated that his country planned to build hydroelectric dams using Abay water, and for the construction they invited private foreign companies and the begotten product is said to be sold, he pointed out.
For the question Reuter asked him about Ethiopia's interest regarding the equitable share of Abay Rivers, he replied Ethiopia has to put forward he request for discussion and if it's not against the utilization procedure, he said, they'll find ways to cooperate with her..
And by saying so tried to present Ethiopia as if she doesn't have rights..
Asked what if Ethiopia wanted to use more water and took her own measure, Tuhami replied that I don't think Ethiopia would do that..
They know what this may result in..
It's very dangerous, he said..
Ethiopia which is the source of Tikur abay river doesn't know about the agreement Egypt and Sudan made pertaining to the division of water in 1959.
This agreement allocated 55.8 billion cubic meter water to Egypt while Sudan would take 18.5 billion cubic meter water..

Colonel Kassahun Terfe – Editorial Board Member of Fiameta Newspaper

However, since many newspapers, due to different reasons, stopped their work the contribution they were making has discontinued.
Among these Fiameta newspaper was one.

Since the contribution the newspaper made in enlightening people was so great, the press family took the responsibility and started it all over again for they believed that it shouldn't give up and is now showing a good start.

From Fiameta December 30, 1999
A Daily Newspaper which is to be Distributed in Six Countries would start Publication on Monday
The company named "sub-saharan Informer" has completed its preparation to publish a colored daily newspaper that is to make its appearance in six African countries, including Ethiopia..
The English newspaper whose name is said to be "The Sub-Informer" would have 32 pages and is decided to make its distribution 124 thousand copies each day, the company disclosed. .
Sub-sharan Informer which has opened bureau for months in different African countries and have been studying the market, has how laid all the necessary preparations for publications..
According to the information gathered from the organization the publication of the news paper begins in Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Nairobi, Tanzania and Uganda..
The largest number of copies of the newspaper, 37 thousand, would be distributed in Nigeria while the lowest number of publication is 5 thousand which is in Ethiopia..
The content of the newspaper is divided into two: The part where common news is shared among all the countries, and special features prepared especially for each country's consumption would be the other part.
It's disclosed that the company's offices opened in different countries would combine and organize their news through the internet..
When the newspaper publication starts in South Africa, Zimbabwe and Zambia after 8 months, the number of countries where the newspaper would be available rises to nine, and daily distribution of the paper would also rise to double 240 thousand, the company stated its plans.  .
With at least 8 of its pages being colored, the Sub-Saharn Informer would be the first news paper to be available in many African countries..
The cost of advertisement publication the company asks for would be fair and the market price of a newspaper is 3 Birr and 50 cents, the company disclosed.   .
From Addis Admas January 12, 200.
The American Government Signed A 30 Million Birr Agreemen.
Makele:- The American government signed a 30 million Birr agreement yesterday with Tigray National Regional Government and non-government organizations, which operate in the region..
The offered money would be expended on residence houses of Gule Mehada and Irob Districts ruined by the war, health institutions, schools, water projects and to protect the explosives, to give strengthened education on HIV AIDS and for the purchasing of goods, the regional administration disclosed.  .
The aid agreement was signed by American Ambassador to Ethiopia Mr. Tibor Nadze and Tigrean Region Regional Administrative Government social Department Head Dr Solomon Enquay and representatives of Tigray Development Association, the Catholic Aid Service, Cooperation International and Medicine San Frontiers..
Out of the offered money, 16 million Birr would be expended through Tigrean Development Association..
In his speech during this time, Ambassador Tibor Nadze pointed out that the American government has strong relationship with Tigrean people and reminded that earlier his government distributed 167 thousand tons of cereals of foods for those who were displaced from their house and proportions by war and victims of drought, and is now giving aid for execution of development works..
Dr. Solomon Enquacy on his part pointed out that the regional government and non-governmental organizations have been prepared to work together and thanked the American government for the aid it offered.
The displaced people from Gulo Mehada and Irob District people who were present during the aid agreement suggested that even though their invaded homes were freed by the heroic army, the magnitude of looting conducted was so high and the area was enclosed by explosives, they're still living in the bushes and fields, so called for other governments to follow suit..

From Fiameta June 3, 1998
The 50th Anniversary of Addis Ababa Chamber of Commerce was Celebrated with different occasions
The 50th anniversary of the Addis Ababa Chamber of Commerce is being celebrated from November 4, 1998 up to November 14, 1998 with international trade fair symposium and different festivities.
In the 3rd Addis Chamber International Trade Fair which was intended to coincide with the occasion, 181 organizations, local and foreign, predicated and presented their produces, out of which 64 of them were foreign companies.
This trade fair which was believed to play a pivotal role in widening trade and investment, connecting seller and buyer as well as strengthening technological transition, would be open for 12 days from November 4, 1998 onwards.
In relation to this trade fair, an international symposium under the leading aim "making the most of Ethiopian Economic Environment" was held from November 9-10, 1998.
In this symposium that was held in African Economic Commission meeting hall, higher government officials, local and foreign elites and business delegates presented research papers that pointed out the problems and remedies of Ethiopian local and international trade..
Among the papers presented, in order to benefit from international trade and investment, Ethiopia needs political and social stability and it is expected from the government to play a crucial role in strengthening and encouraging the private sector.
